Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.Opportunities like this are pretty rare. We're looking for our first Chief Product & Technology Officer to help make Trade Me a genuine leader in tech. This role brings together three key elements for us
column9: product development, our technical platform and infrastructure, and capturing the opportunity that resides within the deep and far-reaching data that we hold.This person will be part of our Executive team and there is a huge opportunity to make your mark, implement positive change and chart our technical vision and direction.In this role you'll:Be leading product and technology at Trade Me, including leading all the people in our central product and tech teams, and providing a single point of leadership for all things technical.Engender speedy and accurate product delivery across the whole company and across the customer lifecycle, from idea through to release and operational support.Help build data as a competitive advantage for us, through smart use of all the information we have at hand, to craft a better offering for our customers and community.Organise and charter our technical vision and direction, including our infrastructure, data and application architecture, as well as oversight of our use of tech tools and methodologies.Deliver on key technology projects.Get the right people, platforms and processes in place to make us better innovators.Make sure that we're doing everything we should on mobile.Ensure we're up, fast and secure on all our platforms, including overarching responsibility for all aspects of cyber security.Lead change and improvements across your area of remit, including big changes derived from your long-term vision as well as constant day-to-day operational improvements.Represent Trade Me tech both internally and externally to grow our brand as a tech leader.Make things better. Help to improve our culture and Trade Me as a place to work. Act as a calming influence in times of drama, and an agitator for change when we're comfortable.Our ideal person has:Strong leadership experience, as well as good experience running large teams, motivating and dealing with the full gamut of HR scenarios.Lots of great technology leadership, with reasonable breadth across the stack, from infrastructure, platform work and data, through to software development and likely a couple of special-power areas of deep expertise.A good strategist and creative thinker who is commercially astute and easily able to grasp and contribute to our wider business imperatives.A deep and intrinsic understanding of the internet and what works online - you'll be able to help get the most out of our core while pushing into new things.The ability to affect meaningful change across an organisation of several hundred people.A natural curiosity with a demonstrated inclination to try new things. Even better, you'll have an entrepreneurial element in your background.Energy and optimism. While you may not be a full-on extrovert, you'll have the ability to inject energy into your surroundings, and inspire those around you.A focus on solutions and good at balancing strong theory with practical application.Great communication skills and a team player able to gain the respect and trust of people of all different skill-sets and levels of seniority.What we have to offer:This is an exciting, new position that offers the opportunity to make an impact while carving out your own space.At around 500 people we're small enough for you to meaningfully impact the whole business, but we're big enough and have the resources to do great things.We have a great base for you to build from and all of the raw ingredients to deliver something great.You'll work with a bunch of passionate and positive people striving to make things better.Free fruit and as much good coffee as you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Large Corporate brandRolling ContractGreat CBD office locationMy client are looking for an experienced, senior business analyst with strong business process experience, who has delivered and will continue to deliver successful project and business outcomes.The successful applicant will engage in a range of common Business Process Analysis activities (such as process mapping and re-engineering), taking ownership for the planning and delivery of these activities, as well as the necessary communications and reporting that goes along with this role.The successful applicant will join an in-flight project at a critical stage to help support and deliver business process analysis and change, detailed process requirements, gap-analysis with a process lens, and (where possible) support the capture of technical and non-functional requirements alongside a Solution Architect. The primary objective is helping the project team and business successfully implement a new technology solution.The role will be based in Auckland but has a group responsibility, meaning that the business analyst may be required to travel to other sites.Senior stakeholder management experience will be essential, as is business awareness of change management principles. Analysis experience in an enterprise scale environment is crucial and preferably within the hospitality industry although preference will be for candidates with an ERP and/or Supply Chain background.What you will need:- 8+ years experience in business analysis for technology projects including implementation, with a particular focus on business processes- Solid understanding of the process discipline (e.g. value chains, process levels, process hierarchies and classification frameworks such as APQC)- Experience in process methodologies such as BPMN, but not essentially as a tailored methodology has been adopted and will be shared with successful candidate- Strong business process reengineering experience, practiced lean six sigma methodology would be great but not essential- Ability to quickly understand and document complex processes such as those related to supply chain management, inventory and warehouse management, and food and beverage outlets- Proficient in business process design activities to complete business process maps (models or related process documentation) - from design and practical implementation perspectives which incorporate business requirements including business rules and polices, internal controls along with operational effectiveness- Accomplished in the completion of process related sections of functional design documents (FDD)- Solid capability in translating/bridging the process requirements between the business and the technical teams- Skilled in systematically managing process requirements and change through the project lifecycle - Good written and verbal communications, including technical writing - Highly confident at participating in workshop environments with business and system subject matter experts (SMEs) to drive process outcomes and deliverables- Solid experience of working in cross-functional teams e.g. with other BA's (business analysts), change analysts, business SMEs, technical analysts and a System Integrator team members.- Experienced with, or knowledge of, Infrastructure, Integration, Data Migration- Experienced in constructively managing risks and issues resolution - column9: Intergen represents an exceptionally talented group of people that deliver leading edge solutions to clients. We are utterly passionate about this, and we are equally convinced that Intergen is an incredibly rewarding environment to work in.We are known for having exciting projects and a fresh, fun and vibrant culture. We have a number of MVPs working for us around the world and we lead in delivering cutting edge solutions for Microsoft and many other high profile clients - It's a great time to come on board!The JobAs our Solutions Specialist for Dynamics CRM you'll be providing strategic leadership, product advice and expertise with the specialist skills to enable the team and business to create value, maximise growth and drive improving performance of our clients. This involves understanding the client's organisation and enhancing their business through recommending better or more appropriate policies, processes, architectures and technologies. Your job is  based in Wellington, the best little capital in the World with the best coffee, beer and restaurants in NZ!The FitTo fit in with us you will need passion! You'll also need to be highly motivated and client focused. Intergen has a vibrant culture and aims to get the best out of its people so if you like striving to new heights and working with the latest Dynamics 365 Sales and Services solutions then you'll slot right in.The ExperienceAs a Solutions Specialist you will be instrumental in driving the presales messaging, presentations and workshop facilitation to contribute to the growth of Intergen's brand reputation and revenue generation.  You'll have done this sort of thing before and be confident working directly with clients with an aptitude for gaining a thorough understanding of their vision. You will have a deep expertise within your product specialisation (Dynamics CRM) and be responsible for providing thought-leadership and product strategy roadmaps for complex cross-product solutions for our clients. You will be a Microsoft Dynamics evangelist and have the communication skills and capability to present this view to clients, partners and colleagues.  You will have the credibility and experience to own the product relationships with counterparts in Microsoft and other related third party vendors.The BenefitsAside from offering a great job in a fantastic city with a talented team, we offer

column8: Financial Services Focus Agile environment Competitive packageTechspace is renowned for providing top level consulting services and we are now growing our professional services arm with our diverse client base. This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned security consultant to be introduced to a big player in the Financial Services space in a permanent Wellington based role. This position will see you working across the business to influence and identify information security requirements to protect the business from current and emerging treats. You will be a trusted partner of the business guiding and influencing business leaders on security issues, treats and threats.  You will have the opportunity to shape business strategies and consult with IT, Risk and commercial teams to ensure strategies align. To ensure your success in this role it is expected that you will have:•	Several years in information security, risk management, audit or equivalent in large and complex environments complimented by consulting assignments •	A knowledge of international security and risk related standards and frameworks - including SABSA, ISO-27000 series, ISO 3100•	Experience with wireless networking, device and mobile applications •	Solid knowledge of regulatory frameworks related to information security •	Financial services industry experience ideal •	Industry certifications (CISSP, CISM, SABSA) all beneficial •	Experience in an Agile environment and with knowledge of Project Management disciplines advantageous This is an excellent opportunity for a seasoned security professional looking to make their mark in the New Zealand financial services market. If you are interested in hearing more about this opportunity, or if this isn’t quite for you then connecting for future roles please apply now addressing your application to Sarah Welsh, Techspace Professional Services.

Multi award winning organisationLeading financial institution12 month Fixed Term ContractThe Company  Our client is a leading financial institution with an A+ financial strength rating. They have been an industry leader for over 20 years in both their service and their CSR activities.    The Role  The role requires someone who is able to manage and continuously develop our client's digital platforms, E-commerce and self-service capability. A focus on providing and further developing an unparalleled digital experience is a key attribute you will possess.  You will be charged with tasks such as: Developing and maintaining the e-commerce strategy in alignment with business needsDevelop self-service capabilityManage a team of fiveDevelop and implement digital strategiesImprove and enhance the customers experience  Key Requirements  You will be commercially smart, results driven and display a high level of professionalism, ambition and confidentiality at all times. You will have at least 5 years experience in leading and managing a team in a corporate environment and have a minimum NCEA level 2, ideally with an industry qualification.  Additionally, you will possess: A solid understanding of project management methodologiesExperience in an agile environment and/or methodologiesSignificant exposure to e-commerce platform managementThe ability to not only identify and delegate work, but to be able to work autonomously.Exposure to A/B testing principles and Adobe Analytics software reporting.Business acumen and the ability to build develop and maintain a strong relationship with key suppliers, stakeholders and customers.Like to know more?  To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Tom Derbyshire in our Auckland office on +64 9 977 9853.  Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.SK928870AApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

12 Month contract with extensionsImmediate StartNegotiable Day RateBusiness Process Expert, Auckland 12 Month contract $600 - $900 per day Immediate Start  To Apply - send your CV to Ben Haigh, Manager Hays Projects & Business Change ASAP  My client is a large and complex organisation who requires a process expert to lead and drive a programmes of initiatives that re-engineer processes and associated workflows to improve customer outcomes and deliver a lower cost to serve.  You should have a good understanding of process redesign and establishing process frameworks and methodology with very good stakeholder engagement/change management capability.  Key Accountabilities: Leads virtual work teams to design and development solutions that can be passed to the delivery team for deployment and change management, maintaining lead for getting the identified benefits / KPI performance post deployment Scopes, establishes and leads waves of re-engineering focused initiatives to deliver simplification in the customer and business related process and workflowsEngages with the Stakeholders to establish success criteria and define and agree requirements. Actively drives stakeholder / partner engagement ?Leads and deploys relevant and actionable Solutions to change the business (both internally and with partners), actively working with touchpoints to achieve operational simplificationLeads and coaches virtual teams to deliver the expected outcomes on time and in full Key Performance Indicators: Clear plans in place and execution qualitySolution and simplification effectiveness Ideally: LEAN or Six Sigma expertiseVery proficient stakeholder engagement/change managementGood understanding of process redesignProven experience in business discovery activity, analysing process flow, metrics and performance and packaging simplification focused initiatives for development and deploymentAn appropriate tertiary qualification and/or demonstrative "in business" experience in process process/business improvement (e.g. re-engineering type experienceHolistic thinking around E2E process re-engineering and simplification, leading to changes in business process and workflowEstablishing process frameworks and methodology Contact Ben Haigh, Hays Projects and Business Change on 09 377 9244 / ben.haigh@hays.net.nz to learn more.

Auckland, New ZealandA unique opportunity to help develop and grow our Software Development Programs across the world!At the cutting edge of user-controlled end-to-end encryption for cloud storage and communications, Mega has very high standards for software design and execution.In this role you will play an integral role in our software development team, ensuring our users experience the best service and features, efficiently and consistently.A qualification in Computer Science is important, but clarity of thought, rigorous approach to detail and willingness to be flexible for our 24/7 operations is more vital.We have a wide array of technical challenges including work in PHP, Python, C , HTML, app development and are looking for candidates who are confident to design and apply algorithms in a variety of technical environments.Apart from technical skills it is essential you are able to project manage from start to finish - assessing resources, setting action plans and deadlines and keeping everyone on course to ensure deadlines are met.This really is a Mega opportunity to work with a company that is committed to protecting internet citizens across the globe. Successful candidates will be able to live in a country that is truly blessed with beautiful mountains, rivers and beaches as well as a cultural richness and level of safety that few countries enjoy.Mega is searching for the best of the best. We offer a competitive remuneration package as well as assistance with relocation costs and visas.So if you are ready for a challenge and are looking for a fresh start this year, then contact us today!

The opportunity:Be a part of a hyper-growth SaaS startup, founder here in New Zealand. The success of their range of digital products can be put down to the way in which they develop and deliver their code. They believe in having the right process in place to allow multiple releases daily, then letting their teams explore. A flat management structure encourages input from the entire team to ensure a considered approach.   Company profile:So what`s this all about then?  What`s different about them as compared to every other upcoming SaaS deployed product development business on these fair Auckland or NZ shores?  Well funnily enough they are near the water of the viaduct (a stone`s throw from the office). That aside, these guys aim for you to be able to set up, process and execute a mobile payment from `I`ve never used this app before` to `payment paid` in under a minute.  Every ensuing payment will take a hell of a lot less time for you to do.How do they do this?  A very clever combination of knowledge of payment requirements internationally, a highly integrated back-end platform managing and securing the payment systems as well as a beautifully engaging UX that is simplicity to use and interact in.  In addition they make equal feature apps across Android and iOS that are regularly reinvigorated by rapid feature development and releases.The fit:They are looking for is primarily a strong software engineer and developer who embraces the fundamentals and wants to optimize their standard of productivity and output.  Someone who enjoys working in an environment that is fleet-footed and iterative, happy to change a process or tool if there is one better out there.A practical commercial knowledge of, and high proficiency with: - Node.js - React and/or React Native  - Experience in designing and integrating with RESTful services  - Emphasis on writing modular, scalable code  - Continuous Integration/Deployment  - Git, Mercurial or some DCVS  - You`re all about that TDD (Automated testing, stubbing, mocking)  - How to understand, break down and explore a problem This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person. If you`re looking to join a top class organisation with great progression opportunities, send me through your CV as soon as you canApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column1: Senior Java Engineers- Come to Sunny Brisbane!
column8: Here at Console Group, we are building something amazing, something that will help re-imagine the real estate industry across AUS & NZ....we are driven to provide the best product for our customers! We are a market leader for providing Websites, Portals, CRM, Property Management and Trust Accounting solutions to over 4,000 real estate agencies throughout Australasia. We are a passionate group of individuals who achieve and learn together, we have a unified vision and clear roadmap to achieving it. About you:You're an experienced Java developer with an understanding of RESTful design and how great APIs are built.You love working within a talented and high-functioning engineering team.You can own a problem from start to finish, striking a balance between fast delivery and 'the perfect solution'.You embrace change and push yourself to constantly evolve, learning new things and improving your skills.Key Experience:5+ years of Java/J2EE experience in commercial, scalable web applicationsExpert level experience in building scalable, secure RESTful services with deep understanding of microservice designStrong experience with Spring 4+ frameworks: MVC, security, data, etcExpert with testing frameworks: JUnit, Mockito, PowerMockExpert with DB integrations, JPA, PostgreSQL, Hibernate, NoSQL based storesExperience with Unix based systemsExperience with AWS.Moderate experience with Intelij, Jenkins/Hudson CI, Git, GradleExcellent communication skills and the ability to communicate technical principles to non technical audiences.Eagerness to own problems and come up with solutions. Our Tech Stack:Kotlin (Java) microservices written on the Spring.IO frameworkRESTful servicesA thin NodeJS "BFF" layer using express and GraphQLAngularJS 1.5 with a plan to upgrade to 2.0CSS via LESS, with heavy use of Bootstrap.Protractor/Cucumber driven BDD tests, JUnit/Karma based unit testsAll continuously packaged via Jenkins into Docker imagesFull AWS environment from Dev through to Production About us:We are an engineering led culture. We want passionate and analytical engineers who can demonstrate their ability to learn and adapt. Our teams are formed as multi-functional squads that are empowered to deliver increments of production ready software in short cycles.  This is an exciting opportunity offering autonomy and room to grow in the future. We're a growing company with a fun, friendly working culture. To be successful in this environment, individuals need to be self-starters who deliver great work and can thrive with the freedom to fail while striving for successThis is a brilliant role for forward thinking Java Software Engineers who can appreciate the bigger picture of software development and how everything & everyone comes together to build quality product. We are looking for a Network Manager who is a visionary and who is ready to own the network space and lead it into the future. You`ll be a champion of change with an understanding of Agile and how it applies to networking projects. column1: Regional Sales Manager - Business - Spark NZ
column8: Regional Sales Manager - Business - Spark NZIf you are looking for an exciting career with a leading New Zealand company experiencing rapid growth and offering enormous career development opportunities, and have experience leading ICT sales teams, then we want to hear from you.Responsibilities:As Regional Sales Manager in our business channel you will lead a territory to deliver outstanding customer experiences and sales results across a network of local Business hubs.You will be required to establish a culture of high performance across customer facing teams to deliver acquisition & retention targets and customer satisfaction across an existing base.You'll be required to lead from the front with extensive customer facing time and be instrumental in recruitment & coaching.You'll champion the needs of your teams with stakeholders across Spark and channel partners to improve sales & service outcomes.You'll promote Spark's values to help make Spark an awesome place to workKEY ACCOUNTABILITIESReporting to the National Business Hubs & ICT Manager you will form part of the regional management team in Spark Customer Channels. You will lead a partner network in a defined territory and coordinate direct & indirect relationships to achieve sales & service targets.To be considered you will have:You'll have 3+ years' experience in sales & service leadership, including the ability to effectively maintain and influence direct & indirect relationships, key stakeholders and other leadersYou'll have 5+ years' relevant sales experience in ICT, with a proven track record of achievementYou will have excellent collaboration, communication and interpersonal skills with the ability clearly articulate ideas/concepts & effectively present both written & verbal.Strong commercial & analytical skills are a must. You'll have the ability to understand commercial drivers and how they can be used to influence behaviours in channel.You'll be an advocate for our customers and partners and focused on delivering support to enable the front line to excel and deliver outstanding customer interactions.N.B. Whilst we welcome overseas enquires, only applicants who are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can be immediately available for interview in New Zealand will be considered for this advertised position.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Wanted:  An experienced Enterprise Architect who is -•	A multi-tasking, highly focused, tech savvy communicator,•	A dynamic and high energy visionary,•	A problem solverWorking under pressure and operating accurately at high speed is your default setting. You’re a team player who can communicate effectively and with influence.  You will come with a wealth of experience and knowledge of what it takes to operate in a complex and convergent world and you’ll probably already have some flexible needs-based solutions that can be deployed at a moments’ notice.  You will be responsible for •	Ensuring IT projects align with strategic capabilities, target architectures and technology standards•	Design and delivery of cost effective and agile technology solutions•	Using your knowledge of complex enterprise systems and applications, and can be called upon to provide subject matter expertise in multiple areas in the infrastructure domain, including: network, compute, storage, data, cloud and securityFor the right candidate we offer:•	A competitive remuneration package•	Experienced and knowledgeable support systems•	Flexible working arrangementsIf that sounds like you, head to qvgroup.qv.co.nz/vacancies for a copy of the job description and to learn more about us.To discuss this opportunity further, please click on the apply button and send us your contact information with a little bit about you.All applications should include a cover letter and a copy of your CV.Applications for this role close on 31 July, 2017 Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column9: Intergen represents an exceptionally talented group of people that deliver leading edge solutions to clients. We are utterly passionate about this, and we are equally convinced that Intergen is an incredibly rewarding environment to work in.The JobYou will work closely with a small number of key accounts providing leadership and technical expertise to ensure quality solution design in line with the customer's strategic business vision. You will provide governance and leadership to ensure successful solution implementations for Intergen and our clients. You'll work collaboratively with our technology teams and lead cross Practice solution design to meet complex client needs while maintaining focus on the end user is key to success in this role. You will be working in Wellington, New Zealand, also known as the best little capital in the world with the best coffee, beer and food in NZ!The Fit To fit in with us, you will need to be a passionate, motivated and client focused Solution Architect with a strong focus on quality solution design. You will be incredibly ambitious, and as a confident expert in a wide range of technologies you will be at ease presenting to a broad audience and enjoy sharing your knowledge with your peers. The ExperienceYou will have demonstrable experience as a Solution Architect delivering Microsoft Technologies with a strong background in presales and complex solution architecture to meet business needs. You will also show deep expertise in a range of technology specialisations and business trends and be comfortable setting the vision and high-level architecture for our clients. The BenefitsAside from offering a great job in the best city with the best team, we offer free International Travel insurance, additional Parental Package to Government Assistance, banking benefits, health insurance cover, technology purchases at dealer rates - computers, TVs, stereos, electronics! We also offer a corporate cell phone plan all paid for, free fruit, training opportunities, clear career pathways and more!To ApplyWe really want to hear from you, even if it's just to ask some questions about this job, talk about salary, or to have a chat in confidence. Email Chloe, our Recruitment Specialist at chloe.skidmore@intergen.co.nz If you are ready to apply, that is great! Apply with your CV by clicking the apply button below. We will get back to you in writing within 14 days.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

WHAT'S ON OFFER?Fujitsu New Zealand is a world leader in Information Technology solutions and services. Throughout Australia and New Zealand we partner with our customers to consult, design, build, operate and support business solutions. From strategic consulting to application and infrastructure solutions and services, Fujitsu has earned a reputation as the single supplier of choice for many leading corporate and government organisations.We have an opportunity for an experienced professional in the applications space to join an experienced team of Project Managers working on some impressive implementations. This is multi-customer, multi-project work which will involve establishing relationships with key stakeholders and stepping into existing projects initially. A sample of what you might be doing could include projects involving Business Intelligence, MS CRM, Dynamics NAV or Salesforce. You will therefore need to be flexible and agile, in all senses of that word.We are looking for someone who will also be able to take a leadership role in monitoring processes and methodology within the Project team.   WHAT DO WE NEED FROM YOU?To be successful in this role, you will need to have:- Around 10 years of experience in the field of applications development- Proven experience managing enterprise-scale development / delivery projects- Prince2 or PMI qualifications- Agile skills - Experience with delivery of a Commercial-Off-The-Shelf  (COTS) solution such as Dynamics CRM or NAV- Strong Financial management experience- Multi-project delivery experience- Excellent business and customer management skill- Previous experience in delivery of solutions to NZ Government preferredIf you believe you have the required skills, we'd like to hear from you. Please apply on-line, or call Malcolm Dow, Recruitment Manager, on 04 890 9577 for more details. Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: Do you want to help lead government into the digital era?Do you want to help architect the future shape of government and transform the way government uses digital technology?The Chief Executive of the Department of Internal Affairs is also the Government Chief Information Officer (GCIO) and leads the digital transformation of government. Supported by a team of people across the Department, the GCIO's focus is for government to work as one, harnessing the power of digital to make it easy for customers and businesses to access government services.We are looking for an All-of-Government Enterprise Architect, one of five permanent positions reporting to the Government Enterprise Architect within the Department's Service and System Transformation Branch. This role provides thought leadership and advice in all-of-government technology and business architecture, supporting shared government capabilities and guiding agencies' alignment with the government's evolving digital strategy.To be successful in this role you will have high energy and excellent interpersonal skills while being a proven practitioner of Enterprise Architecture in government or the private sector.  You will have a mix of both functional/business and technical experience, and be an expert in agile methods, APIs, innovation centres, co-design, accelerators, and public/private sector partnerships.It would be an advantage if you also have a background in cybersecurity and infrastructure architecture, to maintain a balance of skills in the team, and to guide the evolution of shared digital capabilities and the secure adoption of cloud services.Drawing upon your expertise and relationship skills you'll be a proven leader who's adept at facilitating collective decision making and who possesses the ability to communicate with credibility at the most senior levels of the organisation or and with external stakeholders.In return, you will have a fantastic opportunity to help propel government's digital transformation, recognised internationally as a standout and through New Zealand's leadership as Chair of the "Digital 5" nations and the OECD e-Leaders group.Applications close: Monday 7 August 2017For more information please contact: James Collier on 04 494 5753 or james.collier@dia.govt.nz

Implementation and Solutions ConsultantThe Story:This innovative company has invested in bringing about a long-needed revolution to business in the Payroll and HR Service departments. Pushing the power to view, control and make decisions in real-time for employers and employees alike around productivity measures, staff costs, leave requests and hours completed. A powerful solution has been delivered by a cracking team to a well-established client-base. Now they`re ready to extend existing implementations, integrate with broader systems and deliver new features. And as new clients are on-boarded, the opportunities of ground-up implementation beckon.The Opportunity:Rethink systems and processes, fine-tuned to have the optimal results for the environment. This is where you will come in and be able to stamp your mark as new and existing clients upgrade their solutions. The product itself is a unified web and mobile solution to give a holistic view of all employee information and allowing for analysis at a glance. Work with major existing clients like FedEx, Heinz, Vector, Mitre10 to define the highest value extensions of existing implementations and integrations with surrounding ERP, Accounting and related systems. Define processes, enhancements and deliver features for SaaS customers who outsource their HR operations to the company`s dedicated operations team.Company profile:With a well-established presence here and abroad this software vendor has always been an early adopter of technology, heading to and staying in `the Cloud` in the 90s. From there, on-going success has allowed them to spread their product set and capabilities to cover Payroll automation and HR Services software delivered through browser and Web clients to tens of thousands of people globally.The Role:Develop a deep understanding of the target and existing client businesses and implementations. Understand the challenges they face to understand where business value can be added. Drive the program of work, to deliver the best possible feature set and maintain the momentum of the delivery process. Work with cross functional teams to ensure everyone knows what`s happening and how it will be rolled out.The Fit: - Commercial experience successfully analysing business requirements and processes, implementing products and bringing new features to clients and the broader market - Passion for implementing products that positively effect workplace management - Enthusiasm for complex systems integration - Desire to be part a sea-change in an industry ripe for transformation - Excellent written and oral communication capabilitiesJob reference: REJO-1702-46518Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Do you love what you do but want to be at the forefront of the digital and online product space? We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Project Manager in the digital platform space with an innovative New Zealand brand that is expanding its product suite. Our client is continually evolving with customer demands and so too their suite of products. As a project manager in their team you will be tasked with managing various third party vendors, driving product iterations and will work closely with their product and development teams. What would your day look like? - Managing the critical path to deliver product updates and new features in an agile fashion. - Flesh out the ideas, to form an initial picture of the project, and work out whether they are feasible. - Plan and forecast resourcing demands and deliver outcomes in line with the product roadmap. - Engage and manage stakeholders including managing a number of critical third party vendors. - Managing budgets, financial planning and forecasting. - Working closely with the various UX/UI and product development teams. Who are you? - Naturally, you have strong end to end project management experience including finance, resource, risk and issue management and end to end budget tracking. - You will have a proven track record of delivering projects in an agile fashion across the online, web, and digital space.   - You have a track record of managing challenging third party vendors and can wrangle the toughest stakeholders.There is huge potential for growth and personal development here, so if you are a dynamic and talented individual looking to progress your career whilst working with some smart people, then explore the chance of joining an organisation is truly going places!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: We are looking for a generalist Solution Architect for an enterprise client of ours. Work with a highly successful medium size architecture practice on an interesting array of projects and technologies that have a positive effect on New Zealanders around the country!This organisation is largely a Microsoft stack environment but diverse across various technologies. There is a huge focus on cloud adoption, integration, BI and Data projects. Ideally you will be well adverse to working across a selection of these areas. Preferably your architecture background will be across an assortment of technology and you will be a self-starter with ideally around 5 years` experience as an Architect (will consider 3+ years potentially for strong candidates). When the organisation is buying a product you will strategically think about how they will utilise this to achieve business objectives, along with thinking about the long term technology road map. Buying a software product? How are we going to integrate it with our existing environment? I am also looking for you to be able to demonstrate when you have persuaded someone of your point view. How are you able to maintain peoples` confidence in that view?Do you want to work within an excellent culture and in a tight knit team? Let`s have a chat! Call Saskia Mendez on 027 536 3663 or APPLY NOW!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Work on challenging, high profile projectsLots of autonomy, support and the encouragement to do wellWellington based role, competitive salary and great insurance benefitsDatacom has an excellent reputation for looking after their people, and given our current growth there is plenty of opportunity for skilled professionals. We have grown to be one of Asia Pacific's leading locally-owned IT-based service providers. As a New Zealand-owned company, we have managed to maintain a small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and that buzz you can feel from the moment you meet with us.As part of a team of Solution Architects, you will play a key role in major software development and integration projects with some of our largest clients. You be responsible for the design of the application from a technical perspective to ensure the complete success of the projects and ongoing use of the application.  This involves:Understanding the client's technical environment, existing processes, problems and needsPreferably with .NET or Microsoft product experience e.g. SharePoint, BizTalk or large-scale integration project solution architecture experienceLeading the Requirements Discovery stage, analysing any existing non-functional requirements documentationUnderstanding all aspects of the functional requirements and leading any technical communication, meetings and workshops for this stageProducing drafts of the architecture documents, and managing the review of those documents with the client, achieving approval and signoffReviewing architecture documents with the Datacom project team and ensuring the team has clear understanding of what is expected of themQuality controlBeing a key contact point between the Datacom project team and the client technical team for anything regarding technical design, and identifying any changes in scope to the Project ManagersWhat we are looking for:We need an experienced Solution Architect with solid experience in a large-scale apps environment, with associated complexity of requirements, stakeholders and technology.We look for enthusiastic team players who can rapidly understand the client's needs their technical environment and existing processes, and work out what needs to be done to turn business needs into solutions. We like people who aren't afraid to roll up their sleeves and be involved in the sorting of the problem, not just design with the broad expertise to dive into detail when needed. Most importantly you'll have the confidence to voice your opinions, and take ownership of issues and outcomes.  The ability to produce quality architecture documentation, and lead/manage the review of those documents with the client, achieve approval and signoff is essential. Given the nature of the vendor environment, we'll be looking closely at your ability to navigate around our diverse stakeholders and communicate across a diverse range of people, both internal and external.   We prefer an understanding of the Microsoft technology stack but the focus will be on your overall compatibility with what we've asked for above.What's in it for you?Working on challenging, high profile projectsLots of autonomy, support and the encouragement to do wellCompetitive salary and great insurance benefits (income protection, health and life)Significant professional development and career advancement opportunitiesOur remuneration packages include a full suite of insurance benefits for you and your family, and we offer an interesting stream of work and clients, which allows plenty of growth for future development.This is a full-time, permanent role based in Wellington.If you feel like this role might be for you, please apply on-line. If you want talk to us to find out more, call our recruitment team on 04 472 3386.The recruitment of this role is being managed by Round Peg on behalf of Datacom.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Your new role In this position you will have a variety of duties and responsibilities, such as:Producing Optical Distribution Network (ODN) specifications and guidance to clientsPropose cost effective ODN solutionsMonitor the progress and quality of the ODNCommunicate with the supplier and clients to ensure project delivery What you'll need to succeed In order to be successful for this position, you will ideally have:2 - 4 years experience with Optical Fibre Cable NetworksFamiliar with different access networks such as FTTx, PON, GPON and BPONFamiliar with design tools such as Autocad, Mapinfo or Google EarthExperience in blown fiber solutions What you'll get in return With extension options and an attractive rate, this opportunity is a fantastic chance to progress your career in a Telecommunication environment.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Patch Bowen on 0800429787 or 021837668, or email your CV to patrick.bowen@hays.net.nz If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

You will be getting involved in everything from building on existing and new client relationships to assisting with the pre-sales process, advising on, and designing new digital solutions to giving team's leadership and direction. It is a great chance for someone who is highly self-motivated and keen to seek out new challenges, giving you the opportunity to add a huge amount of value to the company and their clients. You will need to be an excellent communicator and feel confident prototyping and presenting an array of solutions to clients. column9: Intergen represents an exceptionally talented group of people that deliver leading edge solutions to clients. We are utterly passionate about this, and we are equally convinced that Intergen is an incredibly rewarding environment to work in.The JobYou will work closely with clients to understand their business processes and key objectives to design and consult on solutions within Dynamics 365 for Operations which suit their requirements. You'll take ownership for the implementation, configuration and delivery of Dynamics projects. You'll prepare for and conduct Dynamics solutions demos and pre sales presentations. You'll work in partnership with our clients, advising on how to use Dynamics in order to meet their business objectives and achieve agreed timelines. As a core member of the Dynamics Solutions team you'll use your fantastic interpersonal and communication skills to advise and consult on detailed technical integration approaches. This job is based in Auckland, the business hub of New Zealand with great international connections, heaps of events and beautiful beaches.The FitTo fit in with us you will need passion! You'll also need to be highly motivated and client focused. Intergen has a vibrant culture and aims to get the best out of its people so if you like striving to new heights and working with the latest Dynamics 365 for Operations solutions then you'll slot right in.The ExperienceYou will have demonstrable lead consulting experience with an excellent understanding of Microsoft 365 for Operations and best practices, along with knowledge of and experience in Dynamics solutions relating to finance. You will also have gained a strong understanding of wider Microsoft technologies with the ability to present these and their benefits to existing and potential clients. You will enjoy leading or being part of a solution leadership group for enterprise projects or programmes for New Zealand's largest organisations.  You will want to do the job right, not cut corners therefore your focus on quality will be second to none.The BenefitsAside from offering a great job with a talented team, we offer free International Travel insurance, additional Parental Package to Government Assistance, banking benefits, health insurance cover, technology purchases at dealer rates - computers, TVs, stereos, electronics!We also offer a corporate cell phone plan all paid for, free fruit, espresso coffee, training opportunities, career pathways and more!To ApplyWe really want to hear from you, even if it's just to ask some questions about this job, talk about salary, or to have a chat in confidence. Email Chloe, our Recruitment Specialist at chloe.skidmore@intergen.co.nzIf you are ready to apply, that is great! Apply with your CV by clicking the apply button below. We will get back to you in writing within 14 days.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: Get involved with an organisation that will surely provide career investment, with opportunities to grow and develop your skill set.We are after an RPA Developer/Advisor to start immediately on a new pipeline of work.What can we provide you - Paid qualification and career investment, including a professional body membership. - Paid Study Leave - Flexible working hours with opportunities to work from home. - Flexible dress code - 2 days Paid Leave for Charity work of your choice - The ability to purchase 2 extra weeks leave - Discounted health memberships (Gym) - Personal travel and accommodation subsidies - Health and life insurance subsidies  - Opportunities to work in other offices across the globeYou as the successful applicant will be working across a number of different accounts with the responsibility of automating core business processes. These processes will be leveraged through RPA technologies such as Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning tools to improve the overall operations of each account, with the ultimate goal of increasing productivity, profitability of each account. You will enjoy endless opportunities working for an organisation with such integrity, employee investment and wide exposure, both locally and internationally.Working with such a diverse organisation will give you a distinct opportunity to work with market-leading private businesses, public-sector organisations and government agencies to help solve their big issues. In our highly skilled environment, you`ll be enabled by cutting-edge technology and a culture of self-disruption, allowing you to do the best work of your life.What do we need from you  - The ability to produce and develop comprehensive road-mapping techniques/strategy plans across productivity metrics, change management and benefit management. - Implementation experience with Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, WorkFusion and various AI platforms. - Demonstrable use of re-engineering/optimizing business process, with the ability to analyse the appropriate findings. - Clear ability to collaborate with appropriate stakeholders including senior management and executives.We are interested in those who have the confidence to take ownership or accountability for the automation outcomes, change management and benefit management.If you are interested in this position, apply today with your CV and one of our consultants will be in touch.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for multiple Product Delivery Leads to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy, sell and list in our marketplace.The online landscape is changing rapidly, and our world is changing. We're excited about this change and our strategy is very ambitious. We know what we need to achieve and we need your help to understand how to do this. Join us in our aspiration to be the go-to place for e-commerce in New Zealand while delighting our customers.We're looking for top-class leaders who thrive on building and developing their team while delivering outcomes and holding themselves accountable.In the role you'll be:Leading a cross-functional, agile squad that includes developers, testers, designers    and BAs or product managers to discover, define and deliver high-quality products      that solve customer problems and provide real business value.Actively leading your squad across project delivery, product, people, technology         and budget.Using your strong product, technical and people management skills, and excellent      understanding of ecommerce, to achieve business and technical outcomes.Breaking down complex problems with your squad into actionable steps that speed    up launch to market and support experimentation and an ability to fail fast.Who you are:An experienced leader who can motivate software development teams in an             agile, ecommerce, and product-focussed environment.You may currently be a Delivery Manager, Product Manager, Technical Lead or            Project Manager.Energetic, driven and enthusiastic about achieving excellent results.You're a people-leader, and actively grow and support your reports.Able to build strong professional relationships.You understand the trade-offs required when delivering business outcomes without    throwing everything else under the bus. You make the correct prioritisations              between long and short term needs.You've got outstanding communication skills.Someone with strong commercial acumen and numerical agility. You're comfortable    setting solid outcome-centric goals and ensuring we crunch data to produce the          necessary insights.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make      an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our stunning Wellington waterfront building, and we're also          lucky enough to have catered lunch every two weeks.A focus on mentoring - we build you. We take our practices seriously and will              encourage you to be part of a guild where you'll grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Break-out areas, games, slides and office scooters.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for people who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Permanent positionGreat central Auckland location away from busy CBDKnowledge of cloud-based technologyOur client is looking to take on somebody to work with their innovation team and head architects to make sure that they are getting the most out of their cloud technology and architectures, and requires that you are able to migrate and deploy applications from enterprise to public cloud providers, among other things.In this role, you will:- Perform detailed architectural evaluation and risk analysis and develop risk mitigation plans- Review architectures of existing systems and software products to identify reuse and platforming opportunities as well as refactoring to improve quality- Provide technical leadership, guidance, and assistance to development teams in implementation of established architectures and designs- Investigate third-party products and technology frameworks for their applicability and fit- Adapt system and software architectures practices to emerging business and technology demands- Work closely with System Architecture team to define standards and processes for documenting software architectures- Establish and enforce quality standards for cloud software architecturesWhat we require of you:- A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.- A minimum of 5 years' experience in enterprise and full-life cycle software development.- 3 years project experience migrating and deploying cloud based solutions (GCP, Azure or AWS), and architecting, implementing and supporting Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services infrastructure and topologies.- CASP or CISSP certified is preferred- Hands-on work experience with large-scale implementations of Public cloud platforms including Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Core drivers include assisting the business drive out requirements, scoping effort, managing application deployment and implementation as well as project financials.As a Project Manager with at least 5-10 years' experience behind you, you will know how to drive projects forward through top notch planning, forecasting and budgeting and will be able to provide solutions to project roadblocks.At the centre of this tech innovator is a relaxed yet professional environment, what matters is the quality of output not what you wear to work each day. This is a unique opportunity to be involved in international projects that are both challenging and rewarding. There is a good package on offer and an environment that promotes a flexible working style.Apply today to be considered and step into an exciting new role.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

TEAM LEADER. Architectural decision making.A technically driven Team lead in a global company with a homegrown feel. - A focus on Cloud - Analytical reporting backend - Define the technical direction Company ProfileThis global company is focused on continual growth of their product set within the real-time measurements of service management. The point of difference within this company is their ability to harness New Zealand`s style of homegrown ingenuity for their global presence with so far, outstanding success.  Being part of this continued journey and the application of your skills with C# MVC and Cloud Development will bring about a huge shift in this successful business aswell as defining the integration of systems providing decision making in real-time to their clients. Role SnapshotYou`ll be required to lead a self managing team of extraordinary senior C#.Net developers and QA. With a focus on C# and Azure how can the ever changing technical environment be best used to have the most impact of their client base? The answer - with the right leader in place. You`ll be required to liaise and work closely with the CTO and Development Director to assist with the changing requirements of the business and guiding the technical decision making.  Examples of these decisions could be: how to best white box the product`s for continual improvement, what the best toolset is for the pure greenfields development and architecture. The ever changing technology & leadershipHaving a strong background in C# ASP.Net MVC and other Microsoft technologies will assist in your success.The technology that will be used in this role will be defined by you, the direction of the cloud platform to Azure has started and as a default, C# ASP.Net MVC and Angular will be your bread and butter. The ability to learn or bring to the team knowledge of SOA, restful Web APi and other mentoring of edgy technologies and approaches (BDD/TDD) will be helpful. If this sound like you then please submit your application and contact Potentia on 093685111Ref:JBJO-1707-46905Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

The opportunity:Be the linchpin between server side development and design to deliver a highly functional, user-centric solution. Work with a technically gifted team to bring a modern feel to the current solution as it goes from a desktop solution to a web application. You will engage with the design team to ensure the look of the new product will be able to deliver all the of the necessary functionality. This solution is globally used by developers to deliver software solutions demands a highly usable and functional solution.  Company profile:With well-established presence here and abroad this software vendor has always been an early adopter of technology, heading to and staying in `the Cloud` in the 90s. From there, on-going success has allowed them to spread their product set and capabilities to cover easy, intuitive and clever ETL and Data warehouse development.The Story:On meeting the director of Development he talks about bringing about a long-needed revolution to making ETL and Data warehouse development easy. Pushing the power to view, control and make decisions in real-time for stakeholders alike around productivity measures, data visualisation and rich information The idea already begs the question `why hasn`t this happened already?` Because in part it is difficult and the other it takes significant investment. Fortunately here lies the solution to both a cracking team with an established client-base ready to change.The fit (of the ideal candidate): - 5+ years of commercial experience - Strong in HTML5, CSS, Javascript, AngularJS and ReactJS - Have experience in SCRUM/Agile workflow environments - Experience with D3.js or charts.js would be a huge bonus - Having an understanding with Java would be beneficialPlease note that to be considered for this role you will need to hold a valid NZ Work Visa or NZ Residency or NZ Citizenship.This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person. If you`re looking to join a top class organisation with great progression opportunities, send me through your CV as soon as you canApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column9: our typical technical work is a mix of application development, infrastructure as code, architecture, and operations. We've worked hard to make the process of delivering and supporting our code as frictionless as possible.We pride ourselves in our emphasis on security, availability, performance and scalability, our desire to innovate and improve the way we work, and our commitment to writing quality software.Why you should apply for this role:As a member of our team, you'll join us as we build solutions and be a part of guiding wider technology choices at Xero. You'll have a voice in our continuous deployment strategy and our architecture. The team will make sure you have the time and resources you need to craft systems all the way from Application and Infrastructure to Deployment, Operations and Monitoring - we own and build our entire stack.What we're looking for:We're looking for someone who has a passion for technology and continuous improvement and enjoys a collaborative approach to software development.We'd love to talk to you if you have...The desire to see your code all the way through dev -> build -> test -> deploy -> operationsSolid experience with C#, ASP.NET, and engineering best practicesSolid experience with AWS or other cloud servicesExperience with terraform/CloudFormation and with dockerExperience with continuous integration and deployment practicesExperience building and monitoring scalable platformsSome experience working with any or all of Linux, .NET Core, Postgres, Event SourcingAn interest in mentoring junior talent and helping others growNo fear of the command line, automation, and constant changeWhy you should become a Xero!It's a diverse and inclusive environment, with people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you to do the best work of your life. We're a place where innovation and change are not only encouraged but also celebrated. We value our people and want them to enjoy and take pride in their work.We're very supportive of flexible working arrangements and offer a competitive remuneration package including shares and life insurance, in addition to your base salary. We have all the tech company perks like free fruit, espresso coffee, with great breakout spaces, pool, video games, and ping pong tables.If this sounds like a team and company you'd like to be a part of, apply today!

We believe innovation and continuous improvement are key to success. If you do too, read on!Stuff.co.nz is the biggest media website in New Zealand with 2.2 million readers monthly and we are now in need of a skilled DevOps Engineer to join us and help us with various initiatives we're undertaking in 2017.You'll be working alongside a small team of existing engineers doing both new builds for projects as well as supporting existing production platforms which consist of lots of Linux, Varnish, CDNs, AWS and modern automation tools.To succeed in this role, you need to have experience in:Spinning up complex environments inside AWS using a range of Amazon productsDebugging traditional sysadmin Linux problemsModern object oriented programming in Python or Ruby for infrastructure automation tasksConfiguration management systems.But technical skills aren't the be all and end all, we are looking for people who have the right attitude and ability to think clearly under pressure. You'll be pragmatic and favour free, as in freedom software, but able to choose a proprietary solution when it makes sense.Working at NZ's largest multi-media company, you'll need to be business-aware and able to get stuff done across multiple business units.Our contemporary central city offices are fitted out with modern technology and surrounded by great food and coffee locations.If you think you know a lot about Linux, HTTP and networking now, come work for us. We`re searching for a talented Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) for a client The Role:  - As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) you will be responsible for overseeing engineering projects of all kinds. - You`ll work collaboratively with cross-functional teams as well as vendors/partners to build tools that ensure the highly avalibility and security of our big data platforms to enterprise and government customers. You will ideally come from a systems engineering and development background. - You are self-directed and possess the ability to design, implement and release the solutions into production. SREs work side by side with the Qrious Software Developers, Big Data Engineers, and Product Managers to understand problems and develop innovative solutions to meet the our customers` need. - We strive for a deep understanding of the core technologies that are being used while building highly reliable systems and establishing best practices. Our goal is to build a highly automated and self-healing system for the evolving platform build challenges, while continuously improving the existing systems and processes. Our team automates as much as possible, using Open Source tools that are available and are best suited to align to our solution design principal - `Simple is the best`. - Our approach is to deploy the most appropriate technology that is best to solve the problem at hand. This often means that we are often learning from the cutting edge of the Open-Source community or developing our own tools.?Responsibilities:  - Work with Architects to lead design solutions focused on the reliability and scalability of the products we use to succeed in our mission - Work with Product Leads to develop a deep understanding of core components of the Qrious big data platform stacks, thinking through all of the moving pieces and making recommendations on design and configuration for Product Pods - Work with the Pre-sales Architects to design the DevOps/Big Data solutions and support sales demos to clients in the public and private sectors. - Design and develop the future architecture of Qrious Automatation Framework wherever applicable Technologies they use:  - Hadoop (HDFS, Yarn), Spark, Elasticsearch, Hive, Cassandra, Greenplum for distributed data storage - Java, Python, Scala, R and Bash programming languages  - RabbitMQ, Kafka for messaging - Tableau, Qlik for visualisation - DevOps - Ansible, Terraform, Cobbler, CloudFormation for configuration management and orchestration - AWS, VMWare ESX, KVM for virtualization - Docker, Kubernetes Containerization and Orchestration - Pivotal Cloud Foundry, RedHat OpenShift Enterprise for PaaSEssential skills you need:   - 5-10 years minimum experience with systems or software engineering in distributed systems - Strong programing experience in Java, Python, Bash - Database administration skills in HBase, NoSQL, RDBMS e.g. PostgreSQL - Good understanding of hardware including networking, compute and storage - Strong security and privacy knowledge - Agile mindset and methodologies - Ability to work independently and collaborativelyGreat if you have these as well:  - BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent experience - Experience in Big Data technologies (Hadoop / Spark / NoSQL DBs) - AWS or Azure or Cloudera certificationsIf you`re looking to work along side world class colleagues, and global technology partners then this is the place for you. Apply for the role and I`ll be in touch soon after.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Why you would like it:As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will work on a broad scope, be across a multitude of project streams and essentially act as a builder and guardian of BI capability and best-practices in relation to BI, reporting and database management.The opportunity:With the chance to support and improve existing solutions alongside a dynamic team, you will act as the go-to person for major stakeholders to understand how to obtain the BI outcomes they desire. The value you deliver to the product teams could be as large and complex as designing a new database and a BI overlay to that database or as small as implementing a minor layout change in an existing report. You will be the key player in helping build the capability within the team, imparting knowledge where appropriate and ensuring you are adopting repeatable processes. You will also have an eye for insight and advanced analysis, understanding where this could add value to the businessCompany profile:An enterprise-scale household name in New Zealand. Being a business leader by providing innovative solutions and achieving real business advantages for their clients and end-users, across a range of industries throughout New Zealand. With cross-functional teams across the technology landscape, there isn`t much this organisation is not able to handle and with their customers sitting at small, medium and enterprise level, the work is bold, broad and always interesting.  Role snapshot:  - Work with multiple data sets and manage your own priorities to deliver effective BI solutions and eventual insight.  - Work with some of the best in the business, gaining the satisfaction of seeing your knowledge actually making a difference  What we need to see in your background:  - Naturally inquisitive and eager to share/teach stakeholders the value of BI solutions, advanced analytics and research - Comfortable in presenting to a variety of stakeholders, as well as selling the value of BI to seek out further opportunities to work within the business    - Competent BI professional with a high numerical and verbal reasoning capability. Knowledge of Microsoft BI tools is a must, along with an academic qualification relevant to analysis/BI or business - Knowledge and experience with cloud services, MS SharePoint, SSRS, Power BI, Tableau and more - A passion for learning new ways to work with data, an interest in advanced analysis, and a strong understanding of data warehousing principles is also a given  This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person. column8: Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for multiple Product Delivery Leads to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy, sell and list in our marketplace.The online landscape is changing rapidly, and our world is changing. We're excited about this change and our strategy is very ambitious. We know what we need to achieve and we need your help to understand how to do this. Join us in our aspiration to be the go-to place for e-commerce in New Zealand while delighting our customers.We're looking for top-class leaders who thrive on building and developing their team while delivering outcomes and holding themselves accountable.In the role you'll be:Leading a cross-functional, agile squad that includes developers, testers, designers    and BAs or product managers to discover, define and deliver high-quality products      that solve customer problems and provide real business value.Actively leading your squad across project delivery, product, people, technology         and budget.Using your strong product, technical and people management skills, and excellent      understanding of ecommerce, to achieve business and technical outcomes.Breaking down complex problems with your squad into actionable steps that speed    up launch to market and support experimentation and an ability to fail fast.Who you are:An experienced leader who can motivate software development teams in an             agile, ecommerce, and product-focussed environment.You may currently be a Delivery Manager, Product Manager, Technical Lead or            Project Manager.Energetic, driven and enthusiastic about achieving excellent results.You're a people-leader, and actively grow and support your reports.Able to build strong professional relationships.You understand the trade-offs required when delivering business outcomes without    throwing everything else under the bus. You make the correct prioritisations              between long and short term needs.You've got outstanding communication skills.Someone with strong commercial acumen and numerical agility. You're comfortable    setting solid outcome-centric goals and ensuring we crunch data to produce the          necessary insights.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make      an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our stunning Wellington waterfront building, and we're also          lucky enough to have catered lunch every two weeks.A focus on mentoring - we build you. We take our practices seriously and will              encourage you to be part of a guild where you'll grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Break-out areas, games, slides and office scooters.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for people who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.
