The nuts and bolts==============================We’re looking for a full-time Intermediate-to-Senior Frontend developer with over three years experience to join our development team of seven.We’re based in the heart of Newmarket.We have our own Ice cream factory and yup, ice cream is on tap.We’re looking to pay someone between $80,000k - $110,000k per annum.Company Introduction==============================Joy Business Academy (JBA) is the brainchild of some very proud parents, Pride & Joy. Pride & Joy exists to “entrepreneurize the remarkable people amongst today's unemployed and underemployed” (try saying that three times fast!). How do they do that? Well firstly through Joy Ice Cream, an ice cream company that creates mobile ice cream pods for unemployed young people to run their own business.  And they didn’t stop there, instead starting JBA a couple of years later.  JBA is a platform that fights to get people into better work opportunities, by providing online courses that upskill users quickly and connecting them directly with employers.  Joy Business Academy believes every person deserves to have a job they love, and in doing so, is working hard to unleash everyone's hidden potential out into their community.  Our head office is located in the heart of Newmarket. We have a funky ‘tech startup’ work environment where you’ll get to have fun while pushing limitless boundaries. Did we mention we also have an ice cream stand in the office? With ten flavours stocked on the regular. We’re looking for like-minded, authentic, honest and trustworthy entrepreneurs with experience in front end web design to create world-class learning for our remarkable unemployed and underemployed. Job Description==============================We’re looking for a Front-End Web Developer with at least three years experience in a front-end development position who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. What will you be doing?Working in the content team, alongside our course writers (learning instructional designers), our legendary Senior Full Stack Developers and five junior front end developers you will design and execute kick ass platform features fit for the typical web and mobile user in today's world.  We’re looking for a self-starter who are excited to learn and improve their skillset in the ever-evolving medium of the web. The ideal candidate is a creative thinker with experience in user experience definition and user interface design. If you know why UX and UI need to play nicely in the web and mobile application sandbox — then you know our learners.If you understand that creative design and experience design functions live under one roof — then you know us.If you are the evangelist and the architect for the products you work on — then you know our passion.If you see how science and art come together in the design and development of a web application — then you know how we work.If coding world-class web and mobile products is something you eat, sleep, and dream – then you’ll be in good company.Skills, Technical Knowledge And Qualifications?? Extensive knowledge of JavaScript and web technologies including ES6.Solid understanding of Angular and React and its internal workings.Strong HTML5 & CSS3 skills.Experience working with a wide variety of 3rd party API`s.Experience developing rich client side applications that use modern web development frameworks, patterns, and practices.Experience in cross-browser development.Experience in an iterative development process to evolve user-facing features.Ability to write high-performing, reusable code for UI components, including appropriate testing.An interest in learning new technologies, tools and modern workflows.Our Current Technology==============================VueJS 1x with a requirement to move to Angular or React immediately.CSS via SASS, with heavy use of Bootstrap.Laravel 5.2 powered backend with a plan to upgrade to 5.5 when released.RESTful services.Full AWS environment from Dev through to Production.Development and deployment tools such Git, Gulp, NPM and Composer. This stack powers our marketing site, learning platform, 37 courses and our 11 white label customers. Get in touch==============================If you think you fit the bill then let’s talk. If you’re not quite there yet but interested in what we’re doing get in touch anyway - we’re always on a lookout for great people.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

New Zealand Racing Board (NZRB) is a truly diverse business. We're a totally kiwi operation and what we do touches the lives of a great number of people the length and breadth of the country. Operating more than 650 TAB retail outlets and a call centre, as well as our own national television and radio channels, we're an integral part of cities, towns, and communities nationwide. Reporting to the Head of Service Delivery Management in the Technology group, you will manage the relationship, performance and administration of our external Technology Vendors.  Through your successful relationship and negotiation skills you will enhance our strategic partnerships with our vendors to support NZRB's strategies and business needs. Along with stakeholder management you'll be responsible for the financial management with technology vendors, ownership of contract renewals and variations.  We need a strategic thinker and a strong communicator  - you'll be able to articulate complex information in a succinct manner. column8: We believe innovation and continuous improvement are key to success. If you do too, read on!Stuff.co.nz is the biggest media website in New Zealand with 2.2 million readers monthly. column8: Our Xero HQ product team in Auckland are on the lookout for a talented Senior Developer to help us develop our newest and most exciting offering for Accountants and Bookkeepers. Xero Auckland is a great place to work - the hundred or so product team members here can't be wrong! Our Developers build robust and scalable web applications with their beautiful code. We're not a bunch of 'rockstars', but we are a bunch of awesome, diverse humans who love coming into work. Everyone loves it for different reasons.Some love it because they enjoy using the latest tools and techniques to solve real world problems for our 1 Million + and growing rapidly, customers.Other people enjoy working collaboratively in small pods to find the best way to work together and release great code frequently. Some teams release several times a week! Some less often - whatever works best for the problems they're solving.There's also the opportunity to help decide on the tools and approaches we use because at Xero, continuous improvement is something we focus on each and every day. Rapid release cycles, continuous integration and delivery - these might be buzzwords elsewhere, but here at Xero they're our reality.What we're looking for...Someone who enjoys problem solving and wants to make software that has real impact on making lives easier for small business ownersC#/.Net skills. We won't lie, C#/.NET is our language du jour, but if you have a solid technical background in a major programming language we'd still love to talk.Enjoys working in collaborative teams and sharing ideasComfortable around modern web frameworks and patterns, including talking about RESTful concepts.Ability to develop scalable software against large relational databases, specifically SQL Server (and any NoSQL databases).Open to sharing your understanding and experience of working within complex architecture designs that support scalable software solutions.Any interest in JavaScript libraries, specifically ReactJS, will see you adding value across our stack too.So that's all the technical part of your job and why you'd love it. How about the culture? Whether you're after a workplace with a social vibe, or a flexible workplace which understands your family is priority - Xero is all of that and more. Our teams are made up of all kinds of people - the 'love my job and love going home to my family' crew, the 'love my job, but it's ok if I chill by myself at lunchtime' crew, the 'work hard play hard' crew, sports mad people, board game people, craft group people&#x2026
column9: all the people! If you share our values - you'll fit our culture!We're also a big part of the development community and you'll find Xeroes attending and speaking at conferences, hosting meetups or mentoring students. We're really open in our discussions at Xero
column10: from the technical challenges we face to improving diversity and inclusion and even those important things too like where the best sushi in Parnell is.We value our people so, obviously, there's also an awesome package that includes Xero shares and other benefits to make your time here that much more enjoyable.Xero is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, foster innovation and reward success.If you've read all this, are interested and feel you've got most of the above - Apply now!

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.We're currently on the hunt for a User Experience (UX) Researcher to join our Auckland team. In this role, you'll be responsible for delivering user insights to our product teams to create better products and experiences. You'll also be growing the user experience capability and knowledge across the wider Trade Me business and be a UX evangelist.In this role you'll:Work closely with product owners, designers, and the rest of the delivery team to plan the user research that is needed.Conduct the research (alongside the team), analyse, and deliver fast-paced results.Communicate results of research to various teams and help them learn from, and act upon, any findings and recommendations.Work on new strategic initiatives to make customer-centric products.Help the teams to design for members and their core needs from the very start, then deliver customer insights that feed into our business strategy.Design and run workshops.Advocate for changes that improve our user experience, and be a strong voice for our members.Build the UX knowledge of Trade Me staff through coaching, mentoring, training and workshops.Look for opportunities for improving the user experience across the business. Be nosy!Our ideal person has:At least 5 years' experience in a similar role or user research experience.A whole heap of good user research tools and experience up their sleeve like user interviews, user testing, surveys, personas, experience mapping and information architecture.The ability to juggle lots of projects and requirements at once. You'll be a natural at making hard calls on where your time is spent.A positive attitude and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment where things are constantly changing.Awesome communication skills - you'll quickly build good relationships with the people you work with and be ready to insert UX (and yourself) where you can see it is needed.The ability to look for opportunities to experiment with new methods, techniques, learning and iterations.A strong understanding of the web and mobile - you'll get excited about where our industry is heading.A great brain - you'll analyse complex data and identify patterns and insights.What we have to offer:This is an exciting position that offers the opportunity to make an impact while carving out your own space.We have a great base for you to build from and all of the raw ingredients to deliver something great.You'll work with a bunch of passionate and positive people striving to make things better.Free fruit and as much good coffee as you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Deputy Director Service Operations New Zealand Police Royal New Zealand Police College, Porirua Grade 22 $125,545.00 - $169,855.00 Permanent Position Vacancy 579The New Zealand Police Information and Communications Technology Service Centre (ICTSC) are seeking to appoint a Deputy Director: Service Operations to the Technology Operations Group, based at the ICTSC, Royal New Zealand Police College in Porirua. As the Deputy Director: Service Operations, you'll be responsible for the technical delivery and continuity of ICT services required by Police. But this significant senior role is much more than infrastructure - it's about leading the Technology Operations Group support staff to provide capability to the Emergency Services, maintaining the availability of critical networks, and having the ability to rapidly react to a changing environment, always with a view to ensuring that our Policemen and Women have the tools in which to enhance the safety of our community.The Police ICT Service Centre is here to save police officers time, enhance their safety and contribute to making New Zealand a safer community. To prevent crime and crashes, Police needs information delivered to the front line that is reliable and able to be accessed anywhere, anytime. Making this happen is the daily work of our people in the ICT Service Centre. With our operational colleagues and partners we create world leading solutions in mobile, computer aided dispatch, intelligence, networks and security. We are looking for a senior leader that has the right people skills and technical expertise but most importantly share our vision for innovation, partnerships and being part of a positive work environment.This role is responsible for providing leadership, strategy, technical and functional direction for 3rd level support in the areas of

A successful track record as a leader and manager within a large complex ICT technical operations environment

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around 4 million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. This means that the code you write will be in front of all of these people, which is pretty exciting!Trade Me Property is NZ's most popular property site, with more than twice as many Kiwi visitors than any of the competition. We're proud of our ability to connect with consumers and real estate agents alike, and we have exciting plans in the pipeline!To drive our success further, we're on the hunt for a passionate .NET developer to join our Auckland Property Team.What you'll be doing: Working within our Agile environment, you'll get your hands dirty alongside other developers, testers, designers and business analysts.Using your extraordinary skills to develop and test stories with your squad.Contributing to requirements analysis with input to the design and usability of new features.Developing and maintaining regression tests to ensure the Trade Me platform is constantly available.Getting involved in peer reviewing and testing code produced by other developers - we're all about helping each other out.Consistently working towards exceeding system performance targets.Actively working with your team members.Measuring and using data for metrics driven development, A/B testing, and minimum viable experiments.You'll have: 6+ years of experience in similar roles. A degree in computer science or a related field would be desirable.Expert skills in C# and .NET.Experience with SQL Server.You'll have an understanding of SOLID principles and the ability to apply them in your day-to-day work.Experienced with some modern frameworks, like ASP.NET MVC, Knockout, Angular or similar.A problem solver - you'll be able to look at a problem and come up with a bunch of solutions.Awesome organisational skills - you should be comfortable with self-directed work, and be adaptable and able to cope with change.A team player - you're not afraid to pitch in and help others.What we have to offer:This is an exciting new position in the Trade Me Property team and offers the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You will work with a bunch of passionate, positive people who are all striving to make things better.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Building awesome products that are used and well loved by 1 million+ peopleEngaging work with interesting and hard problems to solveExcellent training opportunitiesTrade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running. Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Why you`d like it: - Iconic, heavy-hitting, Enterprise brand - Hefty backlog and landscape of multi-business unit projects  - End-End business analysis, with project management learning - Influence and effect commercial change across the business  - Attractive Salary with Central Auckland parking - Great autonomy, with self-driven accountabilitiesThe Organisation This national icon has touch points with a range of businesses and consumers throughout this fair land. With over 25 years of operation in industry land, the business has gone through steady market growth and more recently has embarked on their biggest operational transformation to date, to meet the needs of rapidly changing global business priorities. The next chapter is to make way for their new path of operations. Massive process change and improvement, and new revenue generation projects will come to fruition from the work over the next two-three years.The roleThis is where you come in. With an opportunity for an organisational intermediate business analyst comes huge responsibility in this organisation. You will work on several small to medium sized projects across multiple business units simultaneously, allowing you to grasp the complete picture of where the business is at and where it is going. So there is a need for someone who is passionate and excellent at eliciting requirements, leading workshops, scoping, documentation, use case creation, and process mapping improvements for those various business units. You`ll deliver to Lean Six Sigma and other iterative project methodologies and be able to deliver the changes and improvements as they unfold on the respective products, services, and internal/external stakeholders. You will also work with IT to ensure that user requirements are translated and understood. What we need to see in your background: - You are flexible, a strong communicator (throughout the organisational levels), and are strong at requirements elicitation - You have at least 4 years experience as a business analyst having worked in a large scale environment, with exposure to project management - You come from the manufacturing, logistics or supply chain background - Preferably experienced with Lean Six Sigma  - Proven experience leading workshops, eliciting requirements, process modelling and documenting processes, from a range of business units - You have been hands-on throughout change management projectsYou need to be in New Zealand now, available for face to face interviews, and you need to have the right to live and work in New Zealand.The RewardsThe organisation offers clear development, a huge variety of projects, an excellent remuneration package and the opportunity to define the business landscape for an industry in the throes of commercial evolution.If this role sounds like you, do not hesitate in applying now or reaching out to  joe@potentia.co.nz / 09 550 8557 for a confidential chat.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

We're looking for a Product Owner to join our DevX team in Wellington. What's DevX? Xero was the first cloud accounting software to open an API to 3rd party developers, and is the leading global platform in the financial web. Over 500 certified app partners and 35K developers build to the API and integrate with Xero, to build unique propositions for our 1M+ SMB customers. For connected app partners, this creates a significant channel to market, gaining exposure to Xero customers via the marketplace, and our 100K+ accounting and bookkeeping partners. Our DevX team look after our API and the experiences our app partners and developers have with Xero.The role:As the Product Owner for the Developer Experience portfolio you'll will drive the vision and roadmap for our developer facing portal, documentation and partner tools. You'll focus on delivering a beautiful user experience, self serve, and automation to make it easier and faster for our partners to build to the API, get certified and grow their customer base in the Xero ecosystem.The day to day:You'll work closely with our engineering pods and take responsibility for managing the team backlog, prioritisation and delivery. As the Product Owner you'll need to have a strong understanding of the requirements of Xero as a business and be able to make clear decisions on prioritisation, minimum viable product and help the team plan and operate effectively so we can deploy our resources to get the best bang for our buck.To do this you'll need to:Deeply understand our customer (Xero developers and app partners) and the Xero businessMap the developer and app partner journey, and deliver a roadmap of product and design enhancements to optimise the journey and improve self serveEnsure Xero developer experience is world classWork closely with key stakeholders in the business and build awesome working relationshipsWork with the team to effectively prioritise feature requests, enhancements and bug fixes into an achievable roadmapMaintain a high level of communication to all interested parties on progressAct as a key member of the developer platform leadership team where you will drive performance, culture and an inspiring environmentWhat we're looking for:Ability to lead, mentor and develop a teamA love for data and data driven decision makingStrong design approach, including user journey mapping and conversion optimisationExcellent communication and networking skills - ability to work with a wide variety of peopleAble to take initiative combined with commitment to continuous improvement and qualityExperience in developing web-based applicationsPassionate about software development and building great user experiencesWhy you should join us!We're a diverse and inclusive environment, with people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you to have fun while you do the best work of your life. We're a place where personal development, innovation, and change are not only encouraged but also celebrated. We value our people and want them to enjoy and take pride in their work.We're very supportive of flexible working arrangements and offer a competitive remuneration package including shares and life insurance, in addition to your base salary. We have all the tech company perks like free fruit, espresso coffee, with great breakout spaces, pool, video games, and ping pong tables. Along with great people, friendly offices, and exciting work.Apply now!

column8: The Company  At Fulton Hogan we work hard to be the best, we give it our all and we take pride in what we do. We know we're only as good as our people, and right now we need more good people like you to join our team! Fulton Hogan is a major civil contracting company, offering clients services in civil contracting, construction, infrastructure maintenance, quarrying and asphalt production and surfacing. We are committed to providing cutting-edge innovative, cost effective solutions for customers and for the community.  The Job  The shared Service Centre is responsible for driving efficiency and accuracy in the business, the BI / MS Full stack Developer will play a key part in this.  This role encompasses the following responsibilities:  Development of new financial and business reports for our report centre.Maintaining and enhancing existing reports in our reports centre.Continual enhancements to our existing bespoke Web Applications.Creating new applications to improve efficiency and reduce our reliance on Excel based solutions.Maintaining the existing Data Warehouse and related jobs.Extending the Data Warehouse when required.Assisting in future reporting and development strategies.The Candidate  The ideal candidate would possess the following:  A minimum of 3 years relevant experience in the IT Industry - Ideally in business intelligence / reporting / software development roles.Excellent skills with commercial experience across the full Microsoft stack including: C#.Net, MSSQL, SSRS and SSIS.A high level of analytical skills in working with financial information and adding value to the information obtained.Great working knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, JQuery, APIs and Web Services.Advanced proficiency in the knowledge and use of the Microsoft Office Suite including VBA.Great communication skills and ability to work well within a team.Ability to prioritise, organise and schedule time critical workloads.Experience with accounting or business reporting would be a real plus.What's in it for you?  Fulton Hogan is a company that is dedicated and passionate about creating a Zero Harm workplace environment. We offer an excellent employee benefit package, as well as on-going training and development opportunities.  If this sounds like the exciting next step in your career, and you are as passionate as we are about producing quality work with an uncompromising attitude towards safety, then apply today at www.fultonhogan.com/careers or alternatively for further information please contact Jessica Berry on 027 899 6251.  Successful applicants will be required to undergo and pass a pre-employment medical and drugs screen.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

We`re looking for a talented Developer with experience using Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) to help our clients` on our mission of delivering world-class experiences and a seamless interaction between technology and users. Is this you?  The role You`ll be familiar with multiple technologies, primarily Adobe Experience Manager, and understand the enterprise environment. You`re able to scope and build features from the backlog plus zap bugs and there`ll be some ad hoc feature creation too. You must also be used to working in a collaborative/cross-functional team environment. Industry leading organisationProfessional supportive teamImmediate start for a developer with a testing bent!Mega is committed to protecting internet citizens across the globe- nearly 80 million users in every country of the world! We are proudly in a period of rapid growth and seeking a Software Developer / Tester on a permanent, full-time basis.At the very foundation of our business, however, lies cutting edge technology. Our aims are high, and we'd be kidding ourselves if we thought we could come even remotely close without a top-calibre, switched on team.Which is where you come in.We are throwing down the gauntlet. If you're ready for a satisfying challenge, opportunities aplenty and the chance to really make a role your own, then we will welcome you with open arms as our new Software Developer / Tester. This is your chance to test existing and new features, enhancements and bug fixed to ensure our product is of a very high standard at all times.The role will also work closely with Mega's support team to answer technical queries and address user problems that require some understanding of the underlying workings of the product, but do not require developer assistance. The position will liaise with Developers to clarify and specify bug reports to ensure its smooth growth.In this role you will:Liaise with the design and development teams to ensure understanding of the initial requirements of features, and the intent and limitations of the approaches Mega has taken towards features within the products.Review new features and improvements against their original requirements, including having an awareness of the interconnectedness of different functions within the product and testing other relevant and related functions.Test and debug technical issues through testing toolsGather and evaluate feedback from users and from that, write bug reports.Give critique and feedback on new features and infrastructure improvements.Give critique and feedback on existing testing processes at all levels within the company.Create and maintain documentation relevant to the testing processTo be successful in this role, you will need to have excellent communication skills both written and verbal as you will be engaging with stakeholders globally. Ideally you will have 3+ years commercial experience testing web applications. You will know just about every trick in the book to put the software under pressure and find everything that could possibly go wrong and be confident enough to feed this back to the Dev team so they can repair this, ready for release.You will be degree qualified with a Bachelor of Computer Science or a Software Testing Certification, having experience working with Java code would see you soar to the top. If you have a Cloud based/Encryption background then we'd especially love to hear about it!We work in an Agile environment, so having worked under this methodology would also be advantageous. Having experience in testing tools such as BrowserStack, Test Rail and Jira / Confluence would show us that you're ready for the challenge.In exchange for your hard work, you'll enjoy a very competitive salary in a supportive (and most-importantly, exciting) work environment. But above all else, in joining Mega, the sky is quite literally the limit.Why delay? Apply now!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Ideally, you will have at least a year of NodeJS and will have come up from a Java development background. You will be an able communicator with experience at times leading projects. What you'll need:- 5+ years developing in Java- Ideally at least 1year experience with NodeJS - Angular front end development experience. - Experience working in an AWS environment - Friendly, approachable attitudeDon't miss this opportunity - APPLY NOW!Please send through CV in Word version.Note: We review all CV's manually and you will be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.  Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand.  If you are not an NZ Citizen, you must have the right of permanent residence or a work permit.Ref# LD_475095Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

IT ManagerIf you have a 'can do' attitude, have the ability to build strong relationships with a high level of technical ICT competence then we would love to hear from you.•Great CBD location•Ability to work independently and effectively under pressure in a complex, fast paced environment•Free train travel on the network for staff ABOUT TRANSDEVTransdev is a world leader in the operation of passenger transport services. Operating in 19 countries around the world, with 83,000 employees and managing 41,000 vehicles we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.At Transdev, we believe public transport plays an important part in a how a city comes to life. Our day-to-day work influences our families, friends and future generations where they live, work and playTransdev Auckland is contracted to Auckland Transport to operate passenger rail services in Auckland. The Auckland train network carries more than 19 million passengers per annum, is serviced by more than 660 Transdev staff, and operates more than 2,800 services each week. It's our vision to be the best – to be Australasia's acknowledged passenger transport leader. We strive to be the best in everything we do. ABOUT THE ROLEWorking closely with members of the Transdev Australasian team, you will drive projects to completion within deadlines, ensuring outcomes are met and engaging stakeholders as required.  Your collaborative approach and strong influencing skills will be key to your success in this role.This is a full-time role based at our Head Office in Auckland and reports to the Manager – Finance as well as the CIO – Transdev Australasia. Flexibility is also required to work outside of business hours when necessary. ABOUT YOU•Proficiency in major Microsoft technologies and operating systems (both client and server).•ICTIL qualification, with exhibits a high degree of ownership in the ICTIL context.•Sound networking knowledge (TCP/IP, and networking technologies)•Strong Database fundamentals and a working knowledge of SQL.•10 + years’ ICT industry experience with extensive experience in an ICT management position and managing a technical team.•5+ years Contracts and Vendor management with procurement experience.•Business qualification/demonstrable understanding of financial accounting principles and budgeting.•Project management qualification and experience delivering on multiple parallel projects•A high degree of honesty and integrity, with the ability to handle and respect confidential information.•High degree of technical ICT competence to assist support teams as required.•Ability to build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders, with a proven track record for customer service.•Strong understanding of current trends in the application of technology for business improvement.•Ability to work cross departmentally, with technical and non-technical staff.•Ability to translate user requirements into technical deliverables.•Sound analytical and problem solving skills.•Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Highly motivated and pro-active and demonstrated ability to increase skills and develop with expected business growth. THE BENEFITSIn return, we offer competitive pay and benefits and a positive culture that embraces diversity and employee feedback. We genuinely invest in our people and the work you carry out at Transdev touches the lives of your family, friends and future generations alike. Working in a growing, global business will provide diverse career experiences for you to make your mark, push boundaries and reach your maximum potential.OUR VALUES                                                                  As an equal opportunity employer, we aim to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve. With values reflecting safety, commitment, partnership, passion and performance, we collaborate to support our most valuable assets, our customers.NEXT STEPSTo find out more about careers with us, our benefits and the opportunities we offer, visit our careers page http://www.transdev.com.au/careers#work-with-usIf you're as passionate about delivering unparalleled service as we are then click the ‘Apply now’ button and you’ll be taken to our Transdev website to complete your application form online.Applications close on 1st August 2017A full position description is available by contacting jobs@transdev.co.nzAt Transdev our recruitment process may include pre-employment checks such as medicals, drug & alcohol testing, psychometric testing, police checks, licence checks and right to work checks. For more information http://www.transdev.com.au/careers#recruitment-processRef: 494667Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for multiple developers to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy, sell and list in our marketplace.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for smart and adaptable iOS Developers who thrive in teams. We care less about the specific technologies that you already know, it's your aptitude, passion, and potential that we love and want to see shine through.In the role you'll be:Working on the fabulous Trade Me iOS app in a rapid-fire, fully-Agile squad alongside other developers, designers, testers and business analysts.Helping to define and refine our mobile features.Getting your hands dirty with coding and championing all things iOS.Getting stuck into the official API Wrappers, code reviews and helping to punt up ideas for new products. We run frequent research and development events which will enable to you to experiment with new platforms and tools.Doing basically anything and everything iOS related and working with passionate folk doing the same.Who are you?You've got experience working in a fast-paced, results-oriented, API/mobile-based development environment and understand what's required to get the job done.You'll constantly be looking for learning opportunities, both to grow your already formidable talent and also to share your mad iOS skills with others.You want to ship code all the time and you get nervous if your code is sitting in a development branch for too long. You're happiest when your work is out in the wild.Passionate - you love all things iOS and you're busting to be part of a team with a focus on the needs of the end-user. You're brimming with bright ideas and a plan to bring them to light!What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our exciting Christchurch office which is growing.A focus on mentoring. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.A comprehensive list of training programmes to support your personal development.Free fruit and great coffee.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Strong Sitecore BackgroundImmediate StartOverseas Experience consideredResponsibilities:This is an opportunity for you to work alongside some of the best in the industry, learning and building some amazing products.Working in cross functional mature agile teams, you will lead and deliver a number of leading Sitecore solutions, in a fast-paced mature agile environment.You are currently either a Sitecore Specialist or Lead Developer, with experience working in fast-paced agile environments. You will be well versed in building customer focused, high availability web products, from architecture, estimating, building through to delivery.Key Skills / Experience:Strong .NET and Sitecore backgroundDevelopment for Sitecore CMS 8.1 and similar versionsImplementation and customization of Web Forms for Marketers, EXM, PXM and FXM modulesEnterprise level architecture experienceC#, ASP.NET, MVC, Web APIStrong UI SkillsAgile experienceStrong communicatorContinuous learning mindset - Keep yourself up to date with industry, read blogs, industry news, build apps, attend meet-ups etcThis is your chance to work for an industry leading company, with an awesome work life balance, great salary and benefits, and amazing career opportunities. There are both Senior and Lead roles available. This is your chance to work with the best in the business. To apply online, please click on the link below. Or, if you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Enoch George on + 64 9 2223784, enoch.george@davidsonwp.com quoting ref no. JO-2554247. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.comApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.We're currently on the hunt for an experienced System Engineer to join our fantastic Face team. We need someone to ensure the smooth running of the platforms that host our customer applications and our Umbraco websites.In this role you'll be:Maintaining, monitoring and enhancing the Linux server infrastructure for our customer applications, including storage utilisation, security permissions, patch remediation, performance monitoring, backups and recovery, service packs and operating system upgrades.Assisting in the migration of all the customer sites to the Trade Me cloud platform.Working with our development teams to upgrade all the Umbraco sites to the latest version when required, as well as ensuring future upgrades are scheduled and managed.Looking after ongoing improvements to the Umbraco platform through reporting, alerting and monitoring.Working with the Development team to implement an automated deployment process.Ensuring all our sites remain secure, as well as conducting regular security reviews.Owning hardware procurement, including obtaining quotes, liaising with our end customer, installations and configuration of the hardware (in conjunction with the Infrastructure team).Preparing and maintaining documentation required by our customers in relation to hardware and infrastructure.Creating and scheduling scripts for database updates and regular procedures for the customer sites.Looking after ongoing patch management and upgrades of server platforms.Part of an on-call roster for after hours support.Dealing directly with end customers from time to time.You will have:At least 5 years' experience in a similar role or field, and ideally experience in both Linux and Windows environments.An understanding and preferably experience working with virtualised platforms and cloud technology.Understanding of backup and disaster recovery processes.The ability to scope-out work, as well as providing accurate estimates of the time required to complete that work.The ability to self-manage. While you will be part of the team, this is very much an autonomous role.A genuine interest in IT and technology.What we have to offer:This is an exciting position that offers the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You will work with a bunch of passionate, positive people who are all striving to make things better!Free fruit and as much good coffee as you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

CompanyA global organisation with a distinctly local feel, this organisation has been delivering research and cyber security solutions to enterprise level clients for a number of years. Having adapted to the ever changing landscape that is cyber security, this organisation has recently become known for its uniqueness of its offering, providing the insight to allow businesses to be proactive and for customers to have a greater understanding of cyber security. The Opportunity:Whilst the market has been doing multiple U-turns in this space, there is clearly a need for consultancies like this to continue delivering effective business strategy through tangible and evidence-based security solutions. As a result of new work and new clients joining this organisation`s journey, there is a need for a smart and hungry cyber security analyst to come on board and assist with the delivery of this vision. You will be joining an experienced and high functioning team of experts who will mentor you throughout your development, and because of this, we can only consider the best security analysts/consultants out there. Your Background: - You have worked for a solutions provider consulting to external clients - A solid working understanding of IT infrastructure: Networking, Databases, Linux & Windows - 5 years experience working in Cyber Security specifically carrying out such tasks as.....       ** Security risk strategy       ** Risk assessments and policy initiatives       ** Performing technical security reviews and audits       ** Advising clients across threat detection, threat intelligence, cyber defence, and incident response - A passion for consulting and delivering a premium and dedicated service is definitely a given! - Excellent communications skills - written and verbalThis is a fantastic opportunity for the right person. If you`re looking to join a top class organisation with great development opportunities, send me through your CV as soon as you can.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for more Android developers to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy and sell in our marketplace.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for smart and adaptable Android Developers who thrive in teams. We care less about the specific technologies that you already know, it's your aptitude, passion, and potential that we love and want to see shine through.The Trade Me Android app is one of New Zealand's most used apps and this is your chance to make a big difference in the lives of hundreds of thousands of Kiwis.Our app is native and makes use of a wide range of APIs. You'll play an integral part in shaping the roadmap and implementation of the exciting next steps for Android on behalf of our growing user base.In the role you'll be:Working closely with other mobile developers, designers and testers within our awesome Agile environment. We are looking for a talented Senior ICT Business Analyst contractor with around five or more years' experience to join our team that supports the health services across Wellington, Hutt Valley and Wairarapa for a fixed 12 month contract.You will provide business analysis including requirements gathering and process design to projects as well as enhancements and changes that are done as business as usual. You will have strong skills in business analysis, problem solving, facilitation and documentation. You must have demonstrated experience using best practices in business analysis. You will have proven experience in working closely with project managers, developers, testers, vendors and the wider business to ensure that the DHB's requirements are clearly elicited, analysed and documented to be delivered by ICT projects.The successful applicant will need to demonstrate:Experience and expertise in requirements gathering and analysis,      facilitating workshops, mapping process and information flowsExperience with stakeholder management
column9: a proven      ability to negotiate with, influence and build consensus with a wide range      of stakeholders, including senior managementAbility to produce high quality documentation      including use cases, process flows, high level and detailed requirementsWell-developed analytical skills with the ability      to think strategically and laterallyA self-motivated, positive, "can do"      attitude and a drive to understand and explain requirements. You will also      be highly motivated, outcome focused and take initiative in completing      deliverablesHigh proficiency in professional English and      excellent communication skills - both verbal and writtenExperience working through the SDLC and      experience of different project and development methodologies including      Waterfall and AgileA relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent      knowledge gained by experienceHealthcare sector experience, experience in user experience and user interface design, and formal qualifications (CBAP, CCBA) would be an advantage.This position will be primarily based in Wellington but some travel to Wairarapa and some co-location with project teams based in Lower Hutt may be required.Candidates will be contacted by the CCDHB if they are successfully shortlisted. Referees will only be contacted with candidates' permission during the selection process. Unsuccessful applicants will be notified by email if they were not successful for an interview.Applications will not be accepted via email, applications will only be accepted via the CCDHB careers portal and Seek. All candidates applying for any of our current vacancies must complete an online CCDHB application form by clicking the 'Apply Now' button (applications for positions will not be accepted unless accompanied by one).Applications close on 01 Aug 2017. Please submit your CV and cover letter in Word or PDF format. For further information on this role, please email recruitment@ccdhb.org.nz and please indicate vacancy number and job title in the subject line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: VizExplorer is a global software development company with offices in Wellington, San Diego and Las Vegas. We deliver state-of-the-art advanced Operational Intelligence software that turns large volumes of data into easy to understand and easy-to-use Super Graphics.We have an opportunity for an experienced Technical Automated Tester. Based here in Wellington and working with our customers around the world. You will have the opportunity to work in a highly collaborative and fast-paced team. Utilising your strong technical skills this is an environment where your skills will be highly valued.Our testing team works closely with the development and delivery team. This is a very technical environment so programming experience is vital. In this role, you will have the ability to grow along with the company and to continue to develop your skills.DUTIES:Designing test plans and test scenariosWriting automated acceptance tests for the front end and back endWriting automated performance testsExecute the automated functional and performance regression tests with comprehensive reportsCreating testing tools and frameworks and maintaining existing onesWriting test documentation and test automation guidelinesReviewing and researching testing tools and theoryCreation and maintenance of testing environments, continuous integration scripts and pipelines assisted by the delivery teamReviewing business requirements and feature definitionsMaintenance of the Test Tracking SystemREQUIREMENTS:Experience developing automated test scripts for the front end, restful APIs or service oriented back endObject Oriented Programming with languages such as Java, Ruby. Groovy etc.JavaScript experienceScripting skills in Bash, Shell, or other scripting languages such as Python desirableUnderstanding of SQL and relational databasesUnderstanding of NoSQL and other Database technologies desirableExperience with version control systems such as GitBasic Continuous Integration server administration experience with Jenkins, GitLab CI Travis CI etc.Ability to learn new technologies and frameworks easilyA relevant university degree and/or equivalent experienceStrong written and verbal communication

A market leading technology agency creating strategic solutions for local and global clients is looking for a Database Administrator to join a growing IT operations team in Auckland CBD. You'll be part of a large multi-international organization working with an array of database platforms and applications. You'll be responsible for ensuring the performance, availability, and security of clusters of NoSQL instances. In addition, you'll be responsible for orchestrating upgrades, backups and provisioning of database instances. You'll also be responsible for orchestrating upgrades, backups, and provisioning of database instances. It is a challenging role within a rapidly expanding company with a great work ethos who value and develop their employees The company provides a competitive salary, great benefits and a flexible working environment. Responsibilities:Design, deploy and support high available and scalable distributed NoSQL database for high volume transactionsMaintain and develop data models, structures, and procedures to ensure the integrity of all database componentsEnsure performance, security, and availability of 24x7 mission critical databasesSetup replication across multiple geographically stretched data centersPrepare crystal clear documentations and specifications including database design and coding standardsHandle common database procedures, such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, deployments etc.Profile server resource usage, optimize and tweak as necessaryEnsure Change management process is followedProvide 24x7 support during on-call support rotation scheduleCollaborate with other team members and business stakeholders Skills and Qualifications:Experience with NoSQL. You'll be working with Cassandra but you're welcome to apply if you have experience with any of the following: MongoDB, CouchDB, Neo4J, Redis, HBase, Apache Hadoop Base8+ years overall IT experience, with 2+ years' experience on any of the following:Development using Java based technologiesSystem admin of Linux based servers or Database Administrator of non-relational databasesCommercial experience with scripting languages or programming frameworksProficiency in database management dutiesUp to date knowledge of de-facto standards and best practicesAbility to plan resource requirements from high level specificationsProficient understanding of code versioning tools such as GIT, SVN etcFamiliar with tools like Puppet, Ansible etc.Knowledge of *nix tuning would be helpfulStrong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a teamExcellent English verbal and written communication skillsPrevious Training or Certifications would be a plusUndergraduate degree in Computer Science or equivalent education On offer is the opportunity to take on a challenging role within a rapidly expanding company with a great work ethos who value and develop their employees. Follow the link to apply today or call Catherine Larsen on +64 27 204 4286 for a confidential discussion.

Are you passionate about human-centred design and innovation to drive business growth that matters?Who you are—the expertise we are looking for...You are a passionate business analyst with three-to-five years’ experience working with complex design challenges and system transformations. You’re focussed on creating new systems and services that deliver exceptional customer and staff experiences.  You can deploy a great toolkit of processes and techniques including user experience modelling, service blueprinting, process mapping, business requirements mining, etc. You’re a strong critical thinker, you know how to ask the right questions to ensure we’re focussing on what our clients are trying to achieve, and be able to design and tailor solutions to fit. You have experience in a broad range of challenges across a wide range of contexts— service design, government innovation, legislative-driven change, social innovation, etc. You have strong solution design experience, such as designing funding models, operational business processes, organisation design and governance systems. You put the user at the centre when you develop these, using people insight from quantitative and qualitative data sources.Your expertise is in seeing projects through to delivery.You can drive and model a rigorous but flexible analysis and design process, supported by strong project management practices and outstanding communication skills. You can effectively influence change across an organisation, drive real outcomes for customers and support organisations through significant transformations with your business knowledge and nous.You have experience in an operational role and an understanding of the machinery of government and/or complex business operations.Who you are—the professional attributes we are looking for...Human centred:  You can tame complexity by empathising with people, their needs and goals. You recognise the value of researching the experience of human beings and getting beyond the surface of needs that have been articulated.Strategic:  You think big picture, long term and can translate this to the present. You can play out different future scenarios. You connect strategy to the everyday experiences of people.Productive:  You reflect, you explore AND you deliver on time and on budget. You productively challenge the status quo. You see patterns, surface insights, make sense of complex information quickly and deliver tangible outputs and outcomes. Passionate:  You have charisma and influence. You love complexity and are inquisitive. Your interpersonal skills are outstanding. You build rapport and credibility with people rapidly. You are confident but not arrogant or dogmatic. Accomplished:  You make outstanding products that drive change. You are highly skilled in your areas of expertise. You have a track record of meaningful achievement and are committed to excellence.Collaborative:  You work well with others. You are a good listener and communicator. You seek new ideas and perspectives.  You build and sustain professional relationships. You have a connecting influence on people.Driven:  You make things happen. You inspire confidence, build momentum and bring others along with you. You are driven to provide clients the best advice possible in support of their desired outcomes. You thrive in a fast-paced, often changing environment.Who we are...ThinkPlace is a strategic design consultancy, working with leaders to create new and better futures – vibrant communities, strong economies, sustainable environments and trusted institutions.  We believe in a positive future world that balances the needs of the collective and those of the individual.ThinkPlace is a global company with studios in New Zealand, Australia, Singapore and Kenya, and an emerging presence in the United States.  We are an energetic team that is motivated by using our expertise and talent to create creating positive change. Our New Zealand studios (Auckland and Wellington) combine a global outlook with a unique New Zealand flavour and focus on unique New Zealand opportunities and challenges.   Learn more at www.thinkplaceglobal.com Job details...This is a full-time role based in Wellington. We carry out interesting and meaningful projects nationally and internationally—flexibility for short-term travel is required, and a full drivers licence is preferred.Position salary is competitive, commensurate with professional experience, experience in leading projects and teams, ability to contribute to business development, and a track record in developing trusted professional relationships. We are a close-knit team that is united by a strong sense of purpose as well as a high standard of practice.  A fit to our company purpose and team culture is an important part of our selection criteria.  The team play an active role in our recruitment process.We are accepting applications from people who already have the legal right to permanently in New Zealand.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Implementing Agile methodology to support and enable great results from our technology product development work.Newly created roleKiwi success story with world-class game-changing productsDream teamSenSys is a '40-year old start-up' delivering modern and innovative sensing solutions to global markets in farming, health and safety, utilities, building management and asset tracking. The sensors are cutting edge and a game-changer, opening new possibilities for management and care.  With an expanding client base and products with global reach, SenSys is ready for a Scrum Master who is keen to progress in their career and create their dream job amongst a dream team.   What we need:A Scrum Master who is an all-round high-performing person with exceptional organising, people and communication skills. About the role:The role is pivotal in helping us co-ordinate our project boards, and focuses on supporting the mature and capable product development work through implementation of Agile methodology.  Every minute is about delivering on our product intentions and aspirations.  Day by day, the common thread is ensuring Agile is being used to serve the company with excellence, incorporating into our work the benefits of being agile – lessons learned, schedules changed, maturing requirements throughout the product suites. You will be part of a highly skilled team that designs and supplies modern sensing equipment. Reporting to the CTO working alongside, across and between the team of Hardware and Software Engineers and Marketing personnel, you will play a vital part in supporting the project development processes of the company.  You will have the delicious task of scaling up the pilot manufacturing plant, with initial phase products, into a high volume facility for global markets.To be considered for this role you will have:•	Relevant Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business or Technology development (you flew through, top of the class)•	Experience in Agile methodologies, 10+ years•	Familiarity with the Atlassian suite•	Superb people and communication skills•	Proficiency with desk top office systems•	Attention to detail•	A professional approach and high personal work standards•	Competence to deliver and an eagerness to contribute.The successful candidate will ideally have: A demonstrable interest/experience in technology product development What we offer you:Supportive environment with highly talented peopleThe thrill of contributing to world-leadership in new marketsLeadership potential as the team growsAn enriching and growing career.The position potentially leads to a Product Owner role as we progressively appoint Product Owners across our technology suites.  We value commitment, working hard and being our word. We are looking for someone with a similar outlook who understands the importance of keeping the company interests and values at heart.  We provide a positive and caring team environment that will help the Scrum Master achieve their career goals, while in turn helping us achieve our company goals.  We are all exceptional in this company. Please convince us of your exceptional, award-winning qualities and why you will fit right in. Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

-  International Networking and Telephony Solutions Vendor-  Varied and Challenging Role-  CBD LocationAbout the CompanyOur client is a multinational success story with a well-deserved reputation for excellence in the design and deployment of innovative technology solutions in the Unified Communications and Contact Centre solutions space.About the RoleDue to increased client demand, they are looking to grow their existing team of highly talented developers working on a suite of unified communications and voice transmission software solutions.Although our client has a very flat reporting structure, in terms of the experience required this is senior level position. Skills Required- Senior Level C# / C++ Developer with at least eight years current experience-  Highly experience in VB Development- You will be a good listener, but also have a strong enough personality and enough confidence in your own skills and experience to push back and make decisions when needed-  You will be someone who is very keen to learn  keen to join a team of super geeks who love tech and are always involved in self-development-  You will be a highly motivated person and a hard workerIn return, you will be joining a highly talented team within an international company enjoying flexible working hours, the central CBD location, and Friday afternoon beers outside.We'd love to hear from you, if this is the right role for you - APPLY now or contact Mignon on 027 582 1129 for a confidential discussion. WellingtonNew Zealand Trade and Enterprise (NZTE) is looking for a Data Integration Specialist to join the IT Business Solutions Team in Wellington. You will work with NZTE and its partners to promote the effective use of NZTE's CRM assets. You will use your technical experience and passion to develop business intelligence user experiences to support NZTE to make informed business decisions.To be successful, you'll have strong awareness of Business Intelligence systems including ETL processes and data visualisations tools and techniques. Your excellent communication skills and desire to build effective working relationships at all levels will flow through to your genuine dedication to providing excellent customer service.Technically, you will have a comprehensive understanding of MS SQL, PowerBI and Qlik. Recent experience across the Microsoft stack would make you even more effective in this role, specifically with Azure and CRM Dynamics.If you have an IT or computer sciences qualification, with more than 5 years technical experience and a background in project delivery, with a passion for providing a quality service to customers, this could be the role for you.Applications close on Friday, 30 June 2017 (5pm NZ time).For more information about NZTE, this role, and to view a copy of the position description please visit www.nzte.govt.nz/en/careers/ and enter the job code 13305TM.

Are you passionate about clean code? Do you love learning new things? Are you the type of person that wants to continually grow personally and professionally? We want you!We are looking for a DevOps Engineer who is obsessed with automation, continuous deployment and have mad development skills. The role requires you to be flexible, quick thinking and have the ability to balance technical debt with speed of delivery. It is critical that you are a person that understands the meaning of scalability and how coding in a specific manner impacts on future infrastructure decisions. This is a senior role and will therefore require a high level of skills and experience in full stack development with a focus on AWS, node.js and strong theoretical knowledge and implementation of microservices. Having AWS experience is critical for this role. You will work within a small and quirky team of fellow developers who are not 'just developers'.Experience in the following technologies are required as a bare minimum:•	HTML, CSS•	JavaScript•	Angular.js 1 & 2•	Node.js•	Java / Java Spring•	gitJava is required for understanding and patching the current infrastructure but you will be focused mainly on microservices with node.js and coding. We expect a flexible and 'infrastructure first' mindset that is balanced with an optimized code for growth mentality. Field experience in WordPress theme and plugin development is also useful. We also require working, understanding, and proficiency in mySql, mongoDB and dynamoDB. This means you can do more than just create simple queries. If this sounds like you, apply today. Don't give us a generic CV, you will be ignored. Show us what makes you special, sell us your pitch and we guarantee you that you'll be in for a codetastic ride of your life. The fine print:•	You will need to be in Auckland and available for the interview.•	You must have the legal right to work in New Zealand•	You must include the phrase 'git is glorious' is somewhere in your application as proof that you have read and understood what you are applying for. We get a lot of people that apply who clearly hasn't read the requirements of the job.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Wellington or AucklandHere at BNZ Digital, we're a passionate bunch of digital experts, constantly challenging ourselves to design slicker and more delightful experiences for our customers. Together, we make up a melting pot of different digital specialties, ranging from dev and design to UX and insights. Growing our skills and passion, and creating a great place to work are really important to us, which is why we're looking for someone like you to join the team.As Digital Media Specialist you will be responsible for customer-facing digital technologies like the instore iPad app, signage and associated content. You'll work with third parties to constantly improve the digital experience our customers are getting. It's a pretty exciting role.You'll be helping us to:design and deliver a world class customer digital experience in our Stores and Partner Centresdevelop and manage a roadmap for digital interactions in-store & Partners Centresensuring the digital signage and content management platforms are fit for purpose to deliver exceptional capability.develop or direct content strategies and content that resonate with our customersexplore emerging technologies like Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Avatars, and Artificial Intelligence.About you:A highly driven problem solver with a passion for Customer ExperienceExperience in this field is necessary but enthusiasm is key and we welcome your fresh perspective and ideasExperience and familiarity with Digital channels either in a service delivery, account management, product management or project management capacityAn understanding of financial services and/or creative agenciesOutstanding stakeholder and communication skillsNot afraid to get hands-on as part of a small teamYou'll stand out from the crowd if you have:demonstrable experience with delivering digital experiences and interactionsexperience managing or directing creative projectsa passion for the techy stuff that drives you to learn morea passion for customer service and how technology can be an enabler.Why would you want to work for us?Backed by leaders that invest in you, coach you and inspire you, working at BNZ is a commitment to your development, whatever your career goalsAt BNZ, we have an inclusive culture where everyone is valued. We're inspired by our colleagues, driven by our customers, and encouraged to try new thingsFind the energy to be your best by being yourself, and unleash your potentialIt's more than the money. At BNZ your pay check is just the start, add multiple flexibility options, extended leave, and empowering development options and you've got a high achieving packageFlexible working, great staff benefits, and performance incentives are great- but knowing we've made a difference to our customers is our ultimate rewardIf you'd like to deliver world class digital solutions, work with an inspiring team and generally be part of something awesome, APPLY NOW!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column9: Intergen represents an exceptionally talented group of people that deliver leading edge solutions to clients. We are utterly passionate about this, and we are equally convinced that Intergen is an incredibly rewarding environment to work in.The JobYou will be responsible for designing and deploying cutting-edge solutions across Microsoft public Cloud environments. You'll help deliver freedom, flexibility, choice, and superior performance to clients. As a consultant you'll design and architect cloud-based solutions, liaising with clients to find the best possible result for them.  We will help you achieve your goals by continuous professional development and career progression sessions.The FitTo fit in with us, you will need to be passionate, motivated and client focused. You will be a confident consultant, who is at ease presenting to a broad audience. You will be excited by the challenge presented by complex problems and the opportunity to own the solutions.The ExperienceYou will have extensive experience in the cloud services space, a solid understanding of Microsoft Cloud and truly know what it means to deal with large and complex solutions.  You'll be technically savvy with Azure Datacentre, System Center and Exchange/office 365 with the experience and knowledge to hold your own in presales conversations.You will build rapport quickly to gain credibility and trust with clients and you'll demonstrate your understanding of what it really means to deploy a solution successfully into a complex environment.  The BenefitsAside from offering a great job in a truly talented and supportive team, we offer
column10: free International Travel insurance, additional Parental Package to Government Assistance, banking benefits, health insurance cover, technology purchases at dealer rates - computers, TVs, stereos, electronics!
