LifeDirect by Trade Me is a fast-growing online business which is changing the way Kiwis buy insurance.We offer quick and thorough online comparisons across NZ's best insurance policies, backed up by an expert, professional, and super-friendly Customer Service team who ensure setting up insurance is hassle-free.You'll have:3 years of experience in similar roles (preferably with a focus on web and API technologies) with  progressive increases in responsibilityexperience with agile software development methodologies is preferred, but not requiredextensive experience in development, delivery, and shipping the code using the right toolsreal-world experience in .Net, SQL, HTML and Javascriptpassion for writing beautiful code.In this role you'll be:actively participating within our agile environment alongside other developers, testers and designersengaged in the design thinking process to build, measure, and learn iteratively to move towards a successful productdesigning and building platforms that are scalable and maintainableworking alongside other teams to ship the productgetting involved in peer reviewing and testing code produced by other developers - we're all about helping each other outlearning new technologies and tools, and applying them to your work.pragmatic in your approach, understanding business requirements and enjoy working in an autonomous environment.What we have to offer:A collaborative, supportive work environment where you truly are inspired to make things better.You will work with a bunch of passionate, positive people who are all striving to make things better!Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Rewarding work where you can help people through the insurance application process and make their lives easier.LifeDirect by Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our 'informal but serious' work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Working on the fabulous Trade Me iOS app.Helping to define and refine our mobile features.You want to ship code all the time.Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our mobile apps get millions of visits every month and we're looking for an experienced iOS developer to help build a mobile experience like no other - this is your chance to contribute to the future of some of New Zealand's most popular apps.You'll be part of the Mobile team, building iOS apps targeting iPhone and iPad, assessing new platforms, and constantly prototyping and investigating ways of doing things better.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for a smart and adaptable iOS Developer who thrives in teams. We care less about the specific technologies that you already know, it's your aptitude, passion, and potential that we love and want to see shine through.In the role you'll be:Working on the fabulous Trade Me iOS app in a rapid-fire, fully Agile squad alongside other developers, designers, testers and business analysts.Helping to define and refine our mobile features.Getting your hands dirty with coding and championing all things iOS.Getting stuck into the official API Wrappers, code reviews and helping to punt up ideas for new products. We run frequent research and development events which will enable to you to experiment with new platforms and tools.Doing basically anything and everything iOS related and working with passionate folk doing the same.Who are you?You've got experience working in a fast-paced, results-oriented, API/mobile-based development environment and understand what's required to get the job done.You'll constantly be looking for learning opportunities, both to grow your already formidable talent and also to share your mad iOS skills with others.You want to ship code all the time and you get nervous if your code is sitting in a development branch for too long. You're happiest when your work is out in the wild.You'll love all things iOS and you're busting to be part of a team with a focus on the needs of the end-user. You're brimming with passion, bright ideas and a plan to bring them to light!What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.A focus on mentoring. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.A comprehensive list of training programmes to support your personal development.Free fruit and as much great coffee as you can manage.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our 'informal but serious' work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Systems Data AnalystCBD LocationCompetitive SalaryAbout the companyA leader in their industry, this organisation started in NZ has been operating for almost 40 years, now with a global presence. About the roleAs a Systems Data Analyst reporting to the Senior System Analyst, you will be responsible for providing technical advice, design and support for key business systems. You will lead the technical analysis, design and development of solutions that require data transfer to and from key business solutions. OrganisationThis iconic NZ business is a privately owned firm. They specialize in the provision of integrated advice and portfolio management services to New Zealanders.They`re a boutique and professional business. They are high performers operating in a mature, stakeholder-focused consultancy environment. Their clients range from individuals to large finance organisations and corporates where no limits exist around technologies or approaches being used. Role snapshot - your main objectiveThe primary responsibility of this role will be to own the development path and decisions for Business Technology using insights from the business and external factors, a good mind for intelligent business using Business Intelligence. In addition, you will be responsible for developing, testing and supporting delivery of the clients/advisors applications and services as part of the internal IT team as well work on large scale integration with the likes of Commonwealth bank, Kiwisaver and other financial institutions. Essential Skills Required - You are a seasoned and senior full-stack C#.NET developer  - SQL Server - SSRS, SSAS, SSIS  - Data and application integration experience  - Business Intelligence/Data Analytics  - Experienced in Requirements Translation and regular business stakeholder interaction  - WCF  Good to have - ASP.Net MVC Razor & full frontend tech  - Angular.JS or any other modern JavaScript library  - WPF  - Financial knowledge  - TFS and MSBuild  This company is all about putting people first, being open and honest, sharing their knowledge and making a difference. Working for this business will provide you with workplace autonomy, like-minded collaboration and continuous challenge. Please note that you must possess the right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this position.If this sounds like the right career opportunity for you, then please apply immediately.Contact Potentia on 093685111REF#JBJO-1704-46688Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Are you looking to join an exciting portfolio of work?Do you want to help shape and contribute to the PMO structure in your next role?Have your say and be heard in this extremely tight-knit businessMy client is a small-medium enterprise who are now looking for a new team member to join their growing family. Their portfolio of work has been growing extensively and they now have a need for an experienced Portfolio Analyst to support the Portfolio Manager track and maintain the smooth running of a range of projects.The environment The organisation is a small-medium sized private sector enterprise offering essential services to the New Zealand public. You will be working with a project team of people who are all at different stages of their career and maturity. At times, the role can be ambiguous and intense and will require you to be adaptable to the changes.The Role As the Portfolio Analyst, you will analyse and track the progress of the many projects, programmes and the overall portfolio of work. You will be need to ensure the programmes and projects are properly resourced and on track to deliver. You will need to liaise across multiple internal stakeholders and report to the portfolio manager regarding the overall health of the portfolio of work.Responsibilities You will be the focal point of the portfolio of work and will need to ensure you are across the broad variety of programmes and projects. You are a critical resource within the organisation as people will liaise with you regarding the progress of their work. It will be your responsibility to:*Track the spending of projects to ensure they are in line with the overall budget *Conduct a thorough GAP analysis to identify where resources are required *Measure the progress of projects in line with the set deliverables *Identify the touchpoints across the organisation*Optimise the use of resources across projects to ensure they are efficiently utilised *Engage with stakeholders across the organisation to discover their needs and concerns *Report to the Portfolio Manager with updates and a true understanding of the overall portfolioOverall, you will need to have exceptional soft skills, whereby you can talk to people from a variety of backgrounds and engage them to gain their full support. What next?If this sounds like you and you want to learn more, please contact Joe Chetcuti on (04) 917 9262 for a confidential discussion about your next thrilling step in your career.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Our client has a fantastic new opportunity to join their expanding global company as experienced product Support Analyst. This position requires a self-motivated, customer-focused professional who consistently keeps commitments to customers and fellow employees. The Support Analyst is responsible for engaging clients as the first point of contact and will ensure the customer experience is maintained to a high standard. The key attributes to be successful in this role include demonstrating initiative, strong time management skills, effective problem solving and the ability to understand and communicate technical information professionally. Please note, you need to have previous experience or exposure to supporting HR/HCM products. Responsibilities: - You will work directly with customers to research, troubleshoot and resolve processing and configuration issues - You will need to liaise with various departments including Professional Services, Quality Assurance, Product Management and Development - Manage incoming case queue and maintain focus on resolving customer cases quickly and effectively in line with the service level agreements (SLAs) - You will need to document your customer communications effectively in the issue management system - Test and triage customer problems and log issues to the Development team, working with developers to figure out a solution - Have good multi-tasking and time management skills so you can prioritise and escalate customer issues as required - It`s a global company so you will need to participate in their 24x7 global coverage planKey Experiences: - Experience supporting or implementing SaaS solutions - Customer support experience assisting customers in using enterprise software applications (Software as a Service companies a huge plus) - It would be advantageous if you have previously used Workday or worked with any other Human Capital Management (HCM), Talent or Recruitment solutions - It`s a fast paced work environment so you need to have excellent analytical and problem solving skills - You also need to have excellent verbal and written communication skills and be able to absorb new technologies quicklyAbout the client:They are a leading provider of enterprise cloud applications for finance and human resources. The company delivers financial management, human capital management and analytics applications designed for the world`s largest companies, educational institutions, and government agencies. The role comes with an excellent salary package and the company heavily invests in learning and development so it`s a great place to continue your career!If you`re interested in having a confidential chat about this role, please get in touch on the details below or click Apply Now!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Nine of our apps have reached #1 in a range of app stores. We make our own apps, websites and services, as well as for the world’s largest brands including Levi’s, Rip Curl, Samsung, and locally The Warehouse, AgResearch, and more. You should be well versed with best practices of App Development for Mobile devices, in general.Social networking frameworks and SDKs, knowledge of image manipulation and networking is a plus. Experience with integrating and using third party libraries and services, including ability to work with 3rd parties or client’s public APIs.Web development experience and a high level of competency in mathematicsSolid understanding of object oriented design and coding, design patterns and data structures.Must have a solid understanding of the software development process, including using Git and GitFlow.Initiative and a “get stuff done” attitude.Choose an environment that encourages independence, recognises hard-work and is great fun.Check out www.we-are-mea.com for more information about the company, who we are, what we stand for and who we work with.Apply online by submitting your CV to jobs@we-are-mea.com#15 fastest growing NZ company in the 2014 Deloitte Fast 502016 HiTech Awards Finalist2013 Australian Mobile Awards Finalist.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

At WEL Networks we're focused on delivering innovative energy solutions which help build sustainable Waikato communities, and keep the lights on 24/7.Based in Hamilton, we play an essential role in the region's economic and social development by identifying and investing in new technologies that will modernise our network and future-proof our region. With so much growth and expansion occurring it's an exciting time to consider a role in Electricity Distribution. The energy sector is on the verge of transformation, and Electricity distribution will be at the forefront of this change which makes a career in distribution an exciting choice.In this new role, reporting into our Senior Commercial Analyst, the successful candidate will provide analysis support for the development and implementation of our new business initiatives.The role involves:supporting business case preparation and exploring market opportunitiesassisting with our existing investments through economic performance analysis, KPI monitoring and risk identificationpricing analysis and financial modellingmonitoring and reporting on industry pricing trends and regulatory requirements.We are looking for someone who:holds a tertiary degree in a relevant discipline (business, accounting, finance etc)has plenty (five+ years) of experience in a commercial analytical environmentis an expert in Microsoft Excel™ including significant experience modelling complex financial scenarioshas a collegial, collaborative style of working.If you can bring us your experience of working in a utility or telco - it would be awesome.WEL offers a competitive package and a professional working environment - we look after our people. We will help you with relocation expenses if you are moving into our area and our staff benefits include fully funded medical and life insurance!If you feel this role is a good fit for your current skills and future aspirations, please submit an online application at www.wel.co.nz - where you can also see a detailed position description.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

You will also undertake a full range of business analysis specificity for requirements, Processes Analysis and Business Cases development.   What you'll need to succeed Your previous experience as a Business Analyst within New Zealand Government or services will lead to your success, as will:A proven ability to coordinate with multiple stakeholders and develop strong internal and external relationships.Experienced across a diverse array of projects and demonstrate strong proficiencies across all aspects of Business Analysis.Expert in Business Cases, benefits identification analysis and process Analysis. Opportunity to join a global market leader in this newly created position!Flexible working environment with an innovative spirit.Strong design thinking and customer centric principles.We're looking for a collaborative, agile player who is an experienced Android Developer to join a truly global business!What's in it for me?Headquartered in Christchurch with teams across Asia, UK and Europe and the USA, , our client are a truly global brand. With a proud history of innovation and thought leadership, they are one of the world's leading designers and manufacturers of specialist control technologies which enable people to live life to the full.With a strong road map planned for new systems and technologies, they're looking for a driven and self-motivated person to join them in this newly created position. As a senior position in an established team, you'll have a genuine opportunity to influence the development of products and services, and work on new and exciting product offerings.What would I be doing?The Android Developer will be responsible for providing technical expertise in the development of Android apps through direct work output and considering risks and benefits to the business when making technical decisions. A key component of the role is to lead the Android apps development within the business by effectively communicating technical outcomes and providing development opportunities to less experienced team members to achieve their potential.Key tasks include:Defining and documenting requirements and specifications.Perform development activities (including design, documentation, code creation, review, communication) at an advanced level of competence.Analyse the severity, occurrence and detectability of identified risks and calculate post-mitigation residual risk.Verify system/product/functional block operation and performance using a variety of modelling and simulation techniques.Create opportunities to build a sense of community across the function.Provide technical leadership in area of expertise, and help team members develop their technical knowledge and skills.Follow agreed Agile behaviours and processes, as agreed by the team and the Design department.Leverage experience to provide advice to inexperienced team members - both at a technical and managerial level.What do I need?We are ideally looking for experienced professionals with 5 or more years of Android Software Development experience, teamed with a Bachelor's Degree in a Technical/Engineering field. You will be well versed in current and best practice software application design and testing techniques and methodologies, and have experience in App design for interfaces to/from mobile devices. Experience in leading technical decision making and helping others understand technical aspects related to the field would be highly beneficial.Key skills and Knowledge for the Android Developer include:Strong investigative, analytical and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team.Strong sense of ownership and thoroughness, with high level of attention to detail.Strong organisational skills with the ability to plan, prioritise and make decisions.Ability to proactively identify risks, and drive action to mitigate and resolve issues.A high level of emotional intelligence, including: openness to new experiences

column8: Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for more mobile designers to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy and sell in our marketplace.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for smart and adaptable mobile designers who thrive in teams, and it's your aptitude, passion, and potential that we love and want to see shine through.We're currently on the hunt for talented mobile designers for our small but growing Christchurch office who can work across both Android and iOS platforms.In the role you'll be:Working closely with the marketplace design lead and product development teams to understand what the key objectives and goals of the business are and how great design can help achieve these.Designing and delivering a fantastic user experience for our iOS and Android apps. You'll also shape and deliver changes where you see fit and in conjunction with our brand guidelines.Articulating and demonstrating on a daily basis how your work feeds into the overall company strategy.Solving business and user problems. You'll also be involved in all of the design stages from user research and conceptual design, through to creating pixel-perfect mocks.Working closely with developers, testers, business stakeholders, UX researchers and business analysts within an Agile framework.Tackling difficult interaction challenges, so thinking about the details and thinking strategically is important.Thinking broadly - you'll consider the rest of the marketplace experience when you're designing.Pragmatically balancing the Trade Me brand and iOS/Android platforms.Part of Trade Me's wider design team and guild, collaborating with them, as well as seeking and giving support where needed.Helping to build and drive the design team culture that's future-focused, positive, quality-focused and fun.Who are you:A mobile product designer with 4+ years' experience designing for both iOS and Android platforms.Articulate - you can think on your feet and communicate with ease.Highly organised - you'll be able to juggle multiple projects and competing demands with ease.Curious - a natural problem solver. You'll think through design ideas and simultaneously consider the detail as well as the wider context.A natural collaborator - you'll be part of ensuring the design team is future-focused and positive.A great team mate - you'll be working closely with your squad so this is pretty important.Empathetic - we want you to demonstrate this in your work and to your colleagues.Energetic, driven and enthusiastic - this is a hands-on role and we need someone with a genuine desire to deliver results and motivate others.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll work with a bunch of passionate, positive people who are all striving to make things better!You'll get to work in our exciting Christchurch office which is growing.A focus on mentoring. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

They are known for partnering with some of the country's leading brands, helping them across their digital journey. Due to the continued success of their services, they are expanding their development team and are looking for an experienced Javascript Engineer to join their Agile practice. The role:You will be responsible for the design, development, and execution of software solutions, primarily focused on a digital platform. Delivering high-quality code will be your main goal, in addition to taking a taking a leadership role and coaching junior members of the team. Your experience will span across a range of commercially focused projects using technologies such as ReactJS, NodeJS and Angular along with integration skills with API's and micro servicesSkills:Development in React, Node, AngularJS, and HTML5/CSSDevelopment in JavaScript (NodeJS) of new features and improvements in the internal API3+ years experienceExperienced in front-end JavaScript, preferably AngularJS applicationsExcellent communication skills and the confidence to engage directly with clientsAbility and interest in coaching and mentoring junior team membersPassion and enthusiasm for what you do are just as important as your technical skills as our client's team really care about delivering excellent solutions to clients.Our client is a market leader with a strong growth forecast and there is a lot of scope for interesting project work and ongoing career options.Why wait? column9: working in a complex environment, and getting to know and work with others? Do you thrive on variety, can delve into the detail and care deeply about making a difference? The Information Systems and Services (ISS) team is looking for you, a Senior Business Analyst (SAP), who can help us further conservation through innovative technology. You'll bring an enquiring mind, great communication skills and analysis experience to work with new and existing systems, improving business processes. You'll need to be comfortable facilitating with a diverse range of people from field rangers to scientists, treaty negotiators to policy analysts to commercial marketers. Of course, we expect you to be a great documenter, scaling from the strategic to the detailed view. You'll love understanding how process design can drive efficiencies and effectiveness, knowing that you play your part in delivering better conservation outcomes for all New Zealanders.You will be part of a small, yet motivated Project team and you as the ideal candidate will:Excellent documentation and writing skillsExcellent engagement with business and technical teams.Strong on ICT and specifically integration, and appropriate SAP exposure in PM, FICO and BIBe flexible and adaptable
column10: able to work in ambiguous situations.Have strong business acumen and understanding of organisational issues and challenges.Work with business groups to understand and document requirements for initiatives identified and prioritised by ISS Governance groups.Highlight areas of improvement and identify new opportunities and facilitate change and configuration managementSupport the SAP Business Representative Group to help size and determine feasibility of initiativesValidate the functionality of the end product according to the requirement specificationsPrepare technical user manuals, system configuration documents and other technical reportsQualifications and experienceVery strong on elicitation with what the business needs while also managing stakeholder expectations of what is possible based on their technology awareness.Have experience of current business systems modeling tools and knowledge of the software development life cycle and good practice processes.A minimum of 5 years as a business analyst Please apply online. Applications must include a cover letter, CV and evidence of the required capabilities as per the role description. For more information please contact Kelly Robertson, krobertson@doc.govt.nz, or telephone (027) 559 9379, quoting vacancy 100/12T1. Applications close with Kelly Robertson, krobertson@doc.govt.nz, at 5pm on Monday, 7 August 2017.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column1: Senior Full Stack PHP Web Developer
column8: Come work in an exciting Agile / Scrum team creating fresh features on a bunch of new projects within an innovative technically led environment…What you’ll bring:***BSc or BEng or similar degree***6 - 10 years Full Stack Web Development experience in PHP/MySQL/JavaScript/HTML***2 years Experience of Laravel / Lumen PHP or similar PHP MVC frameworks***Experience working with RESTful APIs / developing UI / Web Applications***Experience of React.js a bonus***Work with GIT / DockerWhat you’ll get:***Exciting Growing company***New Agile / Scrum team***Collaborative team based culture***Espresso Machine & Drinks Fridge***Drinks on Fridays / VR sets & tech toys***Good Benefits / Flexible Working***On-going trainingLots of interesting new web projects to get stuck into!Click Apply Now or send CV with short note to paul@sunstonetalent.comApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

This is an exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Test Engineer to join our fun Fiserv team located in Auckland CBD. Ideally you’ll have had a two years of exposure to C#, Ruby, Python or Java code and be eager to tackle new languages and frameworks in an agile environment. You’ll be responsible for executing test cases, reporting and analysing test results, as well as estimating schedules and meeting them. You will also provide expertise and support for performance testing, system integration testing and other non-functional test activities.You’ll have:•	Two years + professional QA experience as an SDET, Developer or QA Engineer•	At least two years’ experience with C#, Java, Ruby and/or Python coding•	Understanding of black box testing, white box testing, and test automation•	Experience in web services (WCF preferred), HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, XML•	Excellent analytical skills and be methodical•	The ability to be flexible and pragmatic•	A great relationship building manner and be a strong, confident communicator•	Mobile application and Test Automation experience would be a bonusIn return you'll receive the chance to work with some of the finest talent in the financial services technology space as well as subsidised parking/public transport/health insurance and a flexible work environment.We’ve got brand new open plan offices which feature pool tables, foosball and table tennis, as well as cool deck spaces complete with BBQs (and let's not forget Friday drinks)!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for multiple developers to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy, sell and list in our marketplace.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for smart and adaptable software engineers who thrive in teams. We care less about the specific technologies that you already know, it's your aptitude, passion, and potential that we love and want to see shine through.It's great if you're already some kind of mythical.NET unicorn, but it's just as awesome if your career has taken you down a different path. Whatever you already know - we'll learn from you, and teach you what we know. We take training seriously and it's important that you do too.In the role you'll be:Working within our Agile environment, you'll get your hands dirty alongside other developers, testers, designers and business analysts.Using your skills to develop and test stories with your team.Contributing to requirements analysis with input to the design and usability of new features.Developing and maintaining regression tests to ensure the Trade Me platform is constantly available.Getting involved in peer reviewing and testing code produced by other developers - we're all about helping each other out.Harness usage data to drive designs and decisions and then objectively measure whether these have had the desired outcome.Measuring and using data for metrics-driven development, A/B testing, and minimum viable experiments.Who are you:A developer with a few years experience in a similar role. A degree in computer science or a related field would be desirable.You'll have strong development skills and will be working with the.NET framework in particular.You'll have an understanding of SOLID principles and the ability to apply them in your day-to-day work.Experienced with consuming and building web service API technologies.Experienced with some modern frameworks, like ASP.NET MVC, Knockout, Angular or similar.A problem solver - you'll be able to look at a problem and come up with a bunch of solutions.A team player - you're not afraid to pitch in and help others.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our Christchurch office which is growing, and we're also lucky enough to have catered lunch every two weeks.A focus on mentoring: we build you. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

A market leading technology company creating strategic solutions for local and global clients is looking for a Monitoring Engineer to join a growing IT operations team in Auckland CBD. As a Monitoring Engineer, you'll be responsible for all products and services the Monitoring Team provides to the organization at product development and infrastructure level. You'll also provide statistics and performance indicators to other IT groups with the aim of collectively achieving high availability and uptime of all services through performance trend analysis and the identification of bottlenecks, capacity issues, and other points of concern. Additionally, you'll assist the Monitoring Specialist in the usage and implementation of all monitoring tools and platforms that will provide monitoring and alerting capabilities for all software and hardware components across all data centres, environments, and offices globally. You'll be measured on your ability to deliver efficient and reliable solutions, with the goal of ensuring that the business' monitoring and statistics gathering needs are being met. Feedback will be garnered from product development, infrastructure teams and product oriented teams to align and track the effectiveness of the solutions implemented. Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and implementation of a new highly available global monitoring platform that will meet current and future business needs and expectations.Collaborate with development and operational staff to ensure accurate and useful monitoring and statistics gathering are in place.Provide documentation and tools for the rapid deployment of new monitors, alerts, and graphs by development and operational staff.Share knowledge and transition procedures to Monitoring Specialists. Key Requirements:2+ years' commercial experience in a similar role.Understanding of a broad range of software and system components across Unix, Unix-like, and Windows environments
column9: and how to monitor their health and efficiency.Knowledge of Application Performance Management (APM) tools such as New Relic, AppDynamics, Foglight, and how they integrate with servers and applications.Proficiency in scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell etc.) and sound knowledge in Python web frameworks like Django.Basic programming know-how (Linux and Windows oriented) - including an understanding of code and coding concepts - plus knowledge of build tools and concepts like Maven, Ant and Bash/SHKnowledge of Java EE concepts and technologies, .Net, Node.js, etc. and ability to help in the troubleshooting of issues affecting applications written in those languages.Prior experience creating productions monitors in systems such as Nagios, OpenNMS, Cacti or similar.Autonomous, proactive attitude, detail-oriented, highly organized, and quick to adapt to changes. Skills/Qualifications:Experience in a technology support organization.Prior experience working with time series databases and data representation tools.Experience with event and log management tools such as Splunk, Graylog or Logstash.Software development knowledge, including an understanding of Agile and Lean principles (i.e. Scrum, Kanban).ITIL? Foundation certification.Excellent English communication skills, both verbal and written.Computer Science degree or technical certificate On offer is the opportunity to take on a challenging role within a rapidly expanding company with a great work ethos who value and develop their employees. Follow the link to apply today or call Catherine Larsen on +64 27 204 4286 for a confidential discussion.

column1: Intermediate Full Stack Developer - Trade Me Jobs
column8: Trade Me is New Zealand's biggest internet business, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.The online job market is changing rapidly, and we have some big ideas to work on this year!We're on the hunt for smart and adaptable full-stack developers to help us to implement those ideas.We don't limit ourselves to a specific technology or language, but if you have some experience with C#, Angular, TypeScript, SQL Server, or ElasticSearch, we're keen to hear from you.You'll have:3+ years of experience in similar roles showing progressive increases in responsibilityproven skill in using web technologies and API design best practicesextensive experience in developing and shipping web productsstrong knowledge of Object Oriented Programming, Design Patterns and Domain Driven Developmentan agile approach to software developmentand a passion for writing beautiful code.At Trade Me Jobs we:aren't afraid to take risks and get our hands dirtyfix broken windows and write maintainable codeuse unit tests to write provable codewrite APIs while at RESTwrite scalable code for high traffic environmentsdeploy our code daily to a huge audience of job seekers and advertiserssolve hard problems, while keeping the user at the center of everything we do.In this role you'll be:actively participating within our agile environment alongside other developers, testers, and designersengaged in the design thinking process to build, measure, and learn iteratively to move towards a successful productdesigning and building platforms that are scalable and maintainableworking alongside other teams to ship the productgetting involved in peer reviewing and testing code produced by other developers - we're all about helping each other outlearning new technologies and tools, and applying them to your work.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

A market leading development house providing software for a range of large international and local businesses are growing their team. They need a JavaScript Engineer to join their innovative, high performing organisation.You'll be working on new development in a lean agile environment for international clients. Your key responsibilities will include design, development and implementation of front end application software in JavaScript.Tech:AngularJSFlowReactWebpack 2ES6SASS / CSS ModulesHTML5Lo-DashJasmine / Mocha - Chai / JestD3.jsNode / npm / yarnDevOps Tech:GitDockerAmazon EC2 / KubernetesInnovation and collaboration is key in this business so your flare for new methods, technologies and tools will be utilised.On offer is a competitive salary, an awesome culture and the opportunity to work for a market leading company while becoming a craftsman of code.Click apply today or email Catherine Larsen for more information. clarsen@globalattract.co.nz

The Ministry of Social Development (MSD) is undergoing significant transformation.  To support this we're in the process of re-designing and implementing how I.T operates and delivers quality products to the Ministry and partnering agencies across the sector.Influenced by a rapid shift in the marketplace to cloud and mobile based technologies, we are introducing new, innovative digital channels across the Ministry. These technologies will enhance and improve the way New Zealanders’ experience our services and interact with government services as a whole.To support delivery of this work, MSD is looking for  talented and experienced developers to build Client and Process-centric solutions in an environment where we consider I.T. and Business as one entity.Our ethos
column9: we prioritise people over process.To be considered for this role you will have:Experience within Business Process Management Disciplines (process designing, task management and workflow automation).Working Knowledge of IBM products (e.g. IBM BPM, IBM ODM, IBM IIB)Digital attitude (i.e. adaptable to change, influential, problem solver and naturally inquisitive). Located in modern offices in the heart of Wellington’s business district, this position offers opportunity to work across a vast array of applications inside one of the sectors largest technology groups in NZ.  We have a vibrant, diverse, multi-cultural environment, with a committed focus on work-life balance and personal career development.Successful candidates will have the chance to develop skills alongside multiple, skilled DevOps teams using cutting edge I.T. systems and automation to bring business solutions to life.  It will be advantageous to have awareness of Business process management and intermediate JAVA experience.If scope, challenge and the opportunity to grow your talents in one of NZ's most progressive IT Groups piques your interest- apply now. Please apply online with your CV and cover letter via the "apply" button. A position description is available below.All applications must be made online, however, if this is not possible or if you have any queries please contact Jodie Gummer on jobs@msd.govt.nz.Applications close Wednesday 26th July 2017.

column8: Trade Me is New Zealand's biggest internet business, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.  Role Overview We have an exciting opportunity for a passionate iOS developer to join our Trade Me Jobs Squad.  We need you to help us develop some great new mobile products for candidates and our customers as part of our fresh new strategy and shiny new roadmap.  Trade Me Jobs is gearing up to face international competitors. If you think you have what it takes, get in touch.What will you be doing?This role is responsible for contributing to the build of our Trade Me Jobs mobile products. Bringing your industry and community knowledge to the team, you will collaborate with other members of your squad to deliver the best possible outcomes for mobile. Some of those tasks will include:Working in the Jobs mobile squad:Participating in all Sprint meetingsBuilding native applications for all iOS devicesPerforming code reviewsContributing to, and working on, tasks from the Squad's backlogSuggesting ways to improve our productsWorking closely with all other Squad members within an agile frameworkTaking ownership technical solution architectureEnsuring that our mobile products have high quality standardsContributing ideas and feedback to the iOS roadmapIn conjunction with the Head of Mobile, actively promote the mobile platform, its technologies, trends, and opportunitiesWho are you?Tertiary qualification with a degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience)4+ years of experience in similar roles (preferably with a focus on mobile technologies) with progressive increases in responsibilityExperience with Agile software development methodologies preferred, but not requiredNative iOS development using both Objective-C and SwiftBroad understanding of, and ability to identify, technical opportunitiesExperience of releasing apps to the Apple storeExperience in, or a desire to learn AndroidEmpathy: the ability to connect with people, and challenge appropriatelyMaturity: ability to contain emotional responsesA propensity for personal motivation, initiative, adaptability and the willingness to face challenges head-onA passion for building mobile applicationsWhat we have to offer:This is an exciting opportunity here at Trade Me and offers the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space. You will get to work with some of the best Devs in town.You will work with a bunch of passionate, positive people who are all striving to make things better!Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work dayBreak out areas, games, slides and office scootersTrade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running. Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

About your new Company: This government organisation is embedded in all our communities and is key to making sure we are in safe and welcoming environments. They are on the frontline 24/7 and work alongside individuals, businesses and other government agencies to achieve their vison of having the trust and confidence of all in the wider community. You will be proud to be part of this family and knowing you have helped shape the future for all New Zealanders. About your new role: You will be a key point of contact on a large, complex and/or high profile Programme between the EPO, the Programme team and its stakeholders. You will have well developed time management capability, financial reporting and budgeting experience, organisational skills, communication abilities and be familiar with project management applications to ensure a programme meets the required objectives. You will be required to work well under pressure and will be comfortable with change and complexity in dynamic environments. As expected you will be responsible for compiling programme status reports, overseeing meetings and creating project schedules. As a programme coordinator you will make sure the Programme runs smoothly by tracking programme progress and communicating it to the relevant people. What they are looking for in your CV:Previous experience working in a large-scale project or programme environment, or Programme Management OfficePrevious experience in administration and/or coordinationPrevious experience using MS Project, Visio, PowerPoint and other MS office toolsExtensive knowledge of project planning and project management processes, practices, tools and techniquesIdeally you will also have Prince2 or an equivalent certification.What you will get in return: Working for this organisation will give you the sense of accomplishment you may not receive elsewhere. Knowing that you were part of something that continues to help and shape the lives of the people in our communities is something you can be proud of in years to come. You will also be rewarded with a very competitive salary and get to work with a team that wants to achieve and shape the future for our families and children. What you need to do now: If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV. Ref No: 87615

Innovative, Driven public sector agencyCareer making opportunityJoin a passionate, dedicated team who enjoy working towards common goals.Our client, is one of the most commercially-focused government agencies, who have embarked on an interesting pipeline of projects aimed to improve customer experience and increase efficiencies of service. You will have a proven track record as a System Engineer and will have minimum of 8 years IT industry experience. Our client is looking for a Senior Biztalk Administrator to manage and maintain all aspects of the Biztalk server and Application integration. You should have a proven track record maintaining a large environment. You will also have a reputation for excellent documentation skills and striving for best practice.Key Responsibilities:Provide support of the a system

column8: Business Intelligence AnalystTauranga City Council (TCC) is now seeking an experienced and highly motivated Business Intelligence Analyst to join an effective, hardworking and dynamic Digital Services team.In this role you will be accountable for the establishment and continued development of sustainable Business Intelligence (BI) and data management capability that underpins business reporting, data visualisation and advanced analytics across, and beyond, the organisation.While this role will be focussed on BI capability, the successful applicant will also be expected to add value to internal business units and to leverage additional internal and external technical resources as necessary. This challenging and exciting role will be based in the Tauranga CBD and reports to the Application Integration Architect.We are looking for someone with at least 3-5 year's relevant experience and a career that demonstrates progressive increases in responsibility and accountability in the practice of Business Intelligence.Ideally your experience and success will be within a similarly large and complex organisation as proven experience in the following areas will be expected:Data Warehouse principles and implementationMaster Data Management and Data GovernanceICT tertiary level qualification supported by certification and/or accreditation such as IITP or ITILMS SQL Server technologies, Microsoft SSIS, SSAS, SSRS and BI toolsetsThought leadership to deliver business advantage through data, information and BIMulti-level stakeholder engagement and relationship managementSDLCThis is a genuine opportunity to join a progressive, service oriented organisation and develop a clear career path for your future.Applications for this role close at midnight on 23rd July 2017 and interviews with shortlisted applicants will take place during the week commencing 31st July 2017.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Dunedin is an amazing place to live and work, and if you were to ask anyone living here, they’ll tell you that there’s something indescribably special about our city. It’s small enough to feel like you’re part of a community, but big enough to ensure that there’s always something going on. From the great outdoors to arts, culture and education, all within 10 minutes of the city centre. Dunedin has so much to offer, so why not come and feel just how special it is?Dunedin City Council is seeking an Integration Analyst to join the Business Information Services Team. You will bring strong interest and experience in systems integration, along with a can-do attitude.You will have the ability to develop and be a key part of the implementation of DCC’s technical plans required to support the DCC’s digital services and development and monitoring of compliance with technical data and information management across the Council.Ideally you’ll have:experience in a senior technical roleexperience in developing and implementing enterprise system integrationthe ability to demonstrate technical solutions that support business processstrong experience in collaborating with all areas of business to successfully align IT technical solutions with business strategic roadmapsexperience in data warehouse/BI solutions is an advantage but not essentialthe ability  to work successfully to deadlines and as part of a team.If you have the above skills and experience, and want to be part of a high performing team, making a real difference, then we want to hear from you!Applications close 30 July 2017.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

The OrganisationAgResearch is the Crown Research Institute tasked with delivering cutting-edge agricultural science and innovation to benefit the wider New Zealand economy. Our internationally-recognised scientists work across the agricultural sectors in collaboration with a range of stakeholders both nationally and internationally, putting science and innovation at the forefront. We are a unique organisation that is driving prosperity by transforming agriculture.The RoleThis role sits within the software development team providing web based and mobile solutions within the GIS space. But, it is not an ordinary Web/GIS developer position. We are looking for an individual who can offer an 'in-house GIS consultancy service' to our scientists on the ground and in the labs. You will be working on platforms such as ESI ArcGIS Desktop, Server and Arc On-line Software. This role is responsible for ultimately designing and developing applications that will support our scientists to conduct their research and gather their geo-referencing data in an effective and efficient way, leading the way through innovation and technology.This role will be varied, supporting a number of diverse science teams across the organisation. No two days will be the same.DutiesProvide web-based and mobile application development services utilizing various programming languages.Design and develop software applications by writing quality, stable, scalable, and maintainable code based on business requirements.Analyse information to determine, recommend, and plan installation of new applications or modification of existing applications.Perform complex GIS analysis with a variety of data formats.Provide the GIS services using ESRI ArcGIS Desktop, server and Arc On-line software.Work as part of a wider GIS team to develop distributed products via web-based technology and desktop software. About you5+ years professional experience as a Software Developer, 3+ years which are GIS relatedExperience with web technologies including JavaScript, HTML5, CSS and XMLSound understanding of SOAP and REST web servicesAdvanced software development experience with ESRI Web APIsHigh degree of technical expertise on GIS software products and technologiesExcellent communication skillsA team player with a can do attitudeFlexible and adaptable to changeBenefitsAgResearch gives you BalanceYour EverydayBeautiful campuses & great Learning and Development opportunitiesYour HealthGenerous leave provisions & access to the group scheme for health insuranceYour FamilyIncome and life insurance & supportive family friendly working environmentYour ExtrasOptional 5th week annual leave, multiple retail discounts & All of Government Westpac banking discountsApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Student Management System ProjectThe University of Waikato is implementing a new Student Management System (SMS), which will provide online services for students and staff from initial enquiry through to graduation.This is an exciting time to join the University and be part of a multi-functional project team with close links to our Business Information and Analytics Group. We are seeking an enthusiastic person with solid analytical and problem-solving skills to design and develop reports and dashboards for the SMS project during the transition to the new SMS environment and infrastructure.You will have demonstrated expertise in general SQL, SSRS and the Microsoft Reporting Suite and experience in installation and setup of reporting tools and connecting data sources. You will have the ability to design innovative solutions that meet user requirements or solve business problems, be comfortable translating technical issues to non-technical audiences and work with the team developing the data warehouse and Management Information reports.A bachelor's degree is a requirement for this role, along with expertise in SSRS report development and administration, proficiency with MS-SQL BI and excellent interpersonal skills required to support you working in project environments. If you have the technical skills and a willingness to work collaboratively then we want to hear from you.To see the Job Description file please copy and paste the URL below into your internet browser's address bar http://expressonline.hainesattract.co.nz/pdfs/565999_other.pdfApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Competitive SalaryLeading NZ government organisationPermanent PositionA leading NZ government organisation is on the lookout for an experienced Systems engineer to join their team  Your new company A leading NZ government agency is currently recruiting for an experienced Network systems Engineer to join their team. The role has become available to support the continuous transformation and development programme.  Your new role The role of the Network systems engineer sits within technology operations group and the post-holder will be responsible for providing level 3 technical support and functional direction. You will be key in supporting operations and its related infrastructure.  What you'll need to succeed Successful applicant will need:Experience in supporting/troubleshooting remote and central voice platformsExperience in monitoring network server platforms using tools provided. - Good communication skills - Experience with Cisco, Riverbed, Checkpoint, Sun, HP and PC equipment, operating systems and associated data.Experience managing a large number of UNIX and Microsoft servers in a networked environment, including jump start images for serversExperience Maintaining LDAP and AD directories, DNS and IP addressing standards and associated services. Demonstrated ability to work with network and platform management tools.  What you'll get in return Excellent salary and development programme, and an opportunity to work in a highly trained and qualified team.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Zac Doar on 04471 4493 for a confidential discussion. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Why you`d like it - Global organization. - Growing business. - Working with the most advanced technology and solutions in the PoS industry.The OpportunityWith the growth of New Zealand market comes an opportunity to join this growing international business that is ready to invest into employees` development and gives them an opportunity to utilize their coding and software engineering knowledge, skills and abilities in developing the newest and most advanced PoS solutions for their clients.   The OrganizationThis global organization is a market leader in Point of Sale systems.  It prides itself to be a trusted provider of PoS solutions to primarily energy customers in New Zealand and Australia. Role SnapshotIn this role, you will support, develop, and maintain the code base and work on new development projects. The main areas you will focus on are hardware, UI, API, and migration.  Your Fit - You have at least 3 years of `full stack` Java and web development experience and more than 7 years of experience in a software development field. - You have hands-on experience with the following technologies: Java, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Unit Test Frameworks, embedded Linux, embedded platform web server. - Exposure to the DevOps environment. - You have a proven experience in deploying and maintaining applications using Jetty or Tomcat.  Please note that you must possess the right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this position.If this sounds like the right career opportunity for you, then please apply immediately.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

The Christchurch City Council strives toward World Class service delivery in all aspects of its community based services. The Information Technology Unit supports the many different areas of the Council with a range of technology developments, implementations and enhancements.As a Senior SAP Basis Specialist your role is providing senior level technical expertise to support and improve the ongoing management of key SAP based corporate business systems.We are looking for an experienced senior SAP basis specialist with good communication skills, a positive manner, and is able to adapt to changing workloads. Experience working in both on premise and cloud services would be an advantage. You must have attention to detail, a passion for quality and excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills. You will have a high level of written communication skills to participate in the development of functional and technical documentation and well-developed system problem solving skills.Join our team and work alongside highly experienced and very capable professional analysts. Enjoy working on a variety of BAU, project and enhancement work across different applications. We offer a unique working environment with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth, as well as developmental opportunities.What are you waiting for? Apply now!To apply for this job, please go to our job site and enter the job code 8442TM.

WHAT'S ON OFFER?Throughout Australia and New Zealand Fujitsu New Zealand partner with our customers to consult, design, build, operate and support IT solutions that enable them to deliver results.  From strategic consulting to application and infrastructure solutions and services, Fujitsu has earned a reputation as the single supplier of choice for many leading corporate and government organisations. We have a vacancy for an experienced Problem Management specialist to lead a team of Problem Analysts supporting our Managed infrastructure Services clients. Working in an open, friendly environment, your responsibilities will include:- Managing the Problem Management Service Delivery to the Customer through ITIL processes with a goal of reducing Incidents to the Service Desk.- Managing co-ordination/negotiations with the Operational Groups to obtain data data required for research purposes and reporting to the Customer.- Overseeing the investigation and implementation of Root Cause Solutions to Customers satisfaction- Managing the performance of the Problem Analysts- Supporting the 2nd and 3rd level Engineers within the Operational Support requirements of the teamWHAT DO WE WANT FROM YOU?To be successful in this role, you will need to have: - Willingness and ability to take ownership of the problem management process and ensure it is maintained throughout the organisation.- The ability to make decisions and carry out appropriate actions to the satisfaction of the customer.- The ability to manage and  communicate information effectively, e.g. to Customer Problem Management Meetings.- High level negotiation skills when working with Operational groups and with the Client.- Previous experience in IT Service/Support Management.- Experience with ITIL processes- The ability to function in a diverse and cross functional environment in order to achieve the desired result.- Excellent analytical skills.- The ability and experience of leading IT technical staff.- Experience and technical understanding of technologies associated with a Microsoft Windows Server environment.If you believe you meet the above requirements, and are interested in enhancing your career with a leader in the industry, we'd like to hear from you. Please apply on-line, or call Malcolm Dow, Recruitment Manager, on 04 890 9577 for further information.

column8: A market leading digital organisation in Auckland is looking for a Senior Test Analyst to join their team for new and exciting projects.You'll be responsible for testing software for the company, their clients and you'll be involved in automation testing, manual testing, web and mobile testing. You'll be highly technical and will be able to communicate with a range of both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
