Do you live and breathe technology?Hack life's problems & create your own solutions at home?Rate your code as better than your peers?Our privately owned and award winning client requires an Developer with a twist... work on a .Net product you will be solving issues in various languagesDirectly implementing new features and improvements for a new and 2 existing product which are moving fast! See your work put straight into production in an environment capable of releasing multiple times per day! No more developing a button for 6 months only to see it not released. Joining a small team where cultural fit is paramount. You will be a team player, work hard, work without guidance and be driven to deliver for your customer. Did we mention Coca-Cola, Shazam, Deloitte, Microsoft, Air New Zealand... are already using this product?Bring your passion for where technology can take us, your love of problem solving and in return you will join an outstanding brand and team where everyone is developing for a living and a hobby. And yes there are hack days and team lunches, flexibility and wear "what you want dress code".To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate:- You are an Intermediate C# .Net Developer with commercial experience in the Microsoft stack- Your JavaScript frameworks knowledge- The ability to code in more than just C# .Net - Java, Ruby, Python welcomed - Your ability to communicate your ideas, code and ideas to designers and fellow developers - You are an exceptional problem solver - You can keep up with multiple releases per day- You are comfortable working in an Agile environment- Can estimate well and deliver to deadlines Please get in touch for further info and to learn more about how you can become part of something very unique!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DOWe're a delivery team of 90+ developers, designers, testers and product people bringing our electricity retail software to countries around the world. But more than that, we've actively built a place we want to work at: smart, kind and friendly people, all working together on interesting challenges.In our diverse multinational team you'll find runners, parents, cooks, musicians, mountaineers, gamers, volunteers, photographers and knitters, constantly encouraging each other to get better at what we do.Our software platform handles everything needed to be an electricity retailer, from mobile and web apps through to customer service, smart meter data aggregation, billing, payments and industry data integrations. It's pretty great, and both our retail partners and customers love it.Powershop's success means that we're constantly growing and hiring, and that's where you might be able to help us.WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU WANT TO DOOur sophisticated product is written in Ruby, using Ruby on Rails, but we're not a typical Rails rapid application development company: we've got genuinely hard problems. We don't require any Ruby knowledge, but we do need versatile software developers keen to keep growing.You're the kind of person who wants to know how things work
column9: you're not only excited about learning new technologies, but you also want to learn techniques and principles that will make you a more effective developer in every way.You have knowledge of a modern OO programming language, such as Java, C#, Ruby or Python, as well as experience of relational databases. You know what elegant, well-factored code looks like, and you wouldn't want to code any other way.You value amazing working relationships with non-technical and technical people alike. We work here so we can hang out with people like you!WHAT WE'LL DO TOGETHERWe've got a role that'll stretch your abilities, working with super-smart people, building a product in a complex domain. We have a lot to do as we grow our platform into multiple markets, and we could use your help.You'll spend the first two or three months on our unique training team learning how we do things at Powershop, using Ruby & Rails, before you join a delivery team. No matter how experienced you are, our mentors will expand your mind and set you up for success.Once on a team, you'll work in a truly agile way
column10: we give our small integrated teams autonomy in how they run as long as they code-review and test everything. Our product owners bring their business problems to the teams, and you'll be instrumental in working out the right solutions, pitching them to business, designing the architecture, and implementing them, all while helping everyone on your team be awesome.We actively grow our people, and we'll work with you to find new opportunities for learning, sharing and responsibility. (As just one part of our commitment to learning, we have two hack-days every month, where you get to work on your own projects!)Working more than 40 hours a week is frowned upon, and quite a few people have reduced-hours contracts. We're relaxed, family-friendly and social, and we've got the typical office comforts.HOW TO APPLYTo be sure Powershop is a great fit for you, expect a couple of coding challenges, an interview or two, and to spend some time with our teams. You should include enough information to demonstrate your experience and what you'd bring to Powershop
column11: this is often a CV and cover letter and send to devteamjobs@powershop.co.nz.We look for ability and potential, and we're an equal opportunity employer. We are not evaluating you on your race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status, other life choices or dress sense. We're happy to consider you even if you can't yet work in New Zealand.

column8: North Shore locationHuge long-term career opportunitiesMultiple roles $80-110k for appropriate experience levelsOur client are at the top of their technology sphere globally and continue to win major contracts in massive offshore markets.  They are looking for Java developers with a test mindset to join their existing team developing hardware and software applications.  To be considered for these opportunities, it is essential that you come armed with the following:Strong integration testing experience within embedded systemsExperience working within product development environmentsExperience developing test harnesses in Java or an OO language, visual basic, C, C++ within a technical enviromentAt lest 5+ years in an engineering role with software, hardware and development testingA tertiary qualification in Computer Science or similarStrong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teamsThese roles provide a great platform for future career progression and development.  If you are looking to join a successful organisation where staff moral is a priority and a supportive collaborative approach is embraced, please call Katie 021822000 to discuss in confidence or submit your full resume outlining all previous, relevant experience to cv@lloydexecutive.co.nzApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Technology startup with craft beer on tap, 3D printer & latest techBe a part of a rapidly growing team of techiesDevelop overall concept for new products the world hasn't yet seenTechnology startup with craft beer on tap, 3D printer & latest techBe a part of a rapidly growing team of techiesoverall concept for new products the world hasn't yet seenCome work for an organisation which offers an innovative, collaborative, and energetic environment for people who bring passion and commitment to their work.  Often people talk about a great company culture but these guys live and breathe it!  This is a startup type environment and having fun at work is a major priority - You grab a beer on tap, print your newest creation on the 3D printer or play with a range of miniature video cameras.You'll be joining an established global brand who is a dominate player in the global camera technology market, working with all the big players as well as hottest US startups. With offices in the US, China and head office in NZ you'll be a part of the research and development of new solutions.You'll be equipped with a full test lab, workshop, R&D facility and the latest Mac.What you will be doing: As a valued member of the DevOps team you'll be working closely with technical team to deliver technology solutions. Day to day you'll be automating the lame stuff so you can spend more time working on the fun stuff like defining and building systems and pipelines, resolving complex issues and researching the latest technologies.What you'll need to be successful:Debian, UbuntuDocker, AWS ECS, AWS LambdaRabbitMQ, AWS SNS, AWS KinesisMySQL, Elasticsearch, AWS S3Git, Jenkins, Nexus, GitHub, AtlassianPython, Bash, Ruby, Groovy, JavaScriptThis is your chance to work in an innovative environment with a great team of peers. Don't miss out on an opportunity that will utilise your DevOps skills and also allow for continuous growth and development! Don't be one of those people who read an advert about a fantastic opportunity and never actually apply, only to later hear somebody you know bragging about how great their new job is!  They applied so don't miss this opportunity - APPLY NOW!Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.  Please apply using an MS WORD version of your CV, as if we proceed with your application this is the format we'll require to submit to clients.Note: We review all CV's manually and you will only be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.LG_450934Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Join a Canterbury based company with a global reach!In a growth season that will lead to further opportunity.Huge variety of work. In-house PMO.What's in it for me?This is a high profile organisation in the manufacturing industry based on the outskirts of Christchurch, where you can escape the roadworks! In this role you'll be focus on a varied range of projects, juggling multiple projects at any given time and be working with a talented and highly regarded project team. Opportunities on this scale are rare in the Canterbury market and we don't expect the position will be available long! What would I be doing?A good number of upcoming projects have already been identified. You will take ownership of a number of these projects to ensure they are delivered to the highest standard while using your initiative to add value in this rapidly expanding environment.You will be responsible for:Leading the project management activities on your assignmentsActing as key customer liaison (mostly internal) and maintaining a strong stakeholder managementCoordinating project planning and process developmentAchieving deadline and profitability targetsProduction of reports (project status, financial reports)Utilising project implementation methodologies and toolsWhat do I need?2 - 6 years experience with formal Project Management roles and responsibilitiesUnderstanding of specific project management methodologiesExcellent communication skills - written and verbal, in EnglishStrong influencing and negotiation skillsGreat client facing experience alongside strong stakeholder management skillsUnderstanding of the Software Development LifecycleIdeally, experience on business and information systems projectsWhat do I do now?Apply using the Apply button on this pageWho are we?Sourced is a specialist IT Recruitment Agency primarily focused on permanent & contract positions within the Christchurch, Auckland, and wider New Zealand, IT and Technology sector.Jobseekers come back to us time after time as we look out for them and provide sound, unbiased guidance throughout their careers. Our clients keep coming back because we do what we say we'll do, working to genuinely understand their business, their culture and their unique dynamic. Keep up to date with all that is happening in your local IT and Technology market by registering with us now at www.sourced.kiwiOverseas and New Zealand bound?We work with candidates from all over the globe, every day. If you have made your decision to move to New Zealand and your plans are firmly underway, please get in touch by registering with us.  We have clients who are sourcing specialised IT disciplines and are ready and willing to talk to you.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around 4 million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. This means that the code you write will be in front of all of these people, which is pretty exciting!The Internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for smart and adaptable software engineers who thrive in teams. We care less about the specific technologies that you already know, it's your aptitude, passion, and potential that we love and want to see shine through.It's great if you're already some kind of mythical Angular.NET unicorn, but it's just as awesome if your career has taken you down a different path. Whatever you already know - we'll learn from you, and teach you what we know. We take training seriously and it's important that you do too.In the role you'll be:Working within our Agile environment, you'll get your hands dirty alongside other developers, testers, designers and business analysts.Using your extraordinary skills to develop and test stories with your squad.Contributing to requirements analysis with input to the design and usability of new features.Developing and maintaining regression tests to ensure the Trade Me platform is constantly available.Getting involved in peer reviewing and testing code produced by other developers - we're all about helping each other out.Consistently working towards exceeding system performance targets.Actively working with your team members.Measuring and using data for metrics driven development, A/B testing, and minimum viable experiments.Who are you:A developer with a few years experience in a similar role. A degree in computer science or a related field would be desirable.You'll have strong development skills, you'll be working with the .NET framework and Angular. Previous experience with these is not a requirement.You'll have an understanding of SOLID principles and the ability to apply them in your day-to-day work.Experienced with consuming and building web service API technologies such as REST, SOAP or WCF would be nice to have.Experienced with some modern frameworks, like ASP.NET MVC, Knockout, Angular or similar.A problem solver - you'll be able to look at a problem and come up with a bunch of solutions.A team player - you're not afraid to pitch in and help others.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our stunning Wellington waterfront building, and we're also lucky enough to have catered lunch every two weeks.A focus on mentoring: we build you. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Break-out areas, games, slides and office scooters.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Competitive SalaryLeading NZ government organisationPermanent PositionA leading NZ government organisation is on the lookout for an experienced Systems engineer to join their team  Your new company A leading NZ government agency is currently recruiting for an experienced Network systems Engineer to join their team. The role has become available to support the continuous transformation and development programme.  Your new role The role of the Network systems engineer sits within technology operations group and the post-holder will be responsible for providing level 3 technical support and functional direction. You will be key in supporting operations and its related infrastructure.  What you'll need to succeed Successful applicant will need:Experience in supporting/troubleshooting remote and central voice platformsExperience in monitoring network server platforms using tools provided. - Good communication skills - Experience with Cisco, Riverbed, Checkpoint, Sun, HP and PC equipment, operating systems and associated data.Experience managing a large number of UNIX and Microsoft servers in a networked environment, including jump start images for serversExperience Maintaining LDAP and AD directories, DNS and IP addressing standards and associated services. Demonstrated ability to work with network and platform management tools.  What you'll get in return Excellent salary and development programme, and an opportunity to work in a highly trained and qualified team.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Zac Doar on 04471 4493 for a confidential discussion. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Create better content, faster Wipster is a cloud based B2B SaaS startup. We solve the difficult problems around video review and approval for companies making video for marketing. We are a small, ambitious team based in Wellington, New Zealand but we do business on a global scale, with thousands of customers (like Uber, Shopify, Netflix and Tesla) in over 100 countries and integrations with Slack, Adobe, Brightcove and Vimeo. At Wipster you can see the immediate impacts of your work, be involved in the challenge of growing an early stage business and you will get a piece of the success pie through our employee share options program.  We have a ‘best in class’ tech stack. Our platform runs on Microsoft Azure, and our code is built in C#, AngularJS, and TypeScript.  We’re a small and collaborative product development team, and you’ll have the opportunity to contribute through your ideas and hard work.Are you a front end developer who thrives in fast paced environments and likes to get stuff done?In this role you’ll:  Take ownership for the achievement of product development goalsBuild and maintain our product, predominantly on our front-end platforms (with opportunities for full-stack work)Respond to ad hoc requests for a variety of tech-related itemsWork closely with teammates to plan and divide work to achieve ambitious goalsRun demos of your work for the the whole Wipster teamUse your experience to help guide the technical direction of the Wipster platformJob requirements:Ideally you have 5+ years experience in a similar roleA pragmatic attitude and a willingness to get things doneResilience (things change and you’ll need to adapt quickly)Strong software development skills in languages similar / transferable to what we use at WipsterPractical understanding of common software quality principles (things like the SOLID principles)Experience in writing and maintaining automated unit tests including practical experience with mocking frameworksExperience in all aspects of a continuous delivery software development lifecycle - including source control, continuous build / integrationIdeally, experience with cloud platforms (but not required)A tertiary qualification with a degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience)Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Are you a good listener?  Do you love meeting and talking to people and figuring out what matters to them.  Can you explain how software works in simple language? Do you have experience with professional practices like Bookkeepers, Accountants, Financial Advisors or Lawyers?We're looking for a customer researcher to join 2Shakes – an exciting Wellington-based GovTech Start Up. 2Shakes Ltd is a cloud provider of client onboarding and authority software for professional practices. Businesses such as Bookkeepers, Accountants and Financial Advisers save time for themselves and their clients through 2Shakes’ automated signup and authority service, which currently integrates with NZBN, IRD, ACC, Companies Office and Xero and the Blockchain.2Shakes is LEAN which means we are driven to deliver what is of most value to our customers. We need someone who can talk to business prospects and figure out what really matters to them. We are all about co-designing with potential customers, so to do this we need you to find and get onboard early adopters - businesses who are willing to help us design the solution, beta test it, and become customers themselves.Key to your role will be contacting potential customers, finding out what they do and how they do it, telling them about 2Shakes and figuring out how we can provide them with value. You'll need to be comfortable cold-calling people and be able to build rapport and trust quickly. What we're looking for someone who: Loves people, and has an underlying desire to listen to really understand what is being said.Is great on the phone, videoconferencing and in person with prospective customers.Can paint a picture to someone about how our software works and the benefits it can provide them.Has a passion for technology, innovation and all things Startup.Can fit into a small friendly team, and muck in as needed.Has good knowledge of digital media/social media.Is self-motivated with a proactive approach to work.We offer a chance to work in a fast-moving Lean start-up to develop you customer engagement skills.  We are a supportive friendly team who are driven to produce great software using Lean and Agile.  We will support and encourage you to challenge yourself to be the best you can be! Apply now by sending your CV and interesting info about yourself to mike@2shakes.co.nz.Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.www.2Shakes.co.nzApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Above market rate payPrestigious companyExciting projects and great benefitsThe CompanyOur client is a well established and prestigious firm, operating at the pinnacle of their industry for over 150 years. You will continue this legacy by serving as a key member of their IT team.The RoleThe role requires a multi-tasker, someone who 'stands above the rest' with a history of working in a small team within a corporate environment. On one hand you must be comfortable with the many technical aspects of the role, and on the other, you must have the interpersonal skills to communicate with the business and to mentor junior members of the team. You will be responsible for a number of IT functions throughout the business, with the work being split into approximately 60% project work, and 40% operational.Some of these responsibilities and personality traits include:The ability to deploy and maintain reliable and secure technologies supportive of the firm's goalsHaving an enthusiastic, innovative and determined outlook towards the activity at handHaving the foresight to contribute to the firm's technical strategy in a constructive and innovative mannerPossessing an unrelenting drive for self improvement and professional growthThe ability to work with minimal supervision and to have the foresight to think proactivelyKey RequirementsThe ideal candidate will be an experienced Senior Systems Engineer with 3+ years of progressively responsible experience working in technology. You will be tertiary qualified with a Computer Science degree or equivalent and ideally possess at least one mid-level industry certification (MCSE, MCITP, VCP or CCNP).Experience with the following is essential:Windows server (with multi-site AD architecture)Cluster configuration and operation (DFS and DFSR)Expert knowledge of Veeam backup solutionsSystems Center Products (SCCM/SCOM/DPM)Microsoft exchangeAdvanced knowledge of VMware, vSphere, Enterprise/vCenter Server/ESXiSignificant knowledge surrounding standard enterprise technologies (Client management infrastructures, anti-virus, anti-spyware, anti-spam, data networking, Cisco network equipment)Understanding of network security, to include firewalls (IDP and DLP)Like to know more?To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Ryan Mulholland in our Auckland office on +64 9 977 9804.Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

New Zealand is the greatest living space on Earth. DOC's purpose is conservation leadership for a prosperous New Zealand. Join us, and make a lasting difference to New Zealand's future.As one of DOC's Solution Architects you will have a unique opportunity to shape the Department's enterprise architecture and dependant systems as we move to Cloud based services. The results of your work will have a direct impact on how our staff and partners access our systems in support of conservation. The Solution Architects are a member of the Strategy and Architecture Services Team, operating within the Information Systems and Services Group. You will be a key member of the architecture practice.                        You must have multi-year, hands-on experience in architecture in a cloud environment operating as a solution architect. We expect you to be here for the long haul and grow in this role, both in terms of your domain skills, and most critically in growing your knowledge of the needs of a world leading conservation organisation. What we do is unusual, and you will need to be very willing to dig deep into our business. We will invest in you and give you opportunities to work across the Natural Resources Sector and beyond. We will occasionally give you the opportunity to get out into the backcountry to help you stay connected to DOC's mission.From a technical perspective you will need to be flexible and bring a variety of technical competencies. DOC operatesmulti-platform environment across Cloud and traditional infrastructure. Our vision is to maximise the value we get from our systems to maximise the benefit we get from every conservation dollar. As we move into the Cloud we need to evolve our working practices and help DOC achieve best value from taking up modern flexible tools in the delivery of conservation outcomes.Expect to be creative, expect to be innovative, expect a challenge!Please apply online. Applications must include a cover letter, a CV and evidence of the required capabilities as per the role description.We will consider international applicants if available for face to face interviews in Wellington, New Zealand and eligible to obtain a work visa.For more information please contact Kelly Robertson, krobertson@doc.govt.nz or telephone 027 559 9379, quoting vacancy 100/1409 and 100/1410Applications close at 5pm on Tuesday, 1 August 2017Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Ref: EB 87341 .NET Developer - intermediate - FAB ROLE, GREAT MANAGER!$80,000-$85,000 per annum range, based in Wgtn CBDTake your career to a new levelLOADS to learn, work with wide range of Microsoft technologies, great team vibe!ABOUT THE ORGANISATION Based in central city Wellington, this employing organisation is a private sector company focused on consulting to client sites in the IT software development area. They are a great place to be. That's because they are big enough to be doing interesting and challenging work in the IT field that will take your skills to a whole new level, but still small enough to provide a friendly, fun and flexible environment. ABOUT THE ROLE This is an intermediate level .NET Developer role. You will be a member of a software development team, and will report to a Lead Developer who will provide you with mentoring and guidance. You will also be liaising with the wider group of IT professionals including business analysts and testers on a range of client site projects. ABOUT THE TECHNOLOGIES The company makes use of micro-service architecture utilising WebAPIs, MVC websites, Windows Services, Elasticsearch, MS SQL and MongoDB. The work you will be involved with relates toProviding support, maintenance and new development for web and cloud based systemsMaking use of the .NET framework, ASP.NET, C#, SQL and HTMLMaking use of Agile methodology - maintaining relevant software development documentationSharing new ideas and initiatives on how pieces of work can be approached and developed.WHAT THEY ARE LOOKING FOR IN YOUR CV:A background in .net in using C#, ASP.NET, SQL and HTMLExperience of working as part of a development team in at least one or two full-time positionsA tertiary IT related qualification and if you have experience in using Bootstrap and Angular they would absolutely LOVE to hear from you! That said, these are 'nice to have', and not at all essential.However, the hands-on, full-time experience of working as a C#.NET/ASP.NET Developer is a definite 'must'. You will have the chance to work with a great team lead and smart colleagues who, like you, are in the process of growing their development career and their skills. Sound good? Then get in touch! Email your resume to me now by clicking the 'apply now' button below, or call Renee Mouton on 04 471 5868 to find out more information. If you're keen to grow your career, there's no better place to nourish it than here. We're committed to providing our people with all they need to positively thrive. So, isn't it time you put your trust in the company that's been trusted throughout New Zealand for almost 40 years?At Ravensdown, we're all here to support our customers' performance for a more prosperous nation. We're putting together a team of high energy, focused individuals with the commercial acumen and technology skills to really build on and improve our business in a new Service Delivery Team. This new team, accountable to the Technology Governance Group and led by the National Services and Technology Manager and the Chief Technology Officer, has been tasked to use world class practices and agile project principles to deliver Ravensdown's digital roadmap, and this role has been created through the introduction of this team for the BAU work and will report to the Business application manager.About the role:As a talented and experienced GIS Business Analyst, you will be well versed in the development, support and administration of GIS systems. You will be responsible for the technical support and integration of GIS and other enterprise applications, managing the data and third party relationships to ensure accurate GIS data for use for our stakeholder. You will be comfortable working in the Esri GIS and application data management area and providing a second level support for any issues that may arise. This role will allow you to assess the best technical approach for meeting functional enhancements and drive the development and change through to implementation and ensuring the solution meets the requirements of the end users.Skills and experience:To be successful in this role, you will ideally possess:Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in GISsignificant experience in administration of an ARCGIS server environmentbusiness analysis skills with experience in system specifications and designexperience in database interrogation using T-SQLproject delivery experience and managing the software development life-cyclegreat communication and relationship building skills.Benefits:So what can you expect in return? Well, you'll have plenty of autonomy, lots of interaction with local people, and stacks of opportunity to grow your career with one of New Zealand's most successful and respected co-operatives. If you think you've got what it takes to make the next step in your career with us, don't miss out on this fantastic development opportunity.How to apply:If this sounds like you, please send your CV and covering letter to Nik Sheremetov, Recruitment Consultant from Kelly Services, on nik_sheremetov@kellyservices.co.nzApplications close on Monday, 24 July 2017.Ravensdown is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace. The successful applicant will be required to undergo a pre-employment drug test.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: With approximately 19,000 employees and 5 divisions made up of more than 50 businesses operating globally, Fletcher Building rivals any large organisation in Australasia.  We have well-established business solutions utilising appropriate technology applications that are cost effective to operate and are recognised as a key enabler of delivery of the organisations objectives.  As part of Fletcher Building’s Group Technology Team, we can guarantee this is a busy and challenging role that will also offer you the opportunity to grow.About the opportunityIn this role, you will be responsible for the design, execution and reporting of testing strategies to ensure high quality applications. You will also create testing artefacts including test plans and exit reports that are clear and easy for recipients to interpret.  You’ll provide expertise in developing database queries to test and analyse application responses.  As part of Group Technology, you will collaborate with project managers, end users, vendors and other information technology professionals at all levels to ensure that testing meets agreed standards and timelines.The Senior Test Analyst will be a key member of a development team providing services to a range of Fletcher Building business units. Initially, the role will be based at PlaceMakers National Office in Marua Road, Mt. Wellington but will be moving to a newly refurbished location within Fletcher Buildings Penrose Campus. About you We value your experience and skills, but to make it here you will also need to demonstrate the qualities we value as an organisation.  Our people are passionate about performance. They put the customer first and are always thinking about innovative ways to solve business and customer needs.  Our people act with integrity, are down to earth, open and honest and always looking for ways to improve.For a Senior Test Analyst, we are also looking for:	* Proven experience using test/defect management systems including Jira and Service Now.	* A high level of technical literacy and ability to quickly understand new applications and technology.	* In-depth knowledge of testing multi-tier applications including integration, database and presentation layers.	* Knowledge and experience of systems development lifecycle and methodologies 	* Previous experience working within an Agile/Scrum environment.	* Excellent written and oral communication skills.	* Knowledge in JD Edwards (JDE)	* A bonus if you have experience with API’s, web services, performance testing, and test automation.	* ISTQB certification or equivalent.	* Proven experience working within large corporate / enterprise environments. In return we are offering you the opportunity to work with a truly innovative business with lots of future opportunities, this is a really exciting time to join our team as we are gearing up to implement some of the biggest IT changes the business has ever been through! You will be rewarded with a competitive salary and all the benefits you would expect from working for New Zealand’s largest listed company. To make it with Fletcher Building, submit your application now.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Compac leads the world in designing integrated post-harvest solutions and services to the global fresh produce industry.  We optimize every finished pack leaving our customers' facilities and ensure that every consumer can have healthy and safe produce every time with full visibility across the value chain. The company's mission is to enable its customers improve returns, gain operational efficiencies, and ensure a safe food supply via the application of smart, useable technologies. To achieve this Compac operates a number of centers of excellence, regional offices and manufacturing locations within the United States, Australasia, Europe, South America, Asia, and South Africa. Compac is a TOMRA Group Sorting Company - TOMRA Sorting offers the widest range of food sorting and peeling equipment available in the food industry today. TOMRA supplies optical sorting solutions for a multitude of food applications, for fresh and processed food, from farm to fork.The Role:Compac sorting machines use a unique electronic weighing system that is unsurpassed in its accuracy, specifically designed for high speed weighing.  Not content to sit on our laurels we want to ensure we stay at the top providing our customers with the highest precision grading solutions available.  Which is why we need you.Using your manual and automated testing skills you will be working alongside our software team to test and develop procedures for all aspects of the product. You'll be responsible for software quality as well as monitoring and reporting performance across a number of scenarios. Strong documentation skills are essential.You:You will have at least three years testing experience with experience in both manual and automated testing experience. You'll have experience in writing scripts and developing a test framework to maximise efficiency and to ensure the quality of the product.In addition your CV will demonstrate:Qualification in Software Development, Computer Science etcStrong mathematical skills and understanding of software algorithmsExperience working with hardware related product testing would be beneficialExperience with a number of automated testing toolsWhy work for us:Our people love what they do.  There is no shortage of technological challenges where you can apply your skills to real world problems.  Offering flexibility, collaboration and real opportunity to prove yourself, you'll be part of a successful and growing company where your contributions will have make visible differences to your team, the company and our customers.Apply now and tell us how you could benefit our team by sending a cover letter and CV.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: - Looking for an interesting challenge for 2017?- Proven track record selling IT solution services?- Join an award winning company with a great team“Businesses run best with Great IT” - we live by this mantra! As part of the continued growth of Kinetics Group, we are looking for another experienced Account Manager to take over and continue to grow an existing portfolio, while identifying and securing new business opportunities. This is not a quick fix sales role, we employ long term relationship builders who can understand a client’s needs and design a solution to achieve the client’s business objectives. We follow a proven sales methodology with a focus on consultative selling. This means you will be tasked with engaging customers and prospects in an advisory capacity to understand their specific needs and communicate that back to our design team. We have a highly qualified delivery team to give you the surety that promises made are kept, no matter what. Having a team like this to back you gives you the confidence to close the deal every time. It can be a pressurised environment, but we have a great team and a unique and compelling range of service products. It’s always challenging, interesting and very rewarding. For a high performer with a strong track record in B2B IT services sales, this is an amazing opportunity and comes with an attractive base salary, company car and uncapped commission.  Are you hungry, positive, energetic, persistent and outcome focused with a passion for business? With a keen interest in technology and a desire to upskill and learn all about what we do, you’ll have the ambition to consistently exceed goals. You will be a confident, well presented expert with excellent written and verbal communication skills, an active listener able to communicate with business owners and senior executives.  If you’re looking for a stable career and a move to a small, growing company that’s a little bit different and continues to win awards year after year, then come and work for us at Kinetics Group!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

We are supportive of staff and have a strong team philosophy. About your new Company: This is an organisation that is proud to be embedded in all our communities, they look after our country's world leading sporting from grassroots through to elite sport. This position will be based in the Wellington CBD and will be supporting people from the North to the South of New Zealand. About your new role: This is a Senior Desktop position that comes with the expectation that you will lead from the front, no task will be beneath you as you will be involved with the day to day end user support and be on the front line with your colleagues. With all Senior roles, you will be required to lead by example with the delivery of 1st & 2nd level support (phone, portal and on-site) for desktop PCs, laptops and other end-user devices. It is expected that you will have a high level of technical skills and knowledge from the list below that can be passed on to the people you work with. You will need to be structured and organised and not afraid to get stuck in, this role is looking for someone who is ready to stand up and deliver. As there are sites located around the country, there could be some nationwide travel required. As Senior Desktop Engineer, you will need to forge relationships with these sites and build the trust of your team. You will receive the support of a successful team and the guidance of an experienced manager. Alongside this you will receive a competitive salary and a very exciting work place. What you need to do now: If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or to find out more call 04 473 2111. Please note that it is preferred that you have submitted a CV before calling.

Compac leads the world in designing integrated post-harvest solutions and services to the global fresh produce industry.  We optimize every finished pack leaving our customers' facilities and ensure that every consumer can have healthy and safe produce every time with full visibility across the value chain.The company's mission is to enable its customers improve returns, gain operational efficiencies, and ensure a safe food supply via the application of smart, useable technologies. To achieve this Compac operates a number of centers of excellence, regional offices and manufacturing locations within the United States, Australasia, Europe, South America, Asia, and South Africa.Compac is a TOMRA Group Sorting Company - TOMRA Sorting offers the widest range of food sorting and peeling equipment available in the food industry today. TOMRA supplies optical sorting solutions for a multitude of food applications, for fresh and processed food, from farm to fork.The RoleOur award winning products are industry leading and we're looking for an experienced Software developer with a strong background in C++ development to develop leading-edge software solutions to maximise produce sorting performance for our customers. Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for a Test Analyst to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy, sell and list in our marketplace.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for smart and adaptable Test Analyst who thrives in teams.In the role you'll be:Championing all things test and working alongside other test specialists, developers, business analysts, and designers.Getting your hands dirty testing responsive web-based applications and APIs.Writing and executing manual and potentially automated tests for all aspects of the Trade Me technology set throughout the SDLC.Involved in ongoing process improvement.Figuring out with other testers and developers what is the priority to test.Peer-reviewing test plans and other work produced by test analysts in your team.Providing your thoughts and comments into the development of marketplace roadmaps.Who are you:Someone with at least a year or two worth of experience in a formal testing role.Experienced with testing web-based applications and APIs.Someone with a good understanding of testing responsive front-end applications.You have a practical understanding of agile methods or at least a willingness and passion to learn.Someone with strong analytical skills and a high level of attention to detail.Experienced with working in a fast-paced, results-oriented, web/mobile-based development environment and an understanding of what's required to get the job done.Independent - you'll be comfortable working in an autonomous environment.A person with great people skills - you're a team player who likes interacting with testers, developers and the wider Trade Me family.You have a willingness to ask questions, challenge assumptions and be challenged in return.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our Christchurch office which is growing, and we're also lucky enough to have catered lunch every two weeks.A focus on mentoring: we build you. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

If you're keen to grow your career, there's no better place to nourish it than here. We're committed to providing our people with all they need to positively thrive. column8: About UsWe are NZ based with a global view. We handle everything from ‘chip to cloud’ with our work touching millions of users around the world. A product design and development studio that handles client work from down the road and around the globe we love crafting new experiences for a digital world. This can take the form of branding & visual design, mobile apps, user experiences, high end web development and tying it all into the internet of things. In fact so nit picky that the schools still call you up when there’s an outbreak.You don’t keep score, but let’s fact it, developers create the bugs, you just find them. 12 of them. Today.Who You AreKnow how to balance finding all the bugs and realising you’ll never find them allProducts ship with bugs. It’s a fact. You’ll accept thatOrganised. Super organised. Once in a lifetime opportunity for a Junior or Intermediate software developerWork with our Guidance, Navigation and Control team to get rockets into space!Involved with: Linux | Embedded | High reliability development | C | C++This is a fantastic opportunity for a Junior or Intermediate software developer to work on the most exciting engineering project currently being undertaken in New Zealand.Excellence is the only option when it comes to launching our rockets into specific orbits. You'll be a crucial member of our Guidance, Navigation and Control team, who are responsible for the software that gets our customers' payloads exactly where they need to be. You will be challenged on a daily basis and to succeed you will need to adapt quickly and thrive under pressure to achieve tight project deadlines.Our launch date is fast approaching, and we are looking for someone who can hit the ground running when it comes to working with C, C++ and Python, and helping to continue the development of our 6DOF flight and avionics simulator. You will have a thorough, no-shortcuts approach meaning we can rely on your work to be accurate 100% of the time. You will ideally have several years' experience programming C/C++, with some real-time embedded development experience and be comfortable developing in a Linux environment.To really stand out from the other applicants you'll have prior experience working with moving vehicles such as automobiles, UAVs or rockets - although raw passion can make up for lack of practical experience here!Minimum requirementsBachelors, Masters or Ph. D in Electrical, Software or Aerospace Engineering2+ years' experience developing in C/C++, with some embedded or high-reliability development experienceThe ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlinesProven communication skills and the ability to build strong working relationshipExperience with git version controlDesirable SkillsPython, MATLABA good theoretical and/or practical of electronic systems and rigid body dynamicsExperience with flight simulator or flight software development for UAVs, Rockets or other aircraftUnderstanding of orbital mechanics and/or closed-loop control systemsExperience with OpenGLImportant InformationFor security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant.  These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations.  Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality.  For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Join our Christchurch Marketplace teamHelp support and build top-quality productsA team player - you're not afraid to pitch in and help othersTrade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with around four million members and 850,000 people visiting the site every day. Our marketplace has continued to grow and we're now looking for a Senior Test Analyst to help make it easier for Kiwis to buy, sell and list in our marketplace.The internet, New Zealand, and the world are all changing rapidly, and we have some big things to work on this year. It's a new era for Trade Me and with that comes a new way of thinking. We're looking for a smart and adaptable Senior Test Analyst who thrives in teams. You'll join our Christchurch Marketplace team to test and help support other testers in building top-quality products.In the role you'll be:Promoting innovative new initiatives within Test and the wider Technology team.Responsible for nurturing our test culture, testers, practices, and improvement, while maintaining quality products through your own testing.Mentoring and training team members within Test.Involved with and helping to lead the ongoing improvement of our test processes.Writing and executing tests for all aspects of the Trade Me technology set including the SDLC.Contributing to business and systems requirements analysis, and the design and usability of new features and functionality.Participating in determining the direction of testing strategy, tools, and  methodology.Creating and maintaining documents for technical and business rules.Helping to ensure our sites are always available and consistently beating our performance targets.Owning your work from the beginning until it's released into the wild on www.trademe.co.nz.Interacting with developers and the wider Trade Me family on a regular basis.Who are you:A Test Analyst with 4 to 5 years' experience in a formal testing role.Experienced with leading or mentoring other testers.Experienced testing web-based applications and APIs would be extremely beneficial.Someone with strong analytical skills and a high level of attention to detail.You have outstanding written and interpersonal communication skills.A team player who interacts with testers, developers, and the wider Trade Me team.You bring in new ideas, have a real passion for the web, and a willingness to go the extra mile.You've got great time management skills and can deal with change as a part of daily work life.Someone who enjoys Agile and face-paced, innovative environments.You've had exposure to and/or an interest in automation.A team player - you're not afraid to pitch in and help others.What we have to offer:These are exciting new positions that will offer you the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll get to work in our exciting Christchurch office which is growing.A focus on mentoring. We take our practices seriously and will encourage you to be part of a guild where you will grow and learn.Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: About UsWe are NZ based with a global view. Archives New Zealand, Te Rua Mahara o Te Kawanatanga sits within the Information and Knowledge Services branch, the Department's epicentre of information management, culture and heritage. Our branch is all about collecting, storing and preserving important things that are precious to New Zealand.Archives New Zealand is the official guardian of New Zealand's public record. We have developed a long-term strategy - Archives 2057. In order to achieve this vision, Archives New Zealand needs to transform and therefore we have established a Transformation programme.This programme has oversight of a number of key projects which are central to advancing us towards our 2057 vision. The Digitisation project is one of these key projects established to drive increased digitisation of high value records to facilitate increased online access.We are looking for a Team Leader Digitisation to manage the team responsible for the delivery of systematic bulk digitisation.To succeed in this role you will need to have proven experience in:logistical or operational managementsuccessfully leading people to achieve targetsdigitisation to specified standards - desirableFor this role you will be :able to motivate and drive for resultsa good communicator and relationship manageran excellent problem solver who is able to quickly understand complex information and systemsIf you thrive on a genuine challenge, and knowing that what you do, you do for the good of New Zealand, we would very much like to hear from you.Applications close: 5PM, Monday 14 August 2017For more information please contact: Antony Moss on 04 496 1392 or antony.moss@dia.govt.nz

They have a strong focus on collaboration and great team culture, with an overall company mission to achieve improved health through high performing teams and innovative community and primary healthcare.As an Application Support specialist you will have:Proven experience of implementing and/or migrating Microsoft systemsKnowledge in configuration of applicationsExperience of training and explaining technologies in simple terms to end users, at all levels in the organisationExtensive experience using SQLExperience in a large rollout of a new systemWhat we are looking for in the successful candidate:An ability to learn new systems and technologies quicklySolid customer service skillsStrong verbal and written communicationExcellent personality and can-do attitudeYou will get the opportunity to be part of a reputable and innovative organisation that gives back to the community whilst growing your own skill set.Suitable candidates must be legally able to work in NZ.To submit your application, in strict confidence, please apply online using the appropriate link below. Trade Me is New Zealand's biggest internet business, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.  Role Overview This newly-created BI developer role sits in our Analytics team, providing technical development expertise in our Business Intelligence Squad. The role will support and promote better access and use of data for operational reporting, business intelligence and advanced analytics.Just to be clear, this is a development role and not a BI role.What will you be doing?Working to design and implement best practice Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing - primarily using Microsoft's suite of products. That could mean importing data from various sources and transforming it so it's ready for reporting purposes, building new business rules into our existing data warehouse or advising others on best practice.You'll maintain accurate documentation and processes associated with the BI Platform.Quality data is important to our business, so you'll have good attention to detail and regularly QA yours and others work to help deliver accurate results.You'll enjoy collaborating with Insight Analysts to solve reporting and analytical problems alongside them.From a Team Perspective you'll work in an agile environment. So that means involved the creation, grooming and execution of our Backlog. And being involved in scoping, planning and testing the outputs of work.The key people you'll work with in this role will be the Senior BI Developer, the BI Product Manager and a growing number of Insight Analysts across the Business. But you'll also have relationships with members of our Database, Platform and Infrastructure teams.Who are you?An experienced developer in the Microsoft BI stack -  You'll be a skilled operator in the BI space, using SQL, Data Warehouse, OLAP, ETL.Having prior experience with a visualisation tool like Power BI would be a bonus.You are a passionate person with a positive attitude who enjoys collaborating other with people.You'll care about quality data, and the potential value of that data to our business.You have effective problem solving skills. You'll love solving a difficult problem.You may have been in the workforce a while, or just be starting out in your career.What we have to offer:This is an exciting position and offers the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You will work with a bunch of passionate, positive people who are all striving to make things better!Free fruit and as much good coffee you can possibly stomach in a work day.Break out areas, games, slides and office scooters.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running. Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Essentially we make data useful and make sense to our customers. We have an opportunity for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join our talented development team. You will work closely with our development, testing and systems engineering team. Developing tools to automate our processes and help improve our release process. Design and implement applications to automate the build, release and deployment activitiesWork closely with Development, QA and System Engineering to gather requirements, prototype, implement and update solutionsCreate and maintain automated unit and integration testAttend daily stand-ups and ensure effective communicationKeep abreast of current and emerging technologiesProvide regular reporting of progress to managementREQUIREMENTS:Coding experience with Java, JavaScript, Python, RubyExperience with build, release and automation using Maven, Jenkins, Grunt and NexusExperience with Git (gitlab/github), Jira ad DockerIdeally some experience participating in open source projectsExperience integrating with cloud services such as AWS, GitHub and TravisCI preferredExperience with bash shell scripting preferredExperience in configuration management preferredKnowledge and experience administering servers running Linux and Windows preferredMinimum of 2 years work experience in a commercial software environment requiredA relevant university degreeOutstanding communication and interpersonal skills are essential

Are you an analytical thinker?  Someone who cares more about finding the right answer than being right?We are looking for someone who is genuine, and ethical, with a sense of humour to join our IT team as a Data Quality Administrator. You will be someone who is looking to learn and also has the ability to share your knowledge.  You will be responsible for the administration, maintenance, access control, and support for the Real Journeys Group's business intelligence applications. This will include technologies such as database servers, application servers, application clients and other business and reporting applications. You will collaborate and communicate with end users, project stakeholders, and support partners to organise data across various business applications ensuring that data is relevant, accurate, and consistent. This is a full-time, permanent role working Monday to Friday. Ideally this role will be based in Te Anau.You will be someone who is:familiar with Microsoft Dynamics NAV and/or Dynamics CRMknowledgeable about Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, Reporting Services and Analysis Servicesable to navigate and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services cubesable to author and maintain structured reports in a report writing tool such as Microsoft SQL Server Report Builder.Your experience with the Microsoft SQL Server suite, Business Intelligence tools similar to Halo Prism, SAP Business Objects Edge, or IBM Cognos and working with Oracle Hyperion applications will set you up to succeed in this role.   If you are reliable, have an eye for detail and a curiosity for finding answers, then we would love to hear from you.  Applications close 28th July, 2017All applicants must be eligible to work in NZ.

Centrally located in the heart of the Bay of Plenty, Kawerau is renowned for its friendliness, great sense of community, wonderful climate and strong Maori heritage, and is one of New Zealand's youngest towns. Founded in 1953, the township has been well-planned, with plenty of parks and reserves and wide, tree-lined streets. Kawerau is within easy reach of lakes, beaches, forests, major cities and thermal areas and, with the Tarawera River on its doorstep, is a popular outdoor and adventure playground.Kawerau District Council has a new role that will provide leadership on all aspects of information management at Kawerau District Council. As a key member of the Corporate Services Team you will:•	Provide day to day IT services for the organisation.•	Developing information services and technology to ensure that customer needs are met. •	Ensuring the operational efficiency of the technology environment and information systems and processes.•	Development/Update of IS strategy which is aligned to Council’s technology environment.•	Provision of records management system that meets customer needs and complies the relevant legal requirementsTo be considered for this role, you will need to have:•	 A degree level IT qualification.•	A sound knowledge of IT systems and networks.•	Experience in local government (desirable, but not essential).•	Awareness of technical developments/directions in computing and communications•	Well-developed analytical and problem solving skills.This role will appeal to an experienced IT individual who wants to progress their career into a more senior role with a Council that can offer a wide range of experiences.The hours of work will be from 8.00am to 5.00pm, Monday to Friday.The Position Description and Application Forms are available from our website: www.kaweraudc.govt.nz (vacancies) or contact:Pari MaxwellChief Executive Officer’s SecretaryTelephone (07) 306 9009Email:  vacancy@kaweraudc.govt.nzduring normal office hoursApplications close 12.00 noon on Friday, 28 July 2017R B GeorgeChief Executive Officer

With a proud history of innovation and thought leadership, they are one of the world's leading designers and manufacturers of electronic controls and are making rapid headway into emerging cloud based technologies.With a strong road map planned for new systems and technologies, they're looking for a driven and self-motivated person to join them in this newly created position. As a mid-senior position in a brand new team, you'll have a genuine opportunity to influence the development of products and services, and contribute not only to a company dedicated to the bettering the quality of life, but also to new and exciting product offerings.What would I be doing?The Front End web developer will be responsible for providing technical expertise and leadership within the business, collaborating with a Cloud Architect, effectively communicating technical outcomes and providing skills in the following areas:Key tasks include:Defining and documenting requirements and specifications.Perform development activities (including design, documentation, code creation, review, communication) at an advanced level of competence.Analyse the severity, occurrence and detectability of identified risks and calculate post-mitigation residual riskVerify system/product/functional block operation and performance using a variety of modelling and simulation techniques.Create opportunities to build a sense of community across the function.Provide technical leadership in area of expertise, and help team members develop their technical knowledge and skills.Follow agreed Agile behaviours and processes, as agreed by the team and the Design department.Leverage experience to provide advice to inexperienced team members - both at a technical and managerial level.What do I need?We are looking for experienced professionals with 5 or more years of Web Development, with speciality in front end technologies. This will ideally be teamed with a Bachelor's Degree in a Technical/Engineering field. You will be well versed in current and best practice software application design and testing techniques and methodologies, and have experience in App design for web/cloud interfaces and to/from mobile devices. The Wellington Hospitality Group is looking to add a Backend Developer into our IT team. This role is required to help with the implementation of integrations between our systems. The systems are involved in the successful day to day running of individual venues and are therefore a crucial element to assist with a vision to continue growing and acquiring more venues. Every day at Vbase we host the highlights of life, delivering amazing experiences through venue management, event management and retail hospitality solutions across our diverse venue portfolio - Horncastle Arena, Hagley Oval Pavilion, Christchurch Town Hall, Air Force Museum and AMI Stadium.The business is growing and our Operations Team are now on the hunt for a newly created role to lead our Technical Services Team and take the delivery of our events to new levels.Leading from the front, you’ll manage the team and rosters, and be right in the thick of ensuring every event is set up to perfection. From concerts to conferences and all other events in between, it can be challenging and fast-paced work so we’re looking for someone with an inspiring “go get ‘em” attitude who can think on their feet under pressure.This is very much a hands-on role and you’ll be a guru in facilitating overhead rigging, lighting setups, AV, sound and IT components. With experience in a supervisory role, this will be a great match for someone, either a technician from an events, IT or electrical background that is looking to take the next step in their career. You’ll be part of the Vbase team so we need you to be able to role model our values and contribute positively to our company culture.Your sharp eye for detail and attention to promoting a safe and healthy environment will ensure our clients and guests find things exactly as they should be. No two days will be the same and it can be full on as our Technical Team is essential in the delivering of the amazing events we host.Events don’t follow a 9-5 so flexibility is key as we can often operate 24 hours, seven days a week across the different venues. This is a new and exciting challenge so, if you’re up for the challenge and keen to make your life more eventful then send us your CV along with a cover letter.Applications close on Friday, 28 July 2017.To apply for this job, please go to our job site and enter the job code 8544TM.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

The Project Manager is responsible for the successful delivery of the whole of the proposed programme of activity ("the project"), co-ordination of the various aspects of the project and management of their inter-dependencies. They have responsibility for a small team and for managing communications related to the project.Role of the project managerThe project manager is responsible for:- Planning and designing the project and proactively monitoring and reporting on its progress, resolving issues and initiating appropriate corrective action.- Ensuring effective quality assurance and the overall integrity of the programme - focusing inwardly on the internal consistency of the project, and outwardly on its Coherence with infrastructure planning, interfaces with other project and corporate, technical and specialist standards.- Managing the project budget, monitoring expenditure and costs against delivered and realised benefits as the project progresses.- Facilitating the appointment of individuals to the project team.- Ensuring there is allocation of common resources and skills within the project's component parts.- Managing third party contributions to the project.- Managing communications with all stakeholders.- Managing dependencies.- Managing risks to the project's successful outcome.Skills and attributes neededThe ideal candidate has:- Effective leadership, interpersonal and excellent communication skills.- Established relationships and contacts within the stakeholder communities that the project will interact with.- The ability to command respect and to create a sense of community among the members of the project team.- Good knowledge of techniques for planning, monitoring and controlling programmes.- Strong appreciation of programme and project management methods.- Sound knowledge of budgeting and resource allocation procedures.- An ability to find ways of solving or preempting problems.Momentum Consulting Partnering with NZUSA. Opportunity to work on the Electron Launch Vehicle projectBring your ground station and field installation experience to Rocket LabThis is a fantastic opportunity for an RF/Communications Technician to join the team at Rocket Lab and work on the most exciting engineering project currently being undertaken in New ZealandWorking within our Avionics team you will be play an important role in the design, testing and integration of radio frequency communication components used to support Rocket Lab's Electron launch vehicle.  You will be challenged on a daily basis and to succeed you will need to adapt quickly and thrive under pressure to achieve tight project deadlines.We are looking for someone who can hit the ground running so previous experience with Ground stations and field installations is vital.Essential skills required for the position of RF/Communications TechnicianAn Engineering degree or equivalent qualification on ground support equipment as radars or ground stations1+ years' experience in field installations, test and integration of RF front end systems for high reliability (aviation, aerospace systems, or satellite communications).Experience with test equipment: network and spectrum analysers.The ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.Proven communication skills and the ability to build strong working relationship.Hands on experience designing front-end RF systemsAbility to work in remote environmentsManagement of contractors to support ground stations installationAvailability to travel to remote locationsDesirable skillsA good theoretical and/or practical of electronic systems troubleshootingExperience with TTC systems, space modulations and high data-rate links.Inter-satellite communications.Important Information:For security reasons background checks will be undertaken prior to any employment offers being made to an applicant.  These checks will include nationality checks as it is a requirement of this position that you be eligible to access equipment and data regulated by the United States' International Traffic in Arms Regulations.  Under these Regulations, you may be ineligible for this role if you do not hold citizenship of Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Switzerland, the European Union or a country that is part of NATO, or if you hold ineligible dual citizenship or nationality.  For more information on these Regulations, click here http://www.pmddtc.state.gov/regulations_laws/itar.html.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

What's on offer?An opportunity has arisen within our Wellington office for you to take the next step in your career– the role on offer is a Change and Release Administrator and is a perfect opportunity for someone looking to build a career within the Change and Release functions, with long term progression opportunities being within Change and Release Management, Senior Change and Release Management and Team Leadership roles.You will report into the Change and Release Team Leader and administer changes and releases for accounts lead by Change and Release Account Managers who closely supervise their accounts. You will administer using Fujitsu's published ITIL Change and Release Management Life Cycles – put simply managing the addition, modification or removal of anything that could have an effect on IT services within contracted IT Infrastructure environments. If you're up to the task you may also be asked to be the Account Manager's backup.Key Responsibilities:•Provide an outstanding customer experience to all accounts that you administer•Manage the Change/Release Management Life Cycle through to successful completion and closure by administration of Change Management process control points•Deliver account reporting as required – Forward schedule of change, weekly/monthly reports etc •Manage the implementation of an Emergency Change process with minimal impact to business •Manage the delivery of Standard Change Process requirements for simple and effective changes•Ensure quality assurance and technical reviews are implemented on every requested change to the Customers environment•Escalate non-compliance and non-conformance to the Change and Release Management processes to your management•Ensure Customer approval is obtained and Technical Peer reviews are completed successfully and approval given to the Change Manager•Ensure the Change Management System is updated correctly and the change request's relevant documentation is attached to meet audit requirements.•Communicate clearly using appropriate communication methods to all peers, management and stakeholders as required is essential•Be open and flexible to changing accounts based on business needs and timing•Work within the wider change and release team as required.•Update work instructions and documentation as required•Provide backup for an Account change and Release ManagerWhat do we want from you?Experience:•Looking for your next step within Fujitsu and able to demonstrate a keen interest in change/release management and an understanding of ITIL frameworks•Able to produce business documents using MS Office•Able to communicate with internal and external stakeholders- both written and verbal•Good analytical and attention to detail skills•Enjoy working as part of a team and by yourself, take accountability for your own work•Proactive, innovative mind set•Attentive to detail, timeframes and deadlines is essential•Past experience in a similar role would be ideal but is by no means essential – confident, positive attitude, enthusiasm, ambition and keen interest in the subject matter will be key attributes of the successful candidate.Sounds interesting? This is a new full time role in a rapidly growing fintech business operating in the global remittance market - a market worth over $600 billion annually.We are looking for engineers to join our expanding team in our central Wellington office. You will help build new features, products and APIs for our platform and contribute towards continuously improving our current stack to help scale and support our growing customer base.About UsWe’re still a small company which means you will need to wear many hats in the beginning but it also means there are many interesting challenges ahead and areas that you can specialise in if you like.We have a flat structure which means you will work directly with everyone across the company, from customer support to compliance, product, finance. Javascript.Linux administration skills, ability to set up and maintain production and dev servers.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.
