The OrganisationAgResearch is the Crown Research Institute tasked with delivering cutting-edge agricultural science and innovation to benefit the wider New Zealand economy. Our internationally-recognised scientists work across the agricultural sectors in collaboration with a range of stakeholders both nationally and internationally, putting science and innovation at the forefront. We are a unique organisation that is driving prosperity by transforming agriculture.The RoleGenomNZ is looking for somebody to fill a pivotal role. This full-time position requires collation and management of data files needed for analysis, manipulation and cleaning of data received from clients as well as pulling information from the Genomnz database using Microsoft Access into formats useful for analysis. Database development and programming will be key components of this role. This involves liaising with laboratory and research staff in order to implement data processes for new and existing technologies.The role is also responsible for communicating with clients to acquire animal information and reporting pedigree results. You will have relevant a post graduate qualification in Computer Science or an undergraduate qualification with previous experience in software development.You will be expected to work as part of a team, be able to assign your time to a variety of tasks, have excellent time management and communication skills, be well organised and deliver work of a high standard within defined time lines.Additional InformationThis position has been identified as part of AgResearch's strategic plan to be relocated in 2019 to our Lincoln Campus into a new purpose-built science facility where we will be able to work in close collaboration with other organisations who work in the same space as us.About youDemonstrates attention to detailProven experience with computer programmingKnowledge of SQL, Microsoft Access and LinuxFamiliar with R for statistical computingExperience in the manipulation of large data sets including data analysis and data validationSkills in the management of data files are essentialKnowledge of farming systems is highly advantageousKeen interest in the commercial application of scienceBenefitsYour EverydayBeautiful campuses & great Learning and Development opportunitiesYour HealthGenerous leave provisionsYour FamilyIncome and life insurance & supportive family friendly working environmentYour ExtrasOptional 5th week annual leave, multiple retail discounts & All of Government Westpac banking discounts.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

WHAT'S ON OFFERFujitsu is a leading service provider of business, information technology and communication solutions. Throughout the region, and indeed globally, we partner with our customers to consult, design, build, operate and support business solutions. Many of the quality solutions and services we provide come from our Business and Applications Services division (BAS). BAS is basically about applications development and implementation. We provide resources for Fujitsu clients, we develop high quality "bespoke" solutions for customers, we implement other vendor's applications, and we even develop, tailor, and implement our own application products. We use a broad ranges of the latest development technologies, and have teams of Developers, Application Support staff, Business Analysts, Software Testers, and Project Managers. It's big and it's busy .... getting the picture?We currently have an opportunity for a Project Administrator within our Business and Application Services group. But we're not looking for "just any old Project Administrator". We are looking for someone who will pick up what they are asked to pick up, and look for more. We are looking for someone who can, after getting to know the place, identify process issues and recommend solutions. We are looking for someone who can develop the role into a what will become a critical part of the BAS division in New Zealand.Based in Wellington, and reporting to the Business Solutions Manager, you will initially provide project support and administration to the BAS Project Managers and assist in the billing process for all BAS services. Over time, we would look to have you take on license management tasks, project co-ordination, and also defect triage (effectively reviewing and understanding software problems customers are experiencing, and identifying the appropriate person or group within BAS to work on them and resolve.)Excited by this? Read on and see if you have the background we are looking for.WHAT DO WE NEED FROM YOU?To be successful in this role, you will need to have:•	Previous experience in Project Administration•	Previous experience of working in the large, busy environment of what we call enterprise level organisations.•	Strong financial skills - i.e. previous billing or accounting experience•	Outstanding communication skills - written and oral.•	Excellent computer skills - MS Word and MS Excel are essential, and other ERP, billing, project management and/or administration applications experience is important.•	Initiative, problem solving, organisation, accuracy and the ability to "have fun under pressure" are also very important attribute that we are looking for.•	The desire to develop your career in the projects and/or applications space (not for the faint-hearted)Does this sound like you? If you think so, and if you would like a really awesome career opportunity within one of the largest IT Services companies in the world, then we would like to hear from you. Apply today using the link provided.

column8: HQ are on the hunt for a Support/Customer Service Engineer to compliment a talented team over the next month, based in Hamilton's CBD.In order to be considered you will need to have the following:-Experience working for corporate, blue chip companies*Excellent communication skills and a professional manner with users and client contactsA professional, business approach at all timesProven desktop support experience.This role is a Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5pm position and is an immediate start and although this is only a one month assignment for now, it could easily lead to excellent future opportunities.Interviewing will take place on Saturday 8 July 2017 in central Hamilton.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Inspire Net is a technology leader, from our extensive rural wireless network, DSL and UFB services, Inspire Free Wifi and Inspire Prepay services, to over 2,000km of our own fibre optic cable network around the local region. Locally owned and operated we pride ourselves on “Real People Real Service”.Due to our continued growth, we're looking for a talented web-developer to focus on our internal web-based systems and be part of our Network Operation’s Centre. With a broad range of skills and knowledge you will be responsible for taking our external website and internal web-systems to a new level. Your excellent organisational skills will mean you can juggle multiple tasks and get the job done to a high standard within reasonable time frames. Responsibilities•	Integrate data from various back end services and databases•	Maintain and develop Inspire Net’s internal web-based systems•	Write well designed, maintainable code using best software development practices•	Create and maintain documentation on our internal systems•	Be responsible for maintaining, expanding and scaling our external website•	Work as part of the overall Network Operations Centre (NOC)•	To work with managers and staff in departments to automate mundane and repetitious tasks, freeing up staff time for more useful work•	To develop an understanding of many segregated systems and then create a plan to merge into a single user interface for staff to useRequired skills•	3-5 years’ experience developing LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) based web-systems•	Strong PHP skills along with a thorough understanding of MySQL•	Good knowledge of JavaScript and CSS•	Great problem-solving skills•	Ability to design functional and easy to use web-based systems•	Comfortable in an open source environment•	Ability to use version control, generally svn or git•	Experience in PostgreSQL•	An understanding of basic accounting practices•	Excellent communication skills•	Self-motivatedDesirable skills•	Experience with Linux based operating systems, especially Debian•	Unit/integration testing•	Experience with PHP framework, especially Symfony•	Familiar with Apache configuration•	Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks•	Networking skills – especially at layer 2 and 3•	Linux scripting skills, i.e. awk, perl, bash, php scripts. Opportunities within the Inspire Net NOC don’t arise often as team members generally move into these roles internally, after increasing their skills in other areas of the business. Essential Requirements:Applicants must be able to pass a police background check and drug screen.This is a full-time position.A competitive remuneration package will be negotiated based on your skill level.The successful applicant will be subject to a 90-day trial period.Applications close Friday 21st July 2017.Please send your application and covering letter to:careers@inspire.net.nzApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Why you`d like it - Global organization. - Growing business. - Mixture of hardware and software support. The OpportunityWith the growth of New Zealand market comes an opportunity to join this growing international business that is ready to invest into employees` development and gives them an opportunity to utilize their knowledge, skills, and abilities in providing high-quality support to company customers in New Zealand and Australia. The OrganizationThis global organization is a market leader in Point of Sale systems.  It prides itself to be a trusted provider of PoS solutions to primarily energy customers in New Zealand and Australia. Role SnapshotIn this role, you will provide complex support to the customers and distributors of company PoS solutions. Being the first point of contact for the customers, you will resolve all issues with both hardware and software. You are expected to become a subject matter expert in PoS solutions and produce high-quality technical information and reports for the company knowledge base. If required, you will create training and how-to manuals for both customers and internal stakeholders. Your Fit - You have 5 years of experience in the IT industry in client-facing service desk roles. - You have 3 years of experience in providing level 3 support covering software and hardware (ideally PoS systems). - You have supported embedded systems. -  You are an expert in troubleshooting and issue resolution in a customer focused environment. - You have excellent communication skills and are ready to work in a client facing role.  Please note that you must possess the right to live and work in New Zealand to be considered for this position.If this sounds like the right career opportunity for you, then please apply immediately.?Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Do you have experience with contact management or database administration?Would you like to work in a business that is helping those who do good, do better?Do you enjoy solving problems?Are you good at sharing your knowledge with others?Can you translate technical issues in to everyday language? And the reverse?ABOUT US:Fuzion is a well-established provider of database and website systems to non-profit sector, serving clients around the world who are working on all sorts of exciting missions to make the world a better place.Our clients span a wide spectrum of sectors
column9: political, campaigning, education, social services, professional organisations, sporting and recreational bodies, health and legal. Never a dull day!Fuzion helps these organisations communicate with their contacts, organise events, manage membership systems, run campaigns, assign volunteers and fundraise. Some users have very simple needs, others have complex ‘case management’ requirements or multi-level permissioning.A few need significant customisations which our technical team deliver, and whenever possible share these with the community of users as part of our contribution to these open source projects.Some are just starting out, others may be trying to escape the nightmare of multiple spreadsheets, or need help  migrating from other CRMs, such as Access, NationBuilder or Raiser’s Edge.Fuzion thrives on making the administration of non profit organisations more streamlined. We take pride in being transparent in our work and maintaining close communication with clients throughout the process. We have built long-lasting relationships with many of our customers.Fuzion is a small, supportive, distributed team. Our main office is in Wellington, New Zealand, with a second office in Dunedin. A number of other employees and contractors work remotely. We are family- and student-friendly, providing flexible working arrangements and offering an inclusive culture.Working in the Wellington office comes with great lunches, a chorus of native birds and no parking hassles. There is even a park across the road for throwing some disc, stretching your legs (or your dog’s) or just taking a breather with great views. Easily accessible and on several bus routes, a short way from the city centre but well beyond the bustle.We are strong supporters of open source technologies and we take pride in contributing back to the CiviCRM and Drupal communities with new extensions, fixes and helping answer questions from other users of these systems. Fuzion is a Sustaining Contributor and an Empowering Partner of CiviCRM.Not that we will want you to go, but expect to leave with many more skills than you arrived with. Our team values sharing knowledge so we are all continuously extending and broadening our knowledge bases.ABOUT YOU:Fuzion needs a new database support person to join our team! We are looking for someone who is keen to develop and build on their database system experience, and utilise those skills for non-profit clients.Typical projects will involve:Supporting clients with CiviCRM implementation requirementsConfiguring systems and training clients in using themAnalysing requirements and developing appropriate solutionsData migration/imports into CiviCRM from a range of other systemsTroubleshooting and problem solvingWebform construction, report building, communications advice.Key skills for this role are:Database knowledge: Experience with CiviCRM, Access, Raiser’s Edge, NationBuilder or other contact  databasesData cleansing: Familiarity with spreadsheet formula and/or data cleansing tools and techniquesCommunication: Ability to communicate clearly with both clients and technical teamInterpretation: Ability to interpret clients’ concerns and translate these into clear technical requirementsSQL knowledge: Confidence using sql queriesAdditional skills or general experience we would consider useful:Experience using a CMS (eg. Drupal, WordPress, etc)Relevant paid or voluntary role with a non-profit organisation (eg. fundraising, membership management, event planning, communications and marketing strategy and/or implementation)Training and presentation skills (screencasts, webinars etc)Project analysis or management experienceSocial media strategies for campaign workFamiliarity with accounting systems (eg. Xero/MYOB) and conceptsIT skills: familiarity with shell access, command line, git or similar tools Location: Wellington or Dunedin, New Zealand. Remote work is a possibility for an exceptional applicant.Hours and Pay: We can be flexible (and hope you can be too). This role could be full-time or part-time with a minimum of 20 hours per week, and will consider applicants whose availability may need to fluctuate. Pay will be decided based on experience and ability to learn quickly, and is expected to be in the $40-65,000 range.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

column8: Pure Agile/Peer Programming environmentEnterprise web/open source technology focusExceptional work environment offering team, collaboration and innovationWhat's in it for me?Our unique Christchurch based client are the bright sparks behind the development of one of Europe's leading online advertising marketplaces. Every day they serve millions of ad impressions to internet users from all walks of life dotted right across Europe and are well respected both as a global business and locally as an employer of choice. With a large team of highly skilled professionals, renowned for their team culture, level of engagement and commitment to evolving software development methodologies, working at the cutting edge of Agile Development, this is the place to be to develop your enterprise Java skills. With regular social events, Friday drinks, personal project time and generally just a great workplace, this is a Junior Developer role not quite like any other!What would I be doing?As a Junior Java Developer you will be developing using enterprise Java technologies (web) alongside a suite of Open Source technologies to deliver a large and complex web solution teamed with complex analytics. We are seeking an enthusiastic, technically minded Java Developer whose real passion is to get under the hood, and work out how and why things work in the world of web, and how they could be improved. You will need to be very comfortable working with open source technologies and enjoy getting elbows deep with web technologies, front and backend. You will also be excited by the opportunity for team collaboration and personal development that peer programming brings.What do I need?To be successful in this role you will need up to 2 years software development or testing experience in an innovative Java Development setting, ideally with a strong web/open source focus.Experience or an active interest in Agile development methodologies and peer programming are a must.With a proud history in the Christchurch market, our client attracts and keeps the very best Software & Test Engineers. Encouraging growth, development, and above all constant questioning and improvement of how and what they develop, you'll be playing a very key role in how their core technologies should evolve.What do I do now?Apply using the Apply button on this pageWho are we?Sourced is a specialist IT Recruitment Agency primarily focused on permanent & contract positions within the Christchurch IT market.Jobseekers come back to us time after time as we look out for them and provide sound, unbiased guidance throughout their careers. Our clients keep coming back because we do what we say we'll do, working to genuinely understand their business, their culture and their unique dynamic. Keep up to date with all that is happening in your local IT and Technology market by registering with us now at www.sourced.kiwiOverseas and New Zealand bound?We work with candidates from all over the globe, every day. If you have made your decision to move to New Zealand and your plans are firmly underway, please get in touch by registering with us.  We have clients who are sourcing specialised IT disciplines and are ready and willing to talk to you.SK048ZApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Microsoft Inner Circle status for Microsoft DynamicsWork on exciting projects and deliver top service to a range of our clients!Health Insurance - Cell phone allowance - Professional development pathwaysWe are looking for superb CRM Developers to work closely with clients to design and develop solutions within Dynamics CRM which suit their requirementsWho are we?Citizenship at Intergen is about being engaged, contributing, and receiving
column9: Intergen represents an exceptionally talented group of people that deliver leading edge solutions to clients. We are utterly passionate about this, and we are equally convinced that Intergen is an incredibly rewarding environment to work in.We are known for having exciting projects and a fresh, fun and vibrant culture. We have a number of MVPs working for us around the world and we lead in delivering cutting edge solutions for Microsoft and many other high profile clients - It's a great time to come on board!The JobYou will be tasked with working closely with clients to understand their business processes and key objectives so that you can design and develop solutions within Dynamics CRM which suit their requirements. You will also provide integration development to external systems and web services and support services for systems we have deployed. As a core member of the Dynamics Solutions team, you'll be contributing to the design and implementation of CRM development best practices. Use your fantastic interpersonal and communication skills to advise and consult on detailed technical integration approaches. Your job will be based in Auckland, New Zealand, also known as the biggest city and business hub of NZ, with loads of bars, restaurants, and beaches!The FitTo fit in with us you will need passion! You'll also need to be highly motivated and client focused. Intergen has a vibrant culture and aims to get the best out of its people so if you like striving to new heights and working with the latest CRM solutions then you'll slot right in.The ExperienceYou will have a great understanding of the Microsoft technology stack, you'll understand the ins and outs of .net development and know how to apply it to Dynamics CRM. You will ideally have commercial experience in installation, configuration, and development of Dynamics CRM. Your confidence working directly with clients, and aptitude for gaining a thorough understanding of their vision will be huge strengths. The BenefitsAside from offering a great job in a fantastic city with a talented team, we offer

column8: Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.We're currently on the hunt for a talented intermediate level test analyst to be part of our Advertising team. You'll assist us in delivering top-quality products and enhancements to the site and our quick-fire development environment will have you contributing towards things within a few days of your arrival.In this role you'll:Champion all things test and work alongside other test specialists, developers, business analysts and designers.Get your hands dirty testing responsive web-based applications and APIs.Write and execute manual and potentially automated tests for all aspects of the Trade Me technology set throughout the SDLC.Be involved in ongoing process improvement.Figure out with other testers and developers what is the priority to test.Peer review test plans and other work produced by test analysts in your team.Provide thought and comment into the development of product roadmaps.Our ideal candidate has:At least a year or two worth of experience in a formal testing role.Experience testing web-based applications and APIs.A good understanding of testing responsive front-end applications.A practical understanding of agile methods or at least a willingness and passion to learn.Strong analytical skills and a high level of attention to detail.Experience working in a fast-paced, results-oriented, web/mobile-based development environment and an understanding of what's required to get the job done.Independance - you'll be comfortable working in an autonomous environment.Great people skills - you're a team player who likes interacting with testers, developers and the wider Trade Me family.A willingness to ask questions, challenge assumptions and be challenged in return.What we have to offer:This is an exciting position that offers the opportunity to really make an impact while carving out your own space.You'll be working with the latest development languages, for example Angular.You'll work with a bunch of passionate and positive people who are all striving to make things better.Free fruit and as much good coffee as you can possibly stomach in a work day.Break out areas and games.Trade Me is a fun, vibrant and fast-moving place to work. We're looking for someone who'll thrive in this environment. We operate a dynamic and unique office culture, intended to reflect and empower our values and our "informal but serious" work ethic.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We are also proud to have been recognised as a finalist in IBM Kenexa Best Workplaces Award for the last seven years running.Check out what it's like to work at Trade Me in our video and drop us a line.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

We're looking for a great UI designer, with an eye for detail, to work on interesting and complex platforms. As part of a small design and UX team you'll help then continue to create a beautiful user-centred experience for hundreds of thousands of users across mobile and web applications.What we need from you:You will be reporting to the creative director and will be responsible for highly usable and intuitive interface creation. Any concept you create will be brand-consistent across all mobile experiences that our company provides to end users. Develop intuitive, usable, and engaging interactions and visual designs for mobile.Provide strategic thinking and leadership.Collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout the design processParticipate in the development process from definition, through design, build, test, release, and maintenance.Stay abreast of UX trends and look for creative ideas and inspiration in parallel analogous worlds.Research and track advancements in mobile application design patterns.Break any design problem down into viable actionable chunks and solve them with clarity and precision.Staying in the loop and on top of the latest standards, changes, trends in the mobile design field.What you will get from them: Direct involvement with a smart group of pure digital clientsWorking in a friendly design studio with a focused but relaxed cultureSane working hours, great coffee and snacksThe role is based in central Wellington.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

WHAT’S ON OFFER?24x7 Server Support Team – 4 days on, 4 days off!Are you ready for a change, variety and a step up? How about an opportunity with one of the global leaders in IT services?We currently have an opportunity for an associate level Wintel engineer to join our Wellington based 24/7 support team.  In this role you will provide remote management and support of predominantly Windows server infrastructure across a range of Enterprise-level clients – including resolution of incidents, systems monitoring and performing scheduled processes.Using a sophisticated call management system, you will ensure issues are dealt with promptly, within agreed service levels, and with a professionalism that demands that operational and delivery standards are met.In this role you will be on a roster system with shifts of 7am-7pm, and 7pm-7am, so the ability to cover these hours is imperative. The bonus is that after you work 4 days in a row, you will then have a 4 day weekend!This role would be ideally suited to someone who has seen the inside of a large organisation built on the Microsoft Infrastructure, and has experienced enough L1 & L2 Helpdesk scenarios to understand the bigger picture, and the implications of an operational failure at Server level. WHAT DO WE WANT FROM YOU?•2+ years experience in an IT support role•Windows skill set desirable: Server 2010/2012, AD & Exchange•Microsoft qualifications and qualifications in VMware and/or Citrix highly desirable•An understanding of core ITIL Service Delivery and Service Management•Experience using common IT Service Desk and Operational Management tools and processes to deliver IT support services (SCCM, SCOM, etc.)•Advanced analytical and problem solving skills•Excellent communication skills with a strong customer service orientation•Proven ability to work well in a teamIf this sounds like you please apply today using the link provided!

Due to ongoing growth and innovation within the organisation, Ryman Healthcare is currently seeking pragmatic and business focused .net Developers to join our Software development team.You will be working on myRyman, a new in-house developed application built utilising Microsoft's Universal Windows Platform. MyRyman targets touch-enabled tablet devices and will be in every one of our resident care rooms. It is a game changer in the Healthcare Industry and will allow our villages to become paperless. All information for residents and staff will be available in one place at one time, freeing up staff to spend more time with residents.You will be an experienced .net Developer with a real focus on user experience. You will have a proven ability to deliver high quality work to deadlines, and be comfortable working with both front-end and back-end technologies. We are looking for Developers at Junior, Intermediate and Senior levels.In order to succeed in this role, you will need to be dedicated, a great problem solver, and a team player. You will  thrive in a fast- paced busy environment, be comfortable working on rapidly changing and evolving projects and face challenges with an optimistic, solution focused attitude.Listed in the NZX Top 5, we are one of the most successful and fastest growing companies in NZ.  Employing 4000+ staff across healthcare, construction and corporate fields in both NZ and Melbourne, the Ryman Group is diverse and our daily work is varied and interesting. We have a 'grow our own' philosophy, invest in developing our people and promote a culture of kindness!Joining the Ryman team could be your best career move yet…The following technical experience would be advantageous:Microsoft .net FrameworkC#ASP.net MVCLINQMicrosoft SQL Server (T-SQL)Universal Windows PlatformVisual Studio Team ServicesApplicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Kaikoura, North CanterburyAn exciting and challenging opportunity based in beautiful Kaikoura has arisen for a motivated individual to make a real impact in Information Technology and GIS. Reporting to the Manager of Information Technology at the Hurunui District Council, you will be a Tier 1/2 IT or GIS Generalist.The Kaikoura District Council's IT and GIS operations is part of a Shared Services initiative with Hurunui and Mackenzie District Councils that combine their resources for efficiencies.Your workplace will be in a spectacular district nestled between the mountains and the sea, without any of the hassles of a big city. Formal qualifications are not required but you must have experience working within a Microsoft environment, and if you have GIS skills that would be a plus.Initiative, customer focus and a desire to learn in this "hands on" role are a must.If you are looking to start or elevate your career in Information Technology, then this is the opportunity you have been waiting for.For the job description and to apply go to our careers website http://hurunui.currentjobs.co.nz. Enquiries to scott.linton@hurunui.govt.nz phone 03 314 0104. Applications close Wednesday 2 August 2017.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

IT Service Desk Analyst Farmlands is the largest farmer owned co-operative in the country, found at over 80 locations nationwide and a top 20 New Zealand company.Did you also know we have one of the largest IT teams in Christchurch? Our Technology team are responsible for the support, and delivery of information technology right across the country.  We're looking for an experienced Service Desk Analyst to join an outstanding team, to help our customers get the most from our systems, and technology. Not all Service Desks are created equal, so things to note are: Our customers are also our teammates, so we need to put them at the heart of what we do.Farmlands has diverse technology, so our support requirements have wide span and scopeWe encourage ownership, and empower our people to make decisions and solve problemsContinual learning and growth makes us better at what we do The role is based in our open-plan office, where we sit alongside many of our internal customers.This presents a fantastic opportunity to build relationships, and work alongside those people we support. It's an exciting time to join Farmlands. We're looking for talented people who are ready to take their career to the next level, are eager to learn and will never be satisfied with just ok. Farmlands is a fast growing, agile company and people are an integral part of what we do. We invest in the best - our people, safety, training and development.Everyone who works here can make a difference to our shareholders and we are focused on creating a working environment that allows them to do exactly that, every day. We're looking for someone with that perfect blend of technical know-how and exceptional customer service and communication skills.  Let us know how you're the ideal person for this role by submitting your application today.  For more information, contact Sarah Meakin, Recruitment Advisor on 03 344 3740.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Rennacs Limited specialise in research / development and sales of exciting unique automotive electronic equipment to corporate customers such as NZAA, Australian AA, Vehicle Inspections NZ (VINZ), Z Energy, Caltex, plus trade and retail customers worldwide. Our mission is to make a difference in the world by providing "Sustainable Vehicle Technologies". We are currently focused on adding more Hybrid and Electric vehicles to our diagnostic scan tool coverage.  We are looking for a versatile, energetic, motivated person willing to pay significant attention to detail and go the extra mile to get things done well and on time. Based in Hamilton, the main purposes of this full-time role are to: 1. use our in house tools to reverse engineer vehicle diagnostic protocols on a range or vehicles, especially hybrid and electric cars. 2, research / develop and test these new vehicle protocols on the bench and on cars. Also fix and improve any issues with our existing vehicle communication protocols as required. 3. ideally change and improve our current firmware (for PIC processor) as neededThis role requires someone with:strong knowledge of C# and ideally C++. Ideally you will also have some network protocol knowledge so that you more easily understand vehicle protocol packet structures. An interest in cars (particularly hybrid and electric cars) would also be a significant advantage. As this role is fairly unique, experience directly in vehicle protocols is not required, and training manuals and support will be given.   We are expecting this role should last some where between 3 to 6 months depending on the number of hours worked per week and the complexities of the tasks and capability of the person. Role can definitely be extended if mutually agreed for the right person if company conditions warrant it.   Our business is located on Heaphy Terrace, Hamilton. This is a great opportunity to use your skills, gain valuable work experience and to get a reference for your CV. Could also lead to a full time role for the right person if the company requires it.If you have got great software engineering skills, and want to make a difference in the world to help reduce vehicle induced climate change, then please join us now!Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Archives New Zealand, Te Rua Mahara o Te Kawanatanga sits within the Information and Knowledge Services branch, the Department's epicentre of information management, culture and heritage. Our branch is all about collecting, storing and preserving important things that are precious to New Zealand.Archives New Zealand is the official guardian of New Zealand's public record. We have developed a long-term strategy - Archives 2057. In order to achieve this vision, Archives New Zealand needs to transform and therefore we have established a Transformation programme.This programme has oversight of a number of key projects which are central to advancing us towards our 2057 vision.We are looking for an experienced "can-do" Programme Co-ordinator to support the Director Transformation to deliver this programme successfully.To succeed in this role you will need to have proven experience in:schedule management and co-ordinationmanagement of project finance and budgetingproducing project or programme documents and artefactsrisk and issue managementFor this role you will be :an excellent administratorgreat at building effective working relationshipsan excellent relationship managerdetailed focussedIf you thrive on working on a wide range of projects, a genuine challenge, and knowing that what you do, you do for the good of New Zealand, we would very much like to hear from you.Applications close: 5PM, Monday 31 July 2017For more information please contact: Antony Moss on 04 496 1392 or antony.moss@dia.govt.nz

column8: Revive Communications Ltd is an Auckland based company seeking for  skilled fibre technician to join our growing operations within the Auckland region and surrounding areas to help in all aspects of the ultrafast broadband network, including but not limited to:Please note: To apply for this role you, MUST have a minimum of 6 months experience in UFB industry.MUST have completed all mandatory training to work on field.Job Requirements:  Relevant tertiary qualification. Comfortable working at heights Physically fit for trenching and concrete cutting. Must have knowledge of drain laying, Asphalting, Reinstatement, Trenching Ability to communicate technical data with Project Managers and Site Supervisors  Experience in civil works Installing Aerial and underground cables Running conduit Experience with SDU and ROW Experience of the UFB rollout Knowledge of underground service location. We’re looking for amazing people to join about 100 awesome test analysts, designers, developers and product owners in the Powershop delivery team. You’ll help to grow our software platform that powers energy providers in New Zealand, Australia and Europe, and gets rave reviews from customers.You are a test analyst that has worked in software delivery before. Agile experience is a bonus. You have built up subject matter expertise in your previous roles that has made you really valuable to the delivery teams you work with. You care about edge cases and care most that your team know they can rely on you to get them to their goals.Over time with us you will grow to be a business expert with the knowledge to support our business and the delivery process. You may spend time on the front line with incident triage and you will enable your delivery team to analyse, solve, deliver and test business problems. You will become a conduit of information between developers and the business. You’ll enable productive relationships between them and communicate the business impact of each release. You will be the go-to person when your team or the business wants to know stuff!Test skills are awesome but we like to aim for a little more!  The people we value the most are the ones who collaborate and spread what they know and believe. They have amazing working relationships and can share ideas with non-technical and technical people alike. We work at Powershop so that we can can hang out with these people cause it’s fun and rewarding.Our people care deeply about the work they do and the people they work with. They can back up opinions with evidence and reason, and still listen to others with an open mind. Most importantly they can treat others gracefully and know when it’s better for their team if they compromise.It really comes down to: do you want to be part of an awesome team where you deliver great results and build each other up? Do you want to work with passionate and real business owners while you build a global platform? Is a decent pay packet what you expect right now and not something you have to fight for?If so, then read on.WHAT DO WE HAVE FOR YOU?This is a role that’ll stretch your abilities, working with super-smart people, testing a product in a complex domain. We bring business problems to the delivery teams and they work out the right solutions, pitch them to business, craft the architecture, and implement them. This role provides subject matter expertise to the team, helps define the right solution and provides the testing awesomeness - all while helping everyone on your team to be totally awesome. There's a lot to do in the next two years, and we could use your help.ABOUT OUR DELIVERY TEAM, COMPRESSED:Scrum with two week sprints.Small multidisciplinary teams with integrated test, development, product and design.Business stories solved by delivery teams.Positive, mandatory code quality reviews.Automated regression testing.10% of your time to work on non-business projects.Family-friendly, no crazy hours, no unrealistic deadlines, no unnecessary meetings.Everyone on one floor together.Speak your mind and your peers listen.Consistent culture from CEO downAwesome CTODedicated training timeHOW TO APPLYWe have a pretty high bar so there’s a bit to do. Expect a few testing challenges, an interview or two, and to spend some time with our teams. Let us know about your experience and what you’d bring to Powershop at devteamjobs+testers@powershop.co.nz

Trade Me is one of New Zealand's busiest web platforms, with over 850,000 people (on average) visiting our sites and apps every day.We're currently on the hunt for a friendly Corporate Support Technician to provide first and second-level IT support to Trade Me's corporate environment. You'll be helping to look after 570ish staff across our three offices, supporting a mixture of devices including Windows, OSX, iOS and Android. We need an IT superstar who lives and breathes technology, demonstrates a true desire to learn, and can deliver exceptional customer service to our people.In this role you'll be:Working in a team of four, reporting into our Corporate Support Team Leader.Providing a high level of customer service, ensuring you always do so with a smile on your face.Proactively resolving issues that are perhaps not always logged in our system.Familiar with the G Suite product set.Building and setting up desktops and laptops using scripted builds via SCCM and other IT hardware.Creating and removing user accounts as well as resetting passwords for accounts that are locked out using AD.Providing hardware and software support.Providing support for our Shoretel phone system.A go-to person for video conferencing support when it comes to hardware, Hangouts and Skype for Business.Supporting all mobile devices so knowledge of Android, iOS, OSX and Windows is important.Assisting with desk and office moves and recabling of PCs, laptops and phones.Be involved in the provisioning of IT hardware.Involved in various IT process improvement projects for the Corporate Support team.Mucking in and solving problems with the rest of the team.Be able to prioritise your work.You will have:At least 3 to 4 years' experience in a similar customer-facing IT support role.Strong knowledge and experience with level one and level two support, with a previous focus on desktop, mobile and end-user support.A basic understanding of  networking concepts (DHCP, DNS etc.).Experience with Microsoft Desktop operating systems, and any knowledge of Macs would be awesome.The ability to demonstrate common sense when it comes to troubleshooting problems, as well as making smart decisions.A real empathy to understand a users problem.A real focus on delivering quality

Babcock International is a FTSE 100 company that employs 35,000 skilled staff worldwide delivering 125 years of market-leading excellence in the management, support and operation of complex equipment and infrastructure. We work with international navies, airports, the emergency services and the aviation industry and provide and manage essential infrastructure in power and communications.Based in Devonport, Babcock (NZ) Ltd operates within the Global Growth & Operations Division of Babcock International, supporting the NZ Defence Force (NZDF) and commercial shipping industry with the provision of engineering, technical and training services. Our engineering and marine capabilities make us the partner of choice for some of the most innovative marine businesses world-wide.About the role: In this position you will be Babcock IS Regional contact for maintenance, support and implementation of desktop environments at a second line level. This will include fault fix, answering calls, asset management of equipment and fulfilling requests as part of a wider Desktop support team across Babcock International Group.Babcock operates in a secure network environment, and in order to maintain that integrity, this role works to agreed Service Level Agreements, KPIs and best practice relating to IT assets.About you: It goes without saying that customer service is really important to you. You'll have some experience working in a service delivery environment, with strong knowledge of IT support, and the ability to problem solve complex technical issues. As a key local contact for other IT professionals globally, your written and verbal communication skills will be exceptional. You'll enjoy working as part of a remote team and collaborating together to achieve robust, logical solutions for the business. Babcock's offices are located within the Royal NZ Navy's Naval Base on Auckland's North Shore. This picturesque location is ideally positioned for anyone who may wish to use the Devonport or Stanley Bay ferry. I have an exclusive 6 month contract (Large possibility of multiple extensions) opportunity for a Data Architect with a large enterprise client of ours.  This project needs a Data Architect to be able to assist with the following: 1.  The organisation is in the process of implementing a new Information Governance framework including: a.   Establishing processes for data/information governance and stewardshipb.   Implementing consistent processes for managing information & datac.   Creating a knowledge base of existing data/information assets ensure there is a common understanding of data/information across the business. The Data Architect will take the lead in reverse engineering existing data assets, building data models and other artefacts for the new Knowledge base, as well as providing assistance as required for other performing items (a) & (b) above. 2.   Assisting the clients Data Standards & Integration Specialist, working with data architects across government agencies and others to build NZ customised version of an industry Framework  - XML schema based data model and system interoperability standard which needs to be customised to fit requirements of the sector. The Data Architect will take part in GAP analysis of industry standard for across the sector, providing data models of proposed amendments to fill those gaps, and work with the Australian sector community to build NZ customisation of the Australian model

column8: FiberNation is an NZ based Company contracted to Chorus Fibre. We are seeking an outstanding and motivated Technician to join our team in Dunedin, New Zealand.  The successful Candidate is required to start urgently and will ideally have all the mandatory Chorus training completed including the WTC1, WTC3, STMS, Fiber Ready, STMS etc. or should be able to demonstrate that these training requirements can be readily satisfied. Position responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Health and Safety should be your priority on daily and ongoing basis.Be able to successfully complete all the Tasks including OSB (Outside Boundary work)Understanding of Key Network Elements such as handling of FATs, FFPs and Flash9s.Should be able to comfortably work with Flash 9 Trays, FAT in-Ground, FAT - Ariel, FFP and Cabinets. Should be able to identify SC trays and counting and labelling Trays correctly.Should be able to comfortably know Fibre Flexibility point, network elements used for managing fibre. Operate highly specialised Test and Fibre optic Splicing equipment. Planning, Designing, Developing and support ICT Network Infrastructure.Determine work areas, cabling layout using networking skills, connection of Telecommunication and Broadband equipment.Splicing, Termination work, Troubleshooting and Repairing of Cables if require.Installing Routers, Switches, ADSL and VDSL Modems and their configurations.Fibre blowing using Hi Tech Fibre Blow Guns for various distances. Install the Fibre Optic Telecommunication cable distribution system by using Drawings and specifications for Telephone and Computer Transmission Network.Working at commercial and Residential sites at various locations. Liaison with VisionStream and Chorus team members, other contractors and vendors and other resources to fulfil technical requirement for the job. Mounting, Installation of FTP (Fibre Termination Point), ONT and connecting to FAT Cabinet. Maintain Chorus standards and network performance.Should be able to work independently and without supervision.  Along with above technical skills, we would also look for :  Valid and full Driver’s licence.•Preferably from IT, Electronics or/and Telecommunications background.•Good Customer service skills.•Should have valid NZ Work Visa or NZ Residency.   In return you will get: •Excellent team environment. •Competitive Remuneration•Great Team support•Work Vehicle and Tools•Ongoing training  Send your Resume / CV to Prashant.Shastri@Hotmail.com Please only apply if you willing to work in Dunedin and can start at short notice. Although all the applications will be given fair consideration however only shortlisted Candidates will be contacted. Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

Large IT EnvironmentCity LocationImmediate Start!This large organisation are looking for an experience Linux Administrator for a 6 month contract.  Your new company This well-established large organisation are looking for an experienced Linux administrator to join their team for a 6 month contract.  Your new role Reporting to the Unix Team Manager, this role will include the administration, implementation and delivery of services in a Linux environment and ensuring all systems and applications adhere to SLA's.  Key Responsibilities include, but not limited to:Automating the management of the server and application infrastructureEnsuring the functionality meets requirements, that new systems integrate to the existing network and can be deployed with minimal disruption, and participate in the full development life cycleBuild, test and implement suitable Linux server infrastructure (physical and/or virtual) to deliver applicationsAble to provide technical support and related documentation to internal standards, pertaining to the development, implementation, maintenance and recovery of the Linux server infrastructure.Maintain, monitor and enhance the Linux server infrastructure, including storage utilisation, security permissions, patch remediation, performance monitoring, backups and recovery, service packs and operating system upgrades.  What you'll need to succeed To be successful for this role you will have over 5 years experience in a Linux Administrator role or similar. Few years experience in software will also be advantageous along with a RedHat certification or equivalent qualification.  You would have strong technical background in Linux by working with RedHat Linux (enterprise), Unbuntu, MySQL, Nagios, IronPort, Puppet and RedHat Satellite.  As a contractor, your strong Linux background will see you succeed, along with your flexibility, high attention to detail, problem solving and a proactive attitude.  What you'll get in return In return, you will be working with a large reputable organisation in a results driven team and culture. A great hourly rate and possible chance of extension.  What you need to do now If you're interested in this role and are eligible to work in New Zealand, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV or for a confidential discussion call Jay Bhana +64 9 3779244.  **Please note only those who are currently eligible to work in New Zealand will be considered. Due to the urgency of the role, only those who are immediately available for interview/start will be considered**Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.
